story:
WHAT IT IS 

For many recovering addicts it’s in rehab they discover there are often musical triggers to their abuse, (the songs associated with using) and then they have to learn how to avoid those triggers that are essentially the soundtrack to their addiction. We’re hoping through Indiegogo we can raise the money we need to produce an album and also get started developing a website to help recovering addicts begin their own Soundtrax 2 Recovery: A collection of songs to help heal and bring hope to the recovering addict.
Last year, some addiction recovery sponsors found out that John Batdorf and I were working on a project with the working title of 12 songs for 12 steps and asked if we'd do a concert for several recovering addicts. Turns out it was about 700 addicts and their families who attended. The concert gave John and I a chance to see if our songs made a difference with the audience. We were overwhelmed with the feedback we got that evening. The show received a tremendous response, people waiting in line for nearly an hour to thank us, and after receiving several hand written notes from addicts at the show saying "please hurry and get these songs recorded” we realized that the need was great and the urgency even greater.
John and I are singer/songwriters with a passion to let the power of music help people trying to change. We’ve been wearing out our lives the last forty plus years as professional songwriters hoping to make a difference. Although we understand we're not the only guys who have songs that could help, we want to get the ball rolling. We've got an entire album of songs written and ready to be recorded.
When the album is completed we're planning to get a website set up that we’re calling SoundTrax2Recovery where we can eventually provide a sort of "clearing house" for songs that help and inspire people trying to overcome their addictions. Doing the album is the first step in realizing our goal. 

            WHY US?

One of the reasons we are passionate about doing this project is because it’s hit very close to home. In each of our families we’ve seen the devastation that comes from addiction, in any of its forms. We’ve worked our entire professional careers in a business where all too often substance abuse, drugs and alcohol, and any other form of addiction has destroyed lives. We’re not trained therapists, we don’t have degrees in social work, but we know what we’ve seen and we want to do what we can. Writing songs aimed at penetrating hearts is something we can do. And getting these songs recorded and made available for those who need them most is more important to us than simply searching for yet another way to climb up the music charts

          WHY HURRY?

Somewhere at this very moment there’s an addict trying to hold on a few more hours until his next AA meeting, or her next appointment with a sponsor, and it feels like aneternity. If we hurry we might be able to offer a little help, even when we can’t physically be there for them. You might be thinking, “come on, it’s only a song”. But it’s more than that. If someone somewhere can hear a song tell them the truth the only way their heart will hear it, maybe then they’ll know, deep down, they’re not alone.

story:
We need your help to record our debut album! Why? Recording a professional album takes LOTS of MONEY, MONEY that we DON'T have! This campaign is created so that YOU can help us produce our first album collectively. This way we can release our album by April 2013! This oppurtunity is something special to all of us!

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT US...

The John Sung Band is an international folk, indie-pop band formed in Manila, Philippines. The group is composed of John Sung (vocals, guitar, piano), Samuel Sung (keyboard, piano, synthesizer, programing and backing vocals), and Steven Chase (drums & percussion). The group's music is described as folk infused pop music with elements of rock and dance.

After concluding his studies in California, John Sung returned to Manila and founded the band on September 25, 2012.

So far they have played alongside acts like Rivermaya, The Walkie Talkies, Jullianne Tarroja, Robin Nievera, Jensen Gomez, and have been featured guests on Jam 88.3 (Philippine Radio Station). They're single, "The Sinker" has been currently playing on Monster RX 93.1 for the past 3 months. They hope to leave a mark in the local music scene and on the world stage. We've played for Valentines Day at Bellevue Hotel and even performed for the American Eagle Fashion Show Launch Party at High Street in The Fort, hosted by Shay Mitchell of "Pretty Little Liars".

Come and check out our music! :)

http://www.facebook.com/johnsungband

http://www.reverbnation.com/johnsungband

http://www.youtube.com/johnsungband

http://www.twitter.com/johnsungband

WANNA HELP US OUT???

The Cost Breakdown:

$8,000. Yes, you read it correct. 8,000 USD. This large sum of money will ALL go to funding the album such as 100 studio hours, 50 mixing hours, 10 mastering hours, and 8 sessionist (musician) hours. Total of 168 hours of labor.

$6,000 This will cover our travel expenses to Los Angeles, California. There we will be able to work with our producer, Timothy Hilliard, at his studio (Revolution Sounds). He has previously produced the JSB singles: "Mr. No Regrets" & "Lost (Young)".

https://www.facebook.com/revolutionsoundla

$1,000 for CD's to be printed and packaged!

All in all, we are asking for $15,000! I know this seems alot but this is really the only way of creating a quality album that we are proud to share with you and the rest of the humanity. So we need your direct support make this album possible!!!!

Help us make an album that can win recognition, sell millions of copies around the world and be a worldwide hit! Hurrah!

YOU KNOW YOU WANT TO!!!

Donations of any sum of money. $1-15,000.

Spread the word online and from person to person. A fun personal message to someone can do wonders!  Tell your friends and family why you're excited about this project  Let your excitement spread like wildfire!

Your Feedback. Please let us know if there's anything we've missed or anything you would like to see in this campaign like extra incentives or up-to-date news.

You can even help by purchasing any three singles of John Sung's self-titled EP TODAY on Itunes where the money will go straight back into this album.

Here's the link:
https://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/john-sung/id...

CHECKOUT THE REWARDS/INCENTIVES

There are different perks for specific sums of donations! Take a look to the right and check them out!

Exclusive Perks of Donating $1,000 dollars: owning artwork drawn by John.

If Underfunded...  Two things happen.

  • Indiegogo will take a 9% cut instead of 4% yikes!
  • The album release will be delayed. Everyone who donated will still receive their rewards. However the projected delivery dates will be moved back to a later date.

If Overfunded...

  • reach $16,000-  We will record an additional song to be included onto the album
  • reach $17,000-  We will film a Music Video of the song of your choice based on a poll.
  • reach $20,000 or more -  We will record an acoustic EP of 5 songs brand new songs - free to download!

YOU MEAN EVERYTHING TO US

For us musicians, we are nothing without our listeners/fans. And without people that support us by purchasing our songs/albums, we'd be nowhere! You are what drives us to do what we do! So we are always thankful for YOU. We appreciate that YOU have taken an interest in us. And we hope we can return that appreciation through the music we create! Yes, you inspire our music!

BROKE? UNEMPLOYED? YOU CAN STILL HELP

You can still help us out by getting the word out on social media like facebook, twitter, and etc. You can even use the indiegogo share tools, send personal messages/emails to friends and family or even to random strangers!
 
Go pick up that phone and call your friends. Go out for coffee with a relative and tell them about our campaign! If you have any ideas of how others can help, please let us know.  

Let's get this rolling!

story: Hi guys! My brother and I have been invited to bring Fat, Drunk and Ugly to the stages of the Savannah Summer Solstice Festival this June 21-23!!!! We'll be opening the festival as well as performing on the Bluegrass Hayride. It's gonna be an amazing weekend of music and art that I'm sure will be only the first of many to come!!! I can't wait to be a part of it! I'm coming to you with a chance to be a part of it as well by donating to my 'Savannah Summer Solstice Festival or Bust' campaign! By donating you will be helping cover the travel expenses to and from this awesome festival and we've got some awesome perk pakages set up for ya!! check them out, donate what you can, and if you can't donate please pass this info along by sharing!!! I've only got a few weeks so help as often and as much as you can!!! Thanks in advance for your support and long live raunch rawk!!!!

story:
Our Story

Greetings from the Jason Yost Band. I am so very grateful to have this opportunity to produce my very first EP. It has been a long time coming indeed. For the past eleven years I have traveled and played music in all different types of venues and cultures. I never once felt the timing was right to produce my own album, until now! I always wanted to create an album that didn't just move people's emotions, but one that moved people's actions. So I had this idea…what if I gathered up all my experiences and reflections from music and travels over the past eleven years and interweaved them into a lyrical movement that created a rhythm, not just a rhythm that is identified by sound, but also one that is identified by deeds?


Here is the best part: After the release of my EP "Rescue Me", I am going to give away all the music sales to help fund adoptions and orphan projects. 


You can be a part of the behind the scenes production right now!  


The Impact

This album has no time limit as far as its effectiveness goes. Every time someone purchases the album they are directly investing in helping an orphan find a safe and loving family. That can happen this year or ten years from now. The return on investment has the potential to outlive you and I. Investors will also have the opportunity to join us on trips and volunteer at concerts to further their investment in caring for orphans.  Together we can utilize our abilities and resources to make a big impact in the life of a child and have a lot of fun while we do it!


What We Need & What You Get

All of the donated funds on this IndeGoGo site will go directly towards the recording, mixing, mastering, & producing of the album. Then after the completion and release of the album, the entire proceeds to music & CD sales will be donated to New Rhythm Project, a child advocacy and adoption consulting group. We'll keep you updated along the entire process via this custom IndieGoGo site and at JasonYostBand.com


If we can get just 300 people to give $40 we will reach our goal!


Here are some of the perks we set up for your investments and enjoyment:


Best Perk of ALL = **every dollar invested will inevitably help fund adoptions and orphan care projects**


But you will also get:


$10+ - You'll be the first to receive a digital download of our new album in advance of its release

$40+ - 1 Signed CD | 1 ticket to our CD release party in DC | 1 personalized thank you photo signed by the band

$100+ - 1 Limited Edition JYB T-Shirt | 2 Signed CD | 2 tickets to our CD release party in DC | 1 personalized thank you photo signed by the band

$400+ - A MVP Mention in the album cover | 2 Limited Edition JYB T-Shirt | 3 Signed CD | 4 tickets to our CD release party in DC | 1 personalized thank you photo signed by the band

$1000+ - A VIP 30 min. unplugged concert at a location/organization of your choice | A MVP Mention in the album cover, 2 Limited Edition JYB T-Shirt | 4 Signed CD | 5 tickets to our CD release party in DC | 1 personalized thank you photo signed by the band (3 months advanced notice preferred for performance. If away from DC area, transportation not included)

$4000+ - All items from $1000 level PLUS a personalized video from the children's & families lives you helped


Other Ways You Can Help

We are firm believers of DIWO (DO IT WITH OTHERS)! Please share us with your networks, family, and friends so we can reach our goal to help complete the album and put lonely children in loving families. Utilize the share tools on this page and all the other amazing tools you have at your disposal to include everyone you know on this amazing opportunity. Thanks so much!

story:
NEW PERK ADDED - GREAT HOLIDAY GIFT!  An insiders tour of Juilliard for your family!  Check it out and share with families!

 

The Project

Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign!  

I am a professional freelance violist living in New York City at an exciting point in my career - I am about to purchase a viola for the first time! The relationship between a string player and their instrument is key - and that relationship is anything but free.

For more than a decade, I was lucky enough to play on a beautiful 19th century French viola on loan from a foundation. I grew up with this instrument and became very emotionally connected to the sound that I produced with it. When I had to return the viola to the foundation, I felt like I was losing a part of myself and my musical voice. I had just completed my Masters at Juilliard and was left without the right instrument to turn my degree into a career.  

I had my heart set on finding the perfect old instrument; one that  was small enough to play on comfortably, with a “small” enough price tag to match. Old instruments cost anywhere from 50 to 100 thousand dollars, all the way up to the millions of dollars. So, I started thinking outside of the box and considered the world of contemporary instruments.  

That is when I discovered Guy Rabut, one of the most respected modern instrument makers. I was immediately enamored with his instruments and decided that I wanted Guy to make me a viola.

The simple goal of this campaign is to crowdfund the purchase of my new Guy Rabut viola.

On the most basic level, your contributions will help me purchase this world class instrument that will grow with me throughout my career. But on a more significant level, this campaign will connect me to all of you: friends, family, colleagues and even some total strangers that may choose to be a part of this musical journey.  

What You Get Out of This

For each contribution, I am offering different perks. Check out the right side of this screen to figure out what level suits you best!  

The Impact

I hope this campaign encourages other classical musicians to tap into their networks to fund instrument purchases and other creative projects. Even though classical music is an old and slowly evolving field, musicians should still actively use new technology to advance their careers.

Music is a living, breathing, constantly evolving creation and only a small percentage of the artistic process actually happens on the stage. By unlocking the creative process to family, friends and fans, there is endless potential to develop deeper relationships and break down stale business models.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute at this time, please spread the word to music lovers, students and friends. Post a link to this page on Facebook, Twitter, Google+.  Anywhere!  

Thank you very much, and let’s get funding!  

Special Thanks

I would like to thank Guy Rabut for being so generous with his time and so enthusiastic about this project. And an extra special thanks to Eric Paternot for shooting, directing and producing my campaign video.

story:
The video above is a performance clip of Exaltron, one of the artists that played at the Make Music NY festival on the Warper / Dubspot stage in 2011.

Hi, I'm Julie Covello aka Dj Shakey, founder and co-director of the Warper Party, New York's largest electronic music showcase. My partner, Mike Hatsis aka BangInclude, along with the Onex (Outback Nexus) crew, are bringing musicians and djs from our communities to play for both days of the beloved Figment Festival on Governor's Island in NYC June 9th and 10th.

We plan to book approximately 14 live acts, showcasing some of most forward thinking musicians in the area. Whether you end up shaking your booty or scratching your head, our performers guarantee to leave a lasting impression on all who stop by our stage.

We need a small amount of financial support for the following supplies: Generator rental, gas for generator, gas for deliveries, sturdy cooler purchase, ice, softdrinks, banner printing, duct tape, rope, and a few other basic needs.

Warper and Onex organizers, volunteers, and artists have enthusiastically created stages for many events like: Burning Man Decom, NYC Halloween Parade, Lucky Seven Summer Camp, past Figment Festivals, Make Music New York, and many more. We believe we can step-up our productions, provide a better performer experience, and draw in more visitors by turning to the community for contributions. 

Even the smallest donation by those we have reached with our events will be more than enough to assist with our Figment stage. However if you are not able to contribute financially, we certainly would appreciate help putting the word out, please post on facebook or forward to a few of your friends!

THIS IS A VERY SHORT CAMPAIGN,

PLEASE CONTRIBUTE ASAP! 

Thanks!!!

Onex and the Warper Party

ONEX (OUTBACK NEXUS) is an audio visual event crew based in New York City.  Our focus is on the rugged edge of electronic music and visual art.  We are a collaboration of  related creative families from the Tri-State area and play a range of DIY beats and sounds as DJs using vinyl and digital formats and as live musicians using hardware and software.  Our specialty is outdoor events, from inner city events and parades to multi-day campout festivals.  Our roots grow from the global free festival movement, the US urban outlaw scene and the Brooklyn warehouse multimedia underground. 

WARPER PARTY is NY's largest and most diverse electronic music showcase. We aim to build community by giving artists of all skill levels a place to network, share, be inspired, develop their craft, experiment, collaborate, and perform in front a cheering crowd. Warper has been going strong for over 6 years and is known for the enthusiasm and quality of its artists.
story_txt:
The video above is a performance clip of Exaltron, one of the artists that played at the Make Music NY festival on the Warper / Dubspot stage in 2011.
Hi, I'm Julie Covello aka Dj Shakey, founder and co-director of the Warper Party, New York's largest electronic music showcase. My partner, Mike Hatsis aka BangInclude, along with the Onex (Outback Nexus) crew, are bringing musicians and djs from our communities to play for both days of the beloved Figment Festival on Governor's Island in NYC June 9th and 10th.
We plan to book approximately 14 live acts, showcasing some of most forward thinking musicians in the area. Whether you end up shaking your booty or scratching your head, our performers guarantee to leave a lasting impression on all who stop by our stage.
We need a small amount of financial support for the following supplies: Generator rental, gas for generator, gas for deliveries, sturdy cooler purchase, ice, softdrinks, banner printing, duct tape, rope, and a few other basic needs.
Warper and Onex organizers, volunteers, and artists have enthusiastically created stages for many events like: Burning Man Decom, NYC Halloween Parade, Lucky Seven Summer Camp, past Figment Festivals, Make Music New York, and many more. We believe we can step-up our productions, provide a better performer experience, and draw in more visitors by turning to the community for contributions. 
Even the smallest donation by those we have reached with our events will be more than enough to assist with our Figment stage. However if you are not able to contribute financially, we certainly would appreciate help putting the word out, please post on facebook or forward to a few of your friends!
THIS IS A VERY SHORT CAMPAIGN,
PLEASE CONTRIBUTE ASAP! 
Thanks!!!
Onex and the Warper Party
ONEX (OUTBACK NEXUS) is an audio visual event crew based in New York City.  Our focus is on the rugged edge of electronic music and visual art.  We are a collaboration of  related creative families from the Tri-State area and play a range of DIY beats and sounds as DJs using vinyl and digital formats and as live musicians using hardware and software.  Our specialty is outdoor events, from inner city events and parades to multi-day campout festivals.  Our roots grow from the global free festival movement, the US urban outlaw scene and the Brooklyn warehouse multimedia underground. 
WARPER PARTY is NY's largest and most diverse electronic music showcase. We aim to build community by giving artists of all skill levels a place to network, share, be inspired, develop their craft, experiment, collaborate, and perform in front a cheering crowd. Warper has been going strong for over 6 years and is known for the enthusiasm and quality of its artists.

story:
Short Summary

I'm a entrepreneur From Long beach, Ca, I've owned my own store. Now I'm focusing on my music career and getting my business off the ground. I'm also a Songwriter/Ghostwriter/Singer/Rapper/Entertainer /Businessman. Looking to further my entertainment career.

I'm Looking for Supporters,Contributors,Donators or Sponsor for my upcoming project and video. The project is called The Simulation. I'm campaigning for my video entitled "POWERROCKET". This campaign is important to me, because I want to target my community, family and my colleagues.

What We Need & What You Get

Contributors will help me receive exposure, help me get my foot in the door, which I can help others with. I have a 9 to 5 job, and I don't need the funds for myself. The funds will help me pay for production, with this project and outside projects as well.

With the budget, that's where I need you to come in.

Production: (i.e. ,Studio,Equipment Rentals, Crew and Food)

Post Production: (i.e. Editing, Sound Design, Music Composition, CD Mastering, Graphics and Artwork)

Total Budget :$5,000

 
Other CD's I have put out :The Transformation, Stylafornia,In My Pr1me MixTape.

Nintendo Backpack Check it Out
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nCJbcqu4Z7Q&feature=plcp
 
For More Information about the Nintendo Backpack Email Me At : Getatpr1memusic@gmail.com

story:
We're doing this campaign to try and get the funds to record our full length album and go on tour, so we can get the things that we need. 

We have a lot of stuff that we have acquired on our own over the years, but, there are certain things that we need to be able to bring the right show to YOU and we need your HELP.

          


What We Need & What You Get

We just got a distribution deal with Select-O-Hits and we're looking to get some things taken care of so we're gonna talk to you guys about that and see what you think about it....if you wanna be a part of something, we're trying to let you be a part of our family, be on 'Team Harvest Mill'. 

We have a lot of good perks that you'll be able to look at on the side over here -> I think its on this side....its on the side? Yeah, its on the side -> of the webpage as you look at it, all whole 'crap ton' full of Perks -> 

You guys will be able to get stuff like EPs, T-Shirts. 

                  


We'll have a couple Cymbals up that you can go for.  We'll have a guitar, and  merch packs that you're gonna see on there, but we'll have some other stuff too.

We'll even throw a perk in there; that if you give us a certain amount;  we'll put your name in the album...Its gonna be called 'Flesh N Pain'. 

                           


We have an EP out right now, that you can go get; on iTunes, Amazon MP3 and other download places  - but, that will also be INCLUDED in some of our perks too. 

                      



The Impact

The biggest thing is that we need help for is getting some equipment to take care of ourselves.  Like our Egnater cabinets, and heads.  To protect those, because if one of them goes down its like a thousand dollars going out the door, So we need to be able to protect our gear while we're on tour.  We have a lot of our own stuff.  We've worked to get our own endorsements, so we have companies that are backing us up - but we still need a few different things. 

And, you'll be helping us on the record too.  We'll be working with Rocky Gray, formerly of Evanescence, to get a record out to you guys - hopefully sometime mid summer.

Because, the bottom line is - that we're gonna be out there to take the music to YOU.  We're willing to make the trip.  We're already doing shows within 6-8 hours of our location; on our own dime; to get out their and do this. 

               

             


We wanna bring YOU GUYS our music. 

We're doing this independently.  We don't have a label.  And, HELL, you guys help us out who knows if that would change.  We could end up  getting a label and that would be ALL because YOU GUYS helped us out with this record and this tour.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute; or can contribute, but want to lend additional help; please be sure to Share this Campaign. 

Tell all your friends and family, your Twitter followers, your Facebook Friends and subscribers, your Reverbnation Fans, your Blog readers, Etc. 

Share every where Please.

story:
Our Story

Hi! My name is Danielle French- I am a singer/songwriter based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada (but Reno, Nevada also calls me a local, more on that later...) .


I have been creating music and producing CD's since 1995 and in the span of my career so far I have had the supreme pleasure of working with some of my favourite musicians in the world. Artists such as Burton Cummings (The Guess Who), Matthew Good, Martin Tielli (Rheostatics) and members of Blue Rodeo, Spirit of the West, as well as members of Sarah McLachlan, Mae Moore and Barney Bentall's bands have all leant their talents to my previous projects. Career highlights include performing on the Rita McNeil Show and at the Calgary leg of Lilith Fair, as well as having my songs appear on TV shows including Falcon Beach and Fashion Television.


As an independent artist these days, it is necessary for you to not only be the creative/artistic person, but also the business person in your artistic career. Over the past 17 years I have independently handled both the creative aspects of my career as well as the business aspects of my career, acting as my own booking agent, booking my own tours throughout North America, doing my own publicity and marketing, and driving across North America performing in venues from coffee shops to soft seat theatres to night clubs to opening for artists such as Holly Cole, Burton Cummings and the Barenaked Ladies to name a few! 


I feel very fortunate to be an artist in Canada as Canada is very supportive of their artists and there are several grant programs available to support various artistic endeavours. Although it is a very competitive process, I am happy to say that I did receive a grant that contributed partial funding towards the recording costs on my upcoming CD, Drive. But having now reached pressing stage of this project, I find my resources are tapped after spending 2 months in Reno, Nevada, where I recording with my dream record producer, Tom Gordon. 


It has been a dream of mine to work with Tom since I met him almost 10 years ago, when I toured through Reno (when Reno first adopted me as a local!). Tom used to be the assistant engineer at a studio called Granny's House which saw major label artists such as Dr. Dre, Willie Nelson, Whitesnake, Boys II Men and Collective Soul come through their doors. I have always wanted to work creatively with Tom and felt an amazing synergy with him in the studio! Tom connected me with local Reno band The Novelists as my backing band in the studio and drummer Tony Savage (of Englebert Humperdink's band) rounded out the rhythm section. I am very proud of what came out of our recording sessions and can't wait to share it with the world! 


Drive is a series of songs that were inspired by my many years touring throughout North America- songs about freedom, adventure, and of course heartache. Where my last CD was more experimental in nature, on Drive I longed to return to my roots as a singer/songwriter and create a more organic sound. And I am hoping that with a title like "Drive" that I will have much more touring opportunities in the New Year to bring my music across the continent. 


The Impact

The reality is that this project will move forward no matter what! If I have to take out RRSP's or money on my line of credit, this project will be realized! I am almost looking at this IndieGogo campaign as a pre-sales outlet... It is common for independent artists to raise money to press their projects by asking fans to "pre-buy" their music (ie. buy a copy of their product before it was pressed), to help off-set the costs of pressing the product. The album or CD is then sent to the supporter after the project was pressed. Tools like IndieGogo, now assist artists with these sorts of campaigns in our technological era- Thanks IndieGogo! 


What We Need & What You Get

My fundraising goal for pressing 1,000 CD's is $1500 (for anyone who inquires I would be happy to provide a breakdown of how this number was achieved). If I receive less than that amount, I will personally do what I need to do to make up the difference! Should I receive MORE that this amount, please know that once the CD is pressed, there are many other expenses such as marketing, touring, promotion etc... that will encompass my next phase of fundraising. Any funds that surpass my $1200 target will be directly funnelled back into promotion phase for this project and I would be happy to provide full disclosure of expenses and allocation of any additional funds to anyone who requests.


Certainly there are perks for all contributors!

- For all contributions up to $15- I will send you an autographed copy of my new CD, Drive. The purposes of this campaign is to share my music with you all, so I appreciate any contribution level no matter how small and will be happy to send a copy of the new CD to you. 

- For contributions between $16-24- I will send you 2 autographed copies of my new CD, Drive

- For contributions between $25-49- I will send you 2 autographed copies of my new CD, Drive, plus 1 copy of each of my CD's released since 1995 (5 CD's total) 

- For contributions between $50-499- I will send you 1 autographed copy of each of my CD's released since 1995 (4 CD's total), plus copies of my 3 music videos that I produced/directed, that have appears on Bravo! and at film festivals around the world. 

- For contributions between of $500-4999- I will send you 1 autographed copy of each of my CD's released since 1995 (4 CD's total), plus copies of my 3 music videos that I produced/directed, plus, if you live in North America and it is feasible for me to do so on one of  my tour route, I will gladly provide you with a private 2 hour concert in your home, or, if possible, a venue of your choice. 

- For contributions of $5000 and over- I will send you 1 autographed copy of each of my CD's released since 1995 (4 CD's total), plus copies of my 3 music videos that I produced/directed, plus, if you live in North America, I will fly you to Reno at the end of August/early September, give you a tour of the studio in Reno where I recorded Drive and a chance to meet my producer Tom Gordon and I will buy you a ticket to the annual Burning Man Festival (end August, early September 2012, www.burningman.com)* and show you around Burning Man in the Black Rock Desert.* disclaimer- I will buy you a ticket to the festival and help you with logistics and advice and as much fun as I can, but all other travel, accommodation and living expenses are up to you.

story:
We are Nobody Yet

What's up everyone, we're an energetic, sporadic, enthralling, tantalizing, and polite rock band from Philadelphia, PA. If you've ever seen us live, that description probably makes more sense. We're called Nobody Yet, and no, we aren't changing our name to "Somebody Now" once we're famous. We've written a bunch of new songs touching on many emotions, and we're ready to put them on record for you and only you. We guarantee this album will be full of more energy than you've ever seen out of us before. Come to a show and we will literally rip your faces off. 


We really appreciate all the support over the years, and are asking all of you one more time to help us keep making the music we love to make. While you dream of unicorns and talking dinosaurs, we dream of playing Warped Tour. While you wake up to a fresh cup of Folger's, we wake up in the back of a cold van after cuddling with each other all night. While you try to pick up girls at the mall, we take turns hitting on our merch girl. This is our lives and we're going to do everything that it takes to keep doing this for you forever. Right now we would love for you to help us get there!


Why We Need the Money

For this campaign, we are raising money to help fund the recording of our very first full-length album. We've found a kick-ass engineer who's going to help us make the songs sound awesome. The album won't be cheap, and there are certainly other costs involved in the process. The cost of recording, printing cds, touring expenses, ordering new merchandise, and flying to the moon for inspiration add up quickly, and we could use your help in finishing our first full-length album.


If we are hungry and go out to eat after a show, Joe uses the tip money he gets from delivering pizzas (most of the time he just eats the pizza), Ryan uses money he earns hustling at the bowling alley, and Alaapster uses money that he steals from his little sister. We do NOT use band money. As with every single merch item we've ever sold, every penny that we earn or receive from ANYTHING goes directly to our Nobody Yet piggy bank, which in turn helps to pay for band expenses such as new t-shirts or gas for our tour van. Currently, with our band account, we are nowhere near being able to afford a new album.


We don't do this to make money, we just want to be able to play shows every single night. Even if that means eating dry Oodles of Noodles for every meal. Most of the time we don't even get paid at shows. Frankly, we will scrape from the streets if we have to, but every dollar you donate is one more dollar we can spend toward advancing Nobody Yet. 


What We Need and What You Get

We are trying to raise $3500, which will cover the bulk of recording and printing costs for the CD. You can expect updates from us along the way as we finish up writing, get into the studio, and prepare to tour the new material. 


Every single donation receives a reward! Plus EVERY SUPPORTER WILL BE THANKED ON OUR ALBUM. That's right, each one of your names will be on the inside of our album!!


We hope that you dig them! Please leave a phone number, email address, or a way for us to contact you and thank you personally for your support. We really do appreciate it. Like really. If there's something that you've always wanted from us but is not listed as a reward (like a song request, a back rub from Joe, or a slumber party with the band) or just have a question about something, please don't hesitate to ask - we will do anything we can to make you happy. Anything.


You are Nobody Yet

We are nothing without our fans and the people who support everything we do (hint: YOU). We would greatly appreciate it if you told everyone you know about our band and our campaign! Email everyone, text all of your contacts, call everyone in the local yellow pages, Facebook ALL of your friends!! Tell everyone! You can copy this link (www.indiegogo.com/nobodyyet) and post it on your Facebook, your blog, in bathroom stalls, and everywhere else! Tell everyone else to do the same!  We really do appreciate all of your support!!!


From the bottom of our hearts,

Joe, Ryan, and Alaap

www.iamnobodyyet.com
story_txt:
We are Nobody Yet
What's up everyone, we're an energetic, sporadic, enthralling, tantalizing, and polite rock band from Philadelphia, PA. If you've ever seen us live, that description probably makes more sense. We're called Nobody Yet, and no, we aren't changing our name to "Somebody Now" once we're famous. We've written a bunch of new songs touching on many emotions, and we're ready to put them on record for you and only you. We guarantee this album will be full of more energy than you've ever seen out of us before. Come to a show and we will literally rip your faces off. 

We really appreciate all the support over the years, and are asking all of you one more time to help us keep making the music we love to make. story:
Nashville music artist and songwriter, Kelsey Harmon, is using her music to raise money for the Maria Schaffstein foundation, which benefits those in need of support on his or her pursuit to accomplishing academic goals.

With this campaign, there are two options. Through purchasing a ticket to Kelsey Harmon's showcase on August 5th, Kelsey will receive the extra proceeds from excess ticket sales, 100% of which will go to the Maria Schaffstein fund. The second option is to contribute directly through this campaign in order for the money to go directly to the Maria Schaffstein foundation. Thank you for your support!

www.wantickets.com/kelseyh to purchase tickets to Kelsey's show at the Hard Rock Cafe in Nashville, TN on August 5th from 5-9pm. 

www.smiles4maria.com to learn more about Maria's story

story:
This is a teaser for the upcoming album and companion DVD from Fancy Trash. This is a condensed version of the new track "Too Many Dings". It was recorded at Justin Pizzoferrato's new studio in Easthampton, and the video was produced by Drew Steelman. It was filmed by Bryant Naro, Scott Hancock, Jeff Byrnes, Adam Wilkins, and Jessica Correia. Editing by James Steelman.

Our Story

Fancy Trash works the line between rock and folk, blending a non-traditional sensibility with the tradition of acoustic instruments to make something unique: Folk-tinged indie rock. Don’t let the acoustic instruments fool you, Fancy Trash is a rock band.

Dave Houghton (vocals, guitars), Paul Kochanski (upright bass) and Jason Smith (drums) explore new ways to bring out the folk for the anti-folk.

Reviews:

“It isn’t easy to be Fancy Trash. It’s not supposed to be. The twang-rock band based here has chosen to take on two of rock’s most difficult challenges: performing as a trio and playing energetic, often edgy music on acoustic instruments… Most bands would wisely avoid this combination of hurdles. Fancy Trash embraces it. With its semicountrified, punk-influenced music that recalls Neil Young, Clem Snide, the Flaming Lips, and an assortment of ’90s alternarock bands (from Nirvana to early Radiohead), the group doesn’t simply pull off acoustic trio rock, it makes it seem natural. The band’s live sets drip with energy. Its songs turn on delicate guitar picking and furious strumming.”
- The Boston Globe April 30, 2004 by Sean Glennon

The Impact

We want to record a full-length album with songs from 2009 - 2012. We had 57. We're going to narrow it down to 12. We are recording with Justin Pizzoferrato. This will be our 5th album. We plan to be done May 2012.

 

Why We Need You & What You Get

We are producing this album for at least one of the following reasons:

  1. We love rock n' roll.
  2. We are teetering on desperation.
  3. Even better than therapy.
  4. We've got these demons.
  5. We really need $7,500, but we figure we can stretch $2,500 allright.
  6. Self-production just doesn't sound as good.
  7. We can't quit.
  8. Possibly all of the above.

By donating to this campaign you will get the album before ANYONE else, you will also get very cool and unique perks that only backers (like yourself) will have access to. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our mission with your friends, family and pets. Post on Facebook, Twitter and other Social Media sites by using the Share Tools below the video.

story:
In the last several years, Toronto's "The House of David Gang" has been one of Canada's busiest touring reggae ambassadors on the circuit. From their annual Bob Marley Birthday Tribute Food Drive tour which is a staple of the winter music calendar across Ontario, Quebec and Atlantic Canada.  The Gang is also know for their spirited tributes to the other legends of reggae including Peter Tosh, Bunny Wailer, Gregory Isaacs and Denis Brown.

The Band has raised food and spirits for charities across Canada (Cancer, Disabilities and Politics) and have Canadian themes woven throughout their catalog of folk, rock, jazz songs all rooted in reggae-soul and grounded by the voice of King Selah.

House of David Gang is at the heart the downtown reggae scene, and is one of the few roots reggae acts regularily touring the country,

The House of David Gang's honest to goodnes goal is to get a nomination in the reggae category at the 2011-2012 Juno Awards.

The band has already put an incredible amount of work in the album by way of support and financial assistance of The Ontario Arts Council, Factor and the band's own investment of time and dedication.

The band turns to their friends, family and fans for a small financial contribution to be apart of the entire project, and help launch the band, music professionally and as supporting the band on a first ever full Cross Canada tour that starts in Vancouver for Jamaican 50 year independence Celebrations on Saturday, September 22st culminating in Toronto on Saturday, October 20th at El Mocambo in Toronto.

more on the band here: www.houseofdavidgang.com

story:
Childhood friends Jacob McNabb and Garrett Hafler talked for years about starting a band together. Though Garrett played drums and Jacob sang they lacked the other members necessary to form a band as well as the motivation. In 2008, they began playing music casually together with a guitar player friend and their first band, A Decent Tuesday, was born. The group soon added Chris Harvey to play guitar in order to improve their sound. As A Decent Tuesday, Garrett, Jacob and Chris played shows all across the upstate New York area and recorded a self produced EP as well as a full length album entitled Oceanic. However, in late 2010, the band feeling burned out decided to take some time off and they never reunited.

Out of this project however, The September Campaign was born. Jacob, Chris and Garrett, missing the experience of playing in a band, began forming a new project with a new set of members. They recruited their friend Sage to play keyboard and Sage Keber then suggested a guitar player he knew named Tony Marinilli, and the foundation of The September Campaign was established. This group along with Stephen Faro on guitar, began playing together in April 2011 in the Rochester, NY area. 

The band quickly wrote an albums worth of material that they planned on turning into an album in the winter of 2012, but due to recording issues this album never materialized. The band did however release their first single, entitled Gallows, as well as an accompanying music video that received 1,000 views within 24 hours of it being posted online. During this time, the band played shows all across the upstate New York area, earning spots on shows with bands like Emery, Hawthorne Heights, Decoder, and more. 2012 brought some challenges for the band, as long time guitar player, Stephen, decided to leave the band. After several more member changes the lineup eventually solidified with the addition of Conor Mulcahy on bass. This new lineup abandoned nearly all of their older songs, deciding that it was time to start fresh with new material for a new record.

These songs, after being written throughout the summer of 2012, ultimately became the material for The September Campaign's debut album entitled "Haunt." These new songs feature a somewhat more aggressive and technical sound for the band compared with their earlier songs. They are extremely proud of these new songs that they have written and are now eagerly anticipating the release of "Haunt" in early 2013.  

Please help us spread our music and message. We understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially but there are many ways to support us other than monetary donations. Spread the word and share this page with anyone who you think might be interested. Also please visit our facebook and give us a like and listen.

www.facebook.com/theseptembercampaign

story:
Short Summary

GA3 believes we are called to proclaim the Gospel of Christ, to maintain the worship of God through our lives and music, and to inspire in all people a love and passion for righteousness. We've been making music as a group for a long time, but for the past 2 years we have tried to expand our platform and reach more of the world. This year we are excited to announce that our first full length album will debut and it is called Alternative Lifestyle! 

This is where YOU come in!  In order to make great music that glorifies the Most High and also competes with what so many of our young people are listening to, it takes money.  We serve an awesome God and we want to make Him known to the world, but He deserves our very best and GA3 wants to bring quality.  Quality in production, sound, packaging, promotion, etc.  

What We Need & What You Get

$2,000 is our goal and we are confident that with YOUR help we will reach it.  These funds will go towards the following: 
-Packaging: in the past we would all sit around and literally burn 100's of CD's and package them ourselves.  Needless to say the result wasn't as nice as something you would buy in the store.  CD duplications and packaging is a must! 
-Promotion: in order for people to purchase our music, they need to know that it's out there.  Promotion and marketing is very costly, but very necessary. 
-Music Video: a great way for people to recognize you and grow attached to your music is through videos.  Who doesn't like a good video? And we want the best quality--check out the video we already have: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ll3JqjqwJC0

The Impact

Think about your favorite song.  That song can either make you smile, laugh, dance, cry, give you chills or make you simply nod your head. In some way or another music touches us.  It touches us deep down in our souls and it stays there for a while.  They call music "the universal language" because it's the only art form that can speak to anybody, anywhere.  Music doesn't care about your race, background or social class; it just wants to be heard. 

Here's the problem though.  When you turn on the radio there isn't much worth listening to, but many still do.  Between the 808's, high hat drums and hand claps are profane, misogynistic and violent lyrics.  These lyrics don't make us smile or give us chills, but they should make us cry.  GA3 is here to offer an alternative--Alternative Lifestyle. 

Other Ways You Can Help

GA3 understands that everyone is not in a position to make donations and we don't want anyone to strain themselves financially for our sake--we appreciate it though!  Listen, if you are not in a position at the moment to make a donation here are a few ways you can help us out: 
-Spread The Word: tell your family, friends, neighbors and strangers, not just about this campaign but our ministry as a whole. Tell them to check out our website gideonsarmyga.com for music, updates and news. We are on a mission to build the kingdom and every penny or dollar will help. 
-Open Your Doors: if you have a church or any venue don't hesitate to invite us.  We are more than willing to come out if our schedule permits. 
-Pray: most important thing you could do for us right now is to pray. Pray that God will use us however He chooses and that we will take a backseat to His agenda.  Pray for our strength as we boldly step out on faith. Pray for our humilty as our audience expands and grows.  Most importanly pray that souls will be reached through our music.

story:
Short Summary

Samantha Crain had her guitar stolen out of her car in broad daylight while she was in Columbus Ohio. How pathetic is that?!

The video is from her show here in Salt Lake in 2011. Her show was incredible, and she was gracious enough to grant me an interview before the show. I hope to help raise some funds for her to get a new guitar.

What We Need & What You Get

ALL FUNDS GO TO SAMANTHA CRAIN. I have no interest in keeping "a portion of the proceeds ..." This is how I can help repay her generosity, and more broadly, to repay her for all the amazing music she's made for us. This is your chance to support *her*!!

The Impact

I honestly don't know what guitars cost. I hope the $1000 covers it, but if not, then at least we'll have helped some.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, there are other ways to contribute.
  • Share on Twitter
  • Share on Facebook
  • Post to your blog
  • Talk with your friends

She needs a guitar to play on tour, plain and simple. Let's help her out.

story:
Short Summary

We're "Forget It. Goodbye." --a Brooklyn-based kick-ass band. We're Ashley (Larry), Erich, and Frankie. We rock out live and it's awesome, but don't you just sometimes wish we could come over to your house? Or travel with you on the subway? We do too! And with your help, we can! We're recording our first EP and filming our first music video. And then you'll be able to carry us in your pockets, like you've always wanted. Rock out in your pock-out. 

Our first EP is a huge milestone for us and we would love to have you all be a part of it. 

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for a total of $5500, because recording an EP and filming a video takes dough! 

  • STUDIO TIME! One studio session runs us $400 per day. It takes at least 3 days to lay down all the tracks.
  • MIXING & MASTERING! A brilliant sound engineer mixes the songs and then a different but also brilliant sound engineer masters them. This makes them sound perfect--like we were in your living room, if your living room were an acoustically perfect dodecahedron. Each song runs $150 to mix and master. We have eight rocking songs (and one super slow jamz).
  • LIGHTS! CAMERA! ACTION! We complied an amazing director, DP, and lighting team. It runs us about $500 for the lights to make us look amazing. And $300 to rent lenses for the amazing camera, and oh, then there's the camera. And we're feeding the crew. And the crew is amazing so they deserve a couple bucks too. If you saw them, you'd agree.
  • COSTUMES! There are costumes. They're great--and totally worth the $150.
  • Pizza! We'll get pizza while we record. You won't hear it on the tracks though.
  • Graphic Design! Cover art doesn't draw it self. Our resident graphic designer deserves some compensation for his hard work!
  • Strings! Frankie always breaks her strings, and they need to be replaced with high quality metal ones.   

We have shows throughout Brooklyn frequently so the more you help us, the more you can hang out with us. We're offering some pretty good loot -- Larry's socks, Frankie's red hoodie, drinks with the band, VIP treatment at a real-live Forget It. Goodbye. show, and Frankie as your +1 to your next family function!

Every bit helps! Even if we don't reach our full funding goal, we can still get in the studio and maybe even release a single or two. And we'll get pizza. And then for each little bit more we raise, more mixing and then more pizza. 

Other Ways You Can Help

After you donate, tell your friends, tell your parents, tell your friends' parents, tell your parents' friends! Help us get the word out! Use indiegogo's awesome share tools and use every form of social and anti-social media there is!
story_txt:

We rock out live and it's awesome, but don't you just sometimes wish we could come over to your house? Or travel with you on the subway? We do too! And with your help, we can! We're recording our first EP and filming our first music video. And then you'll be able to carry us in your pockets, like you've always wanted. Rock out in your pock-out. Our first EP is a huge milestone for us and we would love to have you all be a part of it. What We Need & What You GetWe're asking for a total of $5500, because recording an EP and filming a video takes dough!

story:
Greetings everyone!

We're Throwbacks, a progressive/pop punk band out of Brick, NJ.  Those mixes of genres may sound unheard of, but we are trying to bring a different perspective to the style of pop punk music.  Recently we have finished preparing 5 songs for our new CD.  The only problem is, we are all broke college kids struggling and unable to put together the money for professional quality studio time.  Bottom line is, we are asking for your help to bring this CD to life with us.  We intend to release these songs free for download online. If you listen to our music and like what we are doing, we would be so wonderfully grateful if you donated to help us pay for recording. Anthony, Tommy, Dan, Jeremy, and I have spent countless hours on writing these new songs.  Please watch our music video for "Limits" that I have attached to see what we are all about.  Thank you so much for your time!

- Throwbacks

Facebook Link

Bandcamp Music Link

story:
The Louisiana Sessions

Hello!  My name is Grant Dermody. I am a harmonica player, singer, songwriter and tunesmith from Seattle, Washington. I play acoustic American Roots music. I am raising money to record and manufacture my third CD, The Louisiana Sessions. We start recording in January 2014 at Dirk Powell's studio in Breaux Bridge, Louisiana.

I have been a working musician for over thirty years. I have performed, toured and recorded with some of the very best. I have been a sideman, a band member and solo artist. My last two solo records had over 20 guest artists each. Each CD was a testament to and an attempt to capture the musical relationships I have developed throughout my life and career. You can read about them on my website www.grantdermody.com. You can also see my complete discography and biography. 

My most recent record, Lay Down My Burden 2010 was made during the two years my wife, Eileen, was ill and before her passing. That record was about strength, power, depth of love, perseverance, and community. It was difficult to do but it emerged as a beautiful record and one of which I am very proud. 

I am ready to make a new record, with a deeper power, a more joyful strength and a smaller musical community. With this recording, I'll be doing what I do best, playing Country Blues, Old-Time and Cajun music with some good friends and fabulous musicians. I have written a bunch of new tunes for this project and am ready to get to work laying them down.

I will be joined by Dirk Powell and Orville Johnson on all the tunes. Cedric Watson will join us on fiddle for the old-time and cajun tunes, and Rich Del Grosso will play mandolin on the deep, low-down blues tunes. All are great friends and musicians and are ready, willing and able to help me make the best possible CD. They are also a group I can tour with once the record is out. 

Dirk Powell will be the engineer for the project and it will be mastered by nine-time Grammy winner Michael Bishop from 5/4 Productions.

I have the vision and tunes for a great record, and I have the best musicians working with me as well. I need your help with the financial part to bring it all to life. 


THE FINANCING

My last two recordings were each done over two-year periods, a song or two at a time. A few hundred dollars a session, spread out this way was affordable. As each CD had over twenty guest artists, this was also the most reasonable way to complete the recording. 

This record will be recorded in two 3-4 day sessions; one in January 2014 and one in March. 

Here is the breakdown of expenses:

Recording, paying these amazing musicians for their time, effort, and supreme musicianship- $11,000.00

Mastering- $1500.00

Graphic Design- $2,000.00

CD Manufacturing- $1,100.00 

Licensing-$300.00

Airfare- $3,000.00

Car rental- $500.00

Food and expenses while recording- $300.00

Hotels- $1000.00

Promotion- $2500.00

Indiegogo Fees- ?

TOTAL- $23,200.00

I am asking for $15,000.00, less than the total cost of the project. I will cover the rest of the expenses myself. I need you to become part of this project, to help me make the best possible recording. 

Check out the perks you will get for contributing. There is a lot there to like.

If I do not receive all the money I ask for I will use what I get to pay the musicians, and the recording and mastering engineers. This will leave me to cover the post production costs myself. I'll figure it out and get it done. I am fully committed to getting this record out into the world.

story:
Forts comme le vent du fleuve !!!

  • Un chemin sinueux de presque 10 années à sillonner le Québec, région par région, personne par personne. Les sourires au rendez-vous, les foules généreuses qui nous donnent toujours le goût de l'être nous aussi.
  • Un spectacle que plusieurs  considèrent comme le meilleur qu'il aient eu l'occasion de voir depuis l'époque des boîtes à chansons...
  • 7 musiciens sur scène et des harmonies vocales à couper le souffle
  • Votre coup de main est important pour nous permettre de tenir le cap sur les vraies choses, les vraies poignées de mains et les trésors perdus du langage québécois. 
  • Aidez-nous à rester des chercheurs de joyaux qui se cachent dans les régions de notre patrie. Aidez-nous à aller vous voir encore et encore pour faire, avec notre coeur en entier, une musique parfaitement adaptée à vos oreilles de prospecteurs de bonheur...

5000 $ pour faire quoi ?

  • 1500 $ pour faire dupliquer de nouveaux albums parce que vous avez acheté tous ceux qu'on avait en stock.
  • 500 $ pour faire imprimer des affiches sur du papier recyclé pour que vous puissiez nous voir la face un peu d'avance et vous préparer à notre venue.
  • 1000 $ pour gosser à la main de nouveaux clips
  • 2000 $ pour les relations de presse et la publicité de notre tournée que nous assumons habituellement en entier. Eh oui, nous avons fait le choix d'être indépendants...

Pourquoi nous aider ? 

  • Parce que la musique indépendante a sa place dans notre société
  • Parce que notre musique se veut porteuse de l'héritage d'un parlé québécois qui perd des plumes
  • Parce que en encourageant un groupe qui veut demeurer libre dans ses actions culturelles, vous encouragez aussi d'autres groupes à emprunter le même chemin en montrent aux gens que l'industrie musicale québécoise ne se trouve pas seulement dans nos téléviseurs et  nos radios...
  • Parce que le Québec est grand et que nous voulons avoir les moyens d'aller rencontrer le gens des régions éloignées aussi. 
  • Parce que nous finançons nous-même tous nos projets sans l'aides de subventions gouvernementales
Vous donnez, on donne aussi !!!

Comme nous voulons que vous soyez aussi gagnants que nous en prenant le pari de nous aider financièrement, chaque don que vous ferez impliquera une action de notre part envers vous. Vous donnez et nous donnons aussi.

Comment ?   Voici quelques articles que vous pouvez vous procurer dans notre magasin général : 
  • Une photo signée par les membres du groupe
  • Une affiche signée par tous les membres de la formation
  • Un album signé de tous les membres
  • Un cours d'harmonica de 75 minutes avec Dave Harmo
  • Une participation pour 2 à une de nos sessions vidéos en 2015
  • Entrée gratuite à tous nos concerts et accès backstage durant 3 ans
  • Un concert du groupe dans votre salon ou votre cour

D'autres façons d'aider

  • Partager cette page à tous vos amis
  • Une contribution volontaire de 1$ à 100$
  • Du bon vieux bouches à oreilles comme dans le temps
  • Aller sur FACEBOOK aimer notre page et inviter des amis à l'aimer aussi

story:
I'm raising money to record an EP at the locally-run analogue studio, Bottle Garden. It's run by local musicians, Free Love Fenner, so your donations would be helping them too!

I want to record a 5 song EP, and do a launch at Cagibi on June 6th.

Donations would help with recording and being able to make tapes and launch them, as well as assist my budget so I can go play a few shows in Vancouver and Toronto and share my music!

Thank you!

Freelovefenner.com

Soundcloud.com/ceilidhmichelle

story:
Well Hello There, Friends and Future Contributors! 

 We're Rockwell's Ghost, southern West Virginia's very own, calls-it-like-we-sees-it, punk rock quartet!  We've been around for a few years with one full-length LP under our belts and we're looking to get some new sweet and sultry rock anthems to those earholes of yours, posthaste!

What We Need & What You Get

We've started this Indiegogo campaign in hopes that you fine folks would be so inclined as to help us raise a little dough.  Said dough will be used to fund the recording of our new record and to order a slew of some brand new, long-awaited Rockwell's Ghost merch!  We will be trying our damnedest to tempt you (our fans, friends, and family), to dust off the old credit card and/or PayPal account and contribute.  We've set our goal at $2,800.00.  This should be enough to payoff the studio and the folks printing the album with a bit left over for new shirts, stickers, buttons, and patches!  If our goal isn't met the album will still limp it's way to the finish line, but the merch may have to wait.  Fear not, however, for we will still get enough goodies together to fulfill our perks!

And perks they are!  We'll be offering everything from CD/t-shirt/sticker/button/patch combos to paintings by members of the band, exclusive studio outtakes, handwritten lyric sheets, private shows, and more!

...Oh, and just so you know, all of the perks at the $15.00 mark and above include the new album!

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, if ya ain't got the funds, we understand.  I mean, why in the hell do you think we've started this Indiegogo campaign?  But sharing this page and telling your friends and family about this awesome band you know that's trying to raise some money is 100% free of charge!  So spread the word and let's get this thing going!

story:
For those of you that know me, you will know that my road has been long, and very challenging.

I have spent nearly all of the last 2 years on the road as a street musician. In that time I have played in

181 places in Europe.

The only break more than a couple of weeks was when I was sick with testicular cancer, at the end of 2013. This only served to make me more determined :)

This has truly been a challenging road, but also one I have grown on.

I can say that every song I have written, is a direct result of the lifestyle, the people I have met, and the road I have been on.

Support will mean that I can not only record the album in Wales, but also release it on Itunes and CD and hopefully promote it.

All help is truly appreciated, more than I could ever say.

This only served to make me more determined :) This has truly been a challenging road, but also one I have grown on.I can say that every song I have written, is a direct result of the lifestyle, the people I have met, and the road I have been on.Support will mean that I can not only record the album in Wales, but also release it on Itunes and CD and hopefully promote it.All help is truly appreciated, more than I could ever say.

story:
Hey, we skip the boring usual speech, but here is the situation: we are Douglas First, a rock band based in Berlin. We are 4 guys from France, Germany and Netherlands, playing together since 2 years. 

The project grew incredibly fast last year, as we worked like crazy to write, arrange and record the 10 songs you will discover on our first album : Seeds.

Now we arrive to the point where we need your help to finalise this project and to make ourselves a name in the amazing Berlin!


What We Need & What You Get

As you can imagine, releasing and promoting an album is not for free. We already invested our money for studio rehearsing, recording sessions, mixing, mastering, graphic design, video clips and photo shootings.

Now we need your help for the last steps:

- manufacturing of the album (1000 copies): 1800€
- promotion (flyers / stickers / merch / booking / communication) : 700€
--> they will help us get new contacts (press, radios, web), to book concerts more easily and most of all, to make our music be heard! 

-> sum to raise : 2500€

The Impact

Here comes the fun part ! In exchange for your generous donation, you will get some incredible rewards.

You can pick your present : from an heart whelming hug to a private concert in your own house, or from a signed album to a private music lesson with one of us, you'll have plenty of choice.

Just do your shopping in the list on the right side of this page.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're religious, you can pray for us.
If you believe in Karma, here is your good investment.
If you are rich, just pick up the biggest donation possible.
If you are greedy, then what are you doing on this crowdfunding page?
If you wanna help, but cannot afford it, we would really appreciate you to share this link, and like our facebook page : https://www.facebook.com/douglasfirstmusic

Whoever you are, we thank you a million times


Traduction en français des contreparties :

5€ : code de téléchargement de l'album
15€ : album signé (frais de port Europe uniquement)
20€ : album signé (frais de port monde)
30€ : album signé + vidéo de remerciement + inédit acoustique à télécharger
45€ : 2 entrées pour notre concert de sortie d'album à Berlin l'automne + album signé + inédit acoustique à télécharger
75€ : un morceau live par skype avec Fabien + album signé + inédit acoustique
100€ : 3 morceaux live par skype avec Fabien + album signé + inédit acoustique
100€ : 2 entrées pour concert à Berlin + invitation pour assister à une répé OU lesson de musique (guitare ou basse ou batterie) avec un membre du groupe
200€ : concert privé par skype ave tout le groupe (4 morceaux) + album signé
400€ : concert privé chez vous (frais non inclus) + album signé
600€ : guitare acoustique signée par les membres du groupe + album signé
800€ : vidéo du groupe jouant une reprise de votre choix + album signé + morceau inédit acoustique
1000€ : guitare signée + vidéo du groupe jouant une reprise de votre choix + album signé

The project grew incredibly fast last year, as we worked like crazy to write, arrange and record the 10 songs you will discover on our first album : Seeds.
Now we arrive to the point where we need your help to finalise this project and to make ourselves a name in the amazing Berlin!
  What We Need & What You Get As you can imagine, releasing and promoting an album is not for free. We already invested our money for studio rehearsing, recording sessions, mixing, mastering, graphic design, video clips and photo shootings.
Now we need your help for the last steps:
- manufacturing of the album (1000 copies): 1800€- promotion (flyers / stickers / merch / booking / communication) : 700€--> they will help us get new contacts (press, radios, web), to book concerts more easily and most of all, to make our music be heard! 
-> sum to raise : 2500€
    The Impact Here comes the fun part ! In exchange for your generous donation, you will get some incredible rewards.
You can pick your present : from an heart whelming hug to a private concert in your own house, or from a signed album to a private music lesson with one of us, you'll have plenty of choice.
Just do your shopping in the list on the right side of this page.

    Other Ways You Can Help If you're religious, you can pray for us.If you believe in Karma, here is your good investment.If you are rich, just pick up the biggest donation possible.If you are greedy, then what are you doing on this crowdfunding page?If you wanna help, but cannot afford it, we would really appreciate you to share this link, and like our facebook page : https://www.facebook.com/douglasfirstmusic

Whoever you are, we thank you a million times
Traduction en français des contreparties :
5€ : code de téléchargement de l'album15€ : album signé (frais de port Europe uniquement)20€ : album signé (frais de port monde)30€ : album signé + vidéo de remerciement + inédit acoustique à télécharger45€ : 2 entrées pour notre concert de sortie d'album à Berlin l'automne + album signé + inédit acoustique à télécharger75€ : un morceau live par skype avec Fabien + album signé + inédit acoustique100€ : 3 morceaux live par skype avec Fabien + album signé + inédit acoustique100€ : 2 entrées pour concert à Berlin + invitation pour assister à une répé OU lesson de musique (guitare ou basse ou batterie) avec un membre du groupe200€ : concert privé par skype ave tout le groupe (4 morceaux) + album signé400€ : concert privé chez vous (frais non inclus) + album signé600€ : guitare acoustique signée par les membres du groupe + album signé800€ : vidéo du groupe jouant une reprise de votre choix + album signé + morceau inédit acoustique1000€ : guitare signée + vidéo du groupe jouant une reprise de votre choix + album signé

story:
Not Your Granny’s Dulcimer, a CD and Video Project by John Sheckler

A funny thing happened on my way to becoming a musical performer…  My music became a huge hit with children and their parents.

When I perform, I always have a bag of percussion “toys” children can use to join the music. That bag includes musical spoons, shakers and gourd “crickets” I have made. They also have the opportunity for a fun sing-a-long on “Pretty Barn” and several other songs I have written.

Some other songs, like Ground Hog, allow me to work the names of the children into the lyrics. “Yonder comes Sally with a ten foot pole, shove that ground hog back in his hole.”

The greatest joy I receive from performing is when a parent comes back to tell me that their child is always withdrawn, even autistic, but I was able to break them out of their shell. One time, I sat next to a blind teenager girl and guided her hand across the dulcimer fret board and gave her the opportunity to play a simple song.

Hello, my name is John Sheckler, and when I retired from a career in journalism, life gave me more time to devote to my second artistic love, music.

The mountain dulcimer is my primary instrument, and I write many of my songs. My music transcends the traditional music style that is usually associated with the dulcimer, so my performances and first CD are called “Not Your Granny’s Dulcimer.” 

Many times when I perform or write songs, I feel it is not me playing the music, but rather, it is the music playing me. That music has pulled me in a very specific direction. It is a joyful experience, and I feel blessed to be able to share that experience with other people.

My performances are in the interactive style of street musicians and always include a few surprises. My audience will hear mountain standards like “Old Joe Clark” or “Little Liza Jane,” but then I try to take the music to unexpected places. One of my songs is a happy song about wind chimes written to the music of the Pachelbel Canon in D.

I will stop to tell tales about the origin of the instrument and music, and even take time to give an impromptu lesson to an audience member.

My goal for this project is to create a video and CD of Children’s songs that I can use as a musical resume’ to approach schools and community service organizations. I want to take my performances into the class rooms and more festivals so that I can reach the widest possible audience.

A Facebook quote from a friend sums up what I try to accomplish:”What a gift you are John. Not only are you good with bringing the music out of children, you also have the gift to bring the inner child out of the adults.” Gigi Straub

Where the Money Goes

My budget has no frills. It includes only the basic production and printing costs necessary to create and print CDs and a video that I will use to promote my performances. If I receive donations in excess of my goal, the extra money will go directly into printing a larger number of CDs, or more video.

The largest single cost is for the printing of the CDs through Disc Makers Manufacturing. I have selected the lowest cost packing option. No expensive plastic cases, just a simple earth friendly cardboard disc case.

Print 1,000 CDs, (includes set up costs)  $1,050, 

Recording production costs  $100

Video costs    $200

Transportation and other   $100

Estimated Indiegogo fee  $125

TOTAL    $1,575

How You Can Help:

Spread the word!  Raising funds to meet the budget is one vital and tangible way you can help. But there are other ways, too. As you pass the word on to your network of friends and family, you're reaching people and places I could never reach alone.

  •   "Favorite" this IndieGoGo page to stay in the loop, and use the Indiegogo        share tools.
  •   "Like" my “Not Your Granny’s Dulcimer” page, and share it with your friends.
  •   Hit like, then Link, Post and Share on all your social networks. 
  •   Pull up the video on your phone or tablet and show to your friends.
  •   Email your friends.
  •   Forward this page to your favorite blogs, websites, magazines, and public radio and television stations -- particularly those interested in music, arts, and supporting traditional music
  •   Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.  Introduce music fans to me and tell them about the CD and my performances.

The Impact

  • In these days of standardized testing, many schools are no longer able to have music programs. Local folk culture has also fallen by the wayside. My ultimate goal with this project is to have marketing material that will allow me to approach schools and libraries seeking visiting performers to offset that loss of arts education.
  • My music is already a regular part of several folk music and community art festivals, so I have celebrated a degree of success. If I can widen that base, it will allow me to share the joy of music with a wider audience.

What people are saying about Not Your Granny’s Dulcimer

“John Sheckler is one of the most enthusiastic performers and music lovers I’ve ever known. His energy is vital to the RiverRoots Music and Folk Arts Festival and he manages the Folk Jammers tent with grace, making all comers feel welcome to participate.

As a performer his main instrument, the lap dulcimer, is transformed from a traditional folk and “old time” musical instrument to a creative and innovative piece of musical expression. He fearlessly explores a multitude of genres, playing them all with passion on an instrument most people pigeon-hole in a very “past” context.”

Greg Ziesemer, RiverRoots Music and Folk Arts Festival Director


“John Sheckler is a fun guy!  He never met a stranger or a song he didn't like. His unassuming personal charm flies into his music.  It is always an enjoyable time with him!”

Steve Thomas, Thomas Family Winery


“John Sheckler's passion for the dulcimer and his ability to play an array of styles of music has provided an enlightening experience for our patrons. He focuses a lot on crowd interaction and participation, which adds to the enjoyment of all.  He will continue to be a part of the diversity in the musical talent we provide.” 

Teresa Weyler, Little Kentucky River Winery


“John Sheckler is a delight to work with and brings a fabulous interactive performance for our attendees at New Albany IndieFest.  Parents and children alike gather to listen to original songs as well as old classics.  It is wonderful to see how fascinated the children are with the multitude of instruments that John brings and to see them learn and explore the music.  We look forward to inviting John and his dulcimer back to the IndieFest for many years to come."

Cisa Barry, New Albany First


We have many things to offer for people who attend the Ferdinand Folk Festival. One of our main attractions--and the only one to recur each of the four years we've held our growing music fest--is the Folk Jammers' area where musicians, from beginning to highly skilled, are encouraged to bring their own instruments and jam over the course of the day.

John Sheckler's great leadership in leading this event year after year is, no doubt, the key to the event. He has a passion for all types of music and, perhaps most importantly, allowing all skill levels to play. His skill at, to be certain, mastering of the lap dulcimer is key to this success. He is a musician's musician and I have no doubt that his skill at leading the Folk Jammers is surpassed only by his skill at performing as a solo artist.

We have continued and will always extend a welcome in Ferdinand to John Sheckler and count him as a friend to Ferdinand and our rising cultural scene.

Marc Steczyk, Ferdinand Folk Festival Director


A Facebook quote from a friend sums up what I try to accomplish:

”What a gift you are John. Not only are you good with bringing the music out of children, you also have the gift to bring the inner child out of the adults.”

Gigi Straub
