story:
Gaetano Pellino

I have been taking my own passion for the good rock-blues music around the world for thirty years now - a daily challenge that has been rewarded by the pleasure and the enthusiasm of those who got to know me in the street, on the major festival stages, in the sweaty, smoky corners of the small clubs I played in. 

Today, 26 years from the release of my first demo tape as a trio, I decided to make a dream come true. I will be leaving for the land where my music was born, recruit a couple of musicians I will get acquainted with over time and record with them may be in a rented secluded farmhouse all the original material I need for my new album. 

Even though my own little recording studio is perfectly equipped to make CDs and I know many a musician who could help me with that, the challenge is now going for the adventure - no comfy hotels, no elegant recording studios - just new persons to meet and share musical ideas with. This is why your help is essential - "Wherever I lay my Strat.. That's home"!


Da oltre trent'anni porto in giro per il mondo la mia passione per la buona musica rock-blues. Una sfida di tutti i giorni ripagata soprattutto dalla gioia e dall'entusiasmo di chi mi ha incontrato per le strade, sui palchi dei grandi festival così come negli angoli sudati e fumosi dei piccoli clubs. 

Oggi, a distanza di ventisei anni dalla realizzazione del mio primo demotape in trio, ho deciso di realizzare un vecchio sogno: quello di partire per la terra dove la mia musica è nata e reclutare un paio di musicisti che avrò occasione di conoscere lungo la strada, affittare un casolare isolato e registrare con loro quanto più materiale inedito possibile per realizzare il mio nuovo CD.  

Io nel mio piccolo studio dispongo di tutto quello che serve a realizzare i miei dischi e di musicisti bravi ne conosco, ma la sfida sta proprio nel partire all'avventura, non appoggiandosi a comodi hotels ed eleganti studi di registrazione, nel conoscere persone nuove e condividere con loro le idee musicali. E' per questo che il tuo aiuto diventa indispensabile! Perché "Wherever I lay my Strat.. that's my home"!


What I Need & What You Get

Even though it will be sort of an escapade and carried out on a strict rock bottom, "on the road" attitude, such an endeavor will need funding. After all, and besides the cost of a plane ticket, it will be a two-month stay in the US with quite a few people to reward for their time and collaboration in developing musical ideas that at the moment are just in the beginning stages. 

As a contributor, you will be able to help in more than one way - from a simple minimum donation to the purchase of a collection of my previously released CDs, merchandising, and obviously the chance to get advance sale the album I will be producing through this fundraising campaign. Don't worry about the difference of currency: Paypal will automatically convert it.

The bigger the amount I get, the longer the time I will be dedicating to this album and the better the quality of the musicians I will be able to recruit. If you are acquainted with my music you already know how much passion and attention I put on the making of my albums - so your help can really make the difference! If you are not, then this is a great opportunity to catch up by receiving at home from one to seven CDs - my whole artistic career, many years of music and energy spread worldwide. 

Now you can be part of all this and your name will be included in the contributors list within the CD booklet.


Un viaggio del genere, sebbene al'insegna dell'avventura e dello spirito "on the road" ha bisogno di essere finanziato. In fondo, biglietto aereo a parte, si tratta di restare negli Stati Uniti per due mesi, coinvolgere più persone che collaboreranno con me e che comunque andranno in qualche modo premiate per il tempo che spenderanno a sviluppare le varie idee, al momento solo in embrione.

Ci sono svariati modi con cui potrai offrire il tuo contributo. Si parte dalla semplice minima donazione all'acquisto dei vari CD da me pubblicati in passato, merchandising e ovviamente la possibilità di acquistare in prevendita l'album che questa campagna servirà a realizzare. Una volta scelta la forma con cui vorrai contribuire il sito ti condurrà su Paypal dove potrai utilizzare una qualunque carta di credito, anche ricaricabile ed anche senza avere un account. Il limite lo decidi solo tu!

Maggiore sarà la cifra che con il tuo aiuto sarò in grado di raggiungere, maggiore sarà il tempo che potrò dedicare alla realizzazione del CD, così come migliore sarà la qualità dei musicisti che potrò coinvolgere. Se conosci la mia musica di certo capirai quanto io sia appassionato e meticoloso nella realizzazione dei miei album. Il tuo aiuto può davvero fare la differenza! Se invece ancora non la conosci, questa è una buona occasione per farlo e per ricevere a casa tua da uno fino a ben sette CD che raccontano tutto il mio percorso artistico e tanti anni vissuti a portare musica ed energia in tutto il mondo. 

Ora puoi essere parte di tutto questo e il tuo nome verrà incluso nel libretto del CD insieme a tutti quelli che hanno contribuito alla realizzazione!


Other Ways You Can Help

Besides contributing practically, help me contacting and informing whomever you think could be involved in this venture, spread the voice! Share and circulate this plea among those you think should get to know my music, my project and myself! There are many ways to do it and the media are there to be used. Help to make this dream come true!

Oltre a contribuire praticamente, aiutami nel creare una certa eco a tutto questo. Chiunque tu conosca che possa in qualche modo partecipare a questa iniziativa, può venirne al corrente tramite te. Condividi e divulga questa cosa il più possibile, con chiunque tu ritenga debba conoscere me, la mia musica ed il mio progetto. Ci sono molti modi per farlo e i mezzi mediatici non mancano. Help to make it real!

Condividi e divulga questa cosa il più possibile, con chiunque tu ritenga debba conoscere me, la mia musica ed il mio progetto. Ci sono molti modi per farlo e i mezzi mediatici non mancano. Help to make it real!

story:
English version after the french one.

-------------------------------------

Bonjour à tous.

Je me présente, je m'appelle Jonathan Bouchard et je suis un Canadien de 38 ans. Pour tout savoir de ma vie et de mes réalisations, consulter mon site personnel, JonathanBouchard.ca

Je suis le fondateur du projet TacticalFM, né le premier janvier 2007. Le but du projet est simple, s'informer en dénonçant la désinformation.

Ceci paraît simple... mais par où commence-t-on quand on veut s'informer? Votre premier réflexe sera de consulter votre site de nouvelles préféré, un site disons X. Vous découvrirez un peu plus tard, un autre site, Y celui-là, et ainsi de suite. Par contre, il est humainement impossible de parcourir l'alphabet des sites d'information et ce chaque jour, en plus du travail, du temps familial, etc...

C'est ici que TacticalFM entre en action.

D'accord, il y a les engins de recherche et leur section “Actualités” mais vous aurez encore une liste bâtie par un robot (programme informatique) et vous verrez que la séparation entre nouvelle officielle et blog se dissipe avec le temps dans les résultats de recherche..

Vraiment, LA solution pour avoir le meilleur de l'actualité mondiale, c'est la page d'accueil de TacticalFM.com

Notre centre de surveillance de l'actualité est né en 2011. Il s'agit simplement d'une banque de liens d'actualité; c'est l'endroit où ceux inscrits au jeu des Chevaliers de l'information rapportent ce qu'ils ont chassés.

Sans aller dans le détail du jeu, le moteur de TacticalFM, ce qui est capable de bâtir cette liste de nouvelles mondiales, est en fait un puissant système d'auto-apprentissage de l'information par le jeu. On gagne des points d'expérience en s'intéressant à l'actualité mondiale pour ultimement animer dans l'émission talk radio en direct des Chevaliers de l'information.

Il est carrément impossible d'expliquer l'entièreté du projet rapidement, le mieux c'est d'y faire un tour, tacticalfm.com.

Donc voilà, le but sur TacticalFM.com est de s'informer entre amis.

S'informer, mais pas n'importe comment... je parle ici évidemment de financement, le nerf de la guerre. TacticalFM n'est pas une entreprise et ne reçoit aucune subvention du gouvernement.. Il n'y a pas de publicité sur TacticalFM.com et ce pour une raison: nous croyons que les concepts d'information et consommation ne doivent pas se mélanger et qu'il vaut mieux éviter la naissance même de quelconque conflit d'intérêt, en supprimant à la source cette possibilité.

De la publicité sur TacticalFM, mise à part celle locale de promotion du site et des émissions, il n'y en a pas. Vous n'êtes pas sur TacticalFM pour acheter quelque chose et nous en sommes conscients, vous voulez vous informer, point.

Tenir mordicus au principe de ne pas mélanger publicité et information nuit donc à notre financement... bien malgré nous. À ce moment, la solution IndieGogo est donc l'idéale pour le projet TacticalFM.

Avec vous et le principe de CrowdFunding, le projet prendra une expansion magnifique: des bureaux officiels, des salaires pour ceux qui y travaillent à temps plein.... Une vision que j'ai depuis bien des années et qui va maintenant prendre forme grâce à vous, j'en suis certain.

Pour bien faire les choses, il faut prendre son temps. Maintenant que nous avons un système fiable et une base de données bien remplie, nous désirons passer à une vitesse supérieure pour le projet pour 2015.

Pour l'instant, nous n'avons pas de bureau, c'est connu que je fais tout avec mon matériel personnel dans un studio qui n'en est pas un, chez moi.

Maintenant, la situation est critique... Après 7 ans de travail acharné, malgré les quelques dons réguliers que je reçois et la régularité du salaire familial au total, le coût de la vie a trop augmenté et je ne peux plus suivre. Croyez-moi, j'ai une modeste vie, je n'abuse de rien, j'achète local... nous essayons du mieux que nous pouvons.

Le premier projet que je propose sur IndieGogo servira à démontrer que l'information pour vous, c'est important. Quand je parle d'information, je ne parle pas des nouvelles du showbizz ou du sport, mais des vraies nouvelles mondiales qui changent nos vies.

Le problème est que si la tendance se maintient, je ne serai plus en mesure d'être à temps plein (et bien plus) sur le projet.

Nous avions planifié de faire ce vidéo beaucoup plus tard, en 2015, mais il a fallu nous rendre à l'évidence, la situation de plusieurs d'entre nous est critique. Nous devons donner un grand coup afin que le projet s'épanouisse vraiment comme il se doit au lieu de le voir se ralentir dans un perpétuel futur incertain... l'information ça n'attend pas!

Cette pré-campagne 2015 a pour but de me fournir une sécurité personnelle afin que je puisse librement et à temps plein assurer l'avenir de TacticalFM.com et de mes Chevaliers de l'information. Cette campagne de financement très importante servira de tremplin pour 2015.

La vie coûte très cher, j'en suis conscient c'est pourquoi je vous remercie d'avance de votre contribution... c'est un cri du coeur que je lance pour qu'enfin le projet TacticalFM prenne l'envol qu'ìl mérite.

Merci à tous et merci de votre visite sur TacticalFM.com

Jonathan Bouchard

Peace

-------------------------------------

Hello to all.


I introduce myself, my name is Jonathan Bouchard 38 and I am a Canadian. To know everything about my life and my work, please visit my personal website, JonathanBouchard.ca

I am the founder of the TacticalFM, created January first 2007. The purpose of the project is simple, world news and misinformation denounciation.

This seems simple... but where do you start when you you do not want to miss any world news? Your first instinct will be to visit your favorite news site, a site “X”. You will discover a little later, another site “Y”, and so on. By cons, it is humanly impossible to navigate the all news websites and this, every day, in addition to work, family time, etc.

It is here where TacticalFM step right into action.

Of course, there are search engines and their "News" section, but you'll still have a list built by a robot (computer program) and you'll see that the separation between official news blogs dissipates over time in the search results.

Really, the solution to get all the important world events, it's the home page of TacticalFM.com

Our monitoring center was born in 2011 and is simply a database of world news links; This is where those enrolled in the Knights of news game drop what they hunted, the news.

Without going into the details of the KoN game engine of TacticalFM, which builds the list of world news, is actually a powerful world news self-learning system. We earn experience points and level up and ultimately become a radio host in our live talk radio broadcast, the Knights of news.

It is simply impossible to quickly explain the entire project, the best you can do is visit us on tacticalfm.com.

Basically, TacticalFM.com goal is to develop our taste for world news.

Informed yes, but not at all cost. I'm talking about funding, the nerve of war. TacticalFM is not a business and receives no government funding. There is no advertising on TacticalFM.com and for one reason: We believe the information (news) and consumption concepts should not mix and it is better to avoid the very birth of any conflict of interest by removing at the source that possibility.

There is no advertising on TacticalFM.com, except our own promotion. You're not on TacticalFM to buy something and we are aware of that, you want to be informed, period.

We hold tight to the principle of not mixing advertising and information, but this makes things harder. At this time, the IndieGoGo solution is ideal for the TacticalFM project.

With you and the principle of crowdfunding, the project will make a wonderful expansion: offices, wages for those who work full time .... A vision I have for many years and that will now take shape through to you, I'm sure.

It takes time to realize a project like this. Now that we have a reliable system and a generous news database, in 2015 we want to go to a higher speed with the project.

For the moment, we have no office, it is known that I do everything with my own equipment in a pseudo-studio, at my home.

Now the situation is critical ... After 7 years of hard work, despite some regular donations that I receive and the regularity of the total family income, the cost of living has increased too much and I can not keep up. Believe me, I have a modest life, I spend wisely, I buy local the most I can... we try as best we can.

The first project I propose on IndieGoGo will demonstrate that information is important for you . When I say information, I'm not talking about show business news and sports, but real world news that change our lives.

The problem is that if the trend continues, I will not be able to be full-time (and more) on the project anymore.

We had planned to make this video much later, in 2015, but we had to face the facts, the situation of many of us is critical. We must give a big boost to the project so it really flourish as it should instead of slowing down in a perpetual uncertain future... worls news can not wait!

This pre-campaign 2015 is to provide personal security for me so that I can freely and fully secure the future for me and my Knights. This very important crowdfunding campaign will serve as a springboard for 2015.

Life is very expensive, I am aware and that is why I thank you in advance for your input ... it is a scream from the heart to finally take the TacticalFM project where it really belongs, available and known by everyone.

Thank you all for visiting TacticalFM.com

Jonathan Bouchard

Peace

story:
Hyperion Ensemble 

  • is  Chamber music ensemble  It was founded in 1976 by composer Iancu Dumitrescu and specializes in the performance of contemporary classical music, more particular it is the main promoter in Romania of the Spectral Music trend. HYPERION has attained universal prominence due to the openness, force and originality of its creations, being considered, from USA to Japan, and from South Africa to Chile or Korea, as the laboratory of daring and original musical contributions.  Renewed once more, Hyperion International is today a reunion of musicians from all over the world. 


  • This year Hyperion International ensemble is once more invited to perform in the George Enescu festival. - one of the most prestigious in Europe. But due to massive cuts in fundings the Festival will be unable to support the artists journey from different countries to Bucharest,

    Our team has musicians from all over the world,


  • Issued from alternative or classical music, written or improvised milieu, from electroacoustic or electronic cultures, from Eastern, Western Europe and Middle Orient ,their reunion demonstrate the integrative idea which is the centerpiece of our project

  • But in order to meet, to rehearse and perform we need to travel!

    Therefore we need your support for this stunning ensemble!


          


The team:

Maya Dunietz - Flute, piano (Israel), Tim Hodgkinson - clarinet, bass clarinet ( U,K), Jonathan Silver - bass clarinet ( UK-Israel), Orban Godri - bassoon (Romania), Tiberiu Cenuser - trombone (Romania), Eran Sachs -no-input mixer (Israel), Colin Hacklander - percussion (Germany), Alex Jonovic -percussion (Israel), Philippe Petit - turntables (France), Stephen O'Malley -  electric guitar (USA), Ioan-Marius Lacraru - viola (Romania), Andrei Kivu - cello (France), Adam Scheflan, Shmil Frankel - double bass (Israel). Conductors Ana-Maria Avram, Iancu Dumitrescu ( Romania ), Ilan Volkov (Israel)


The program:

World and Romanian premieres by contemporary and experimental composers connected to spectral music trend: Giacinto Scelsi, Iannis Xenakis, Horatiu Radulescu, Ana-Maria Avram, Iancu Dumitrescu

The context

The official page of George Enescu festival

The festival is organised every two years, in the month of September during a two-three weeks period and includes symphonic and chamber concerts, recitals, opera and ballet performances in the main venues of the city of Bucharest and sometimes also in other historic cities 

Even Hyperion Ensemble is invited,  it probably can't participate to the festival. Why? 

Unfortunately, contemporary and experimental music, and the local composers of international proeminence, as well as ensembles  dedicated to experimental music are underrepresented in this festival, dedicated  mostly to classical music and targeting  an aging audience.

On the contrary, the presences of Hyperion ensemble in the former editions of the festival were followed by a young and enthousiastic audience, very different from the general audience of the festival. 

The Needed Budget:

- Six roundtrips from Tel-Aviv to Bucharest, for the Israeli resident artists: Ilan VOLKOV, Maya DUNIETZ, Eran SACHS, Alex JONOVIC, Shmil FRANKEL, Adam SCHEFLAN. The lowest price would be around US 350 per person, so a total of $2100

- Six roundtrips from different EU cities to Bucharest: 2 roundtrips from london ( Yoni SILVER and Tim HODGKINSON), 3 roundtrips from Paris ( Andrei KIVU, Philippe PETIT and Stephen O'MALLEY),  1 roundtrip from BERLIN ( Colin HACKLANDER). The lowest average price is $150, which makes a total budget of $3000.

WHY TO FOUND THIS PROJECT? 

1. Becuse it is an innovative project. The idea of gathering together artists from  different backgrounds, different musical cultures, sharing their skills together in rehearsals and concerts of innovative music is brilliant and  rewarding. 

2. because it's important for the music of the present , alive, anti-establishment, the visionary music to  exist not only in underground context but also in the prestigeous festivals, in  good concert halls, with an important visibility and good technical conditions. The innovative music has to be respected as well as the music of the museums.

3. Because the project encourages to develop a common international  musical space and provide the audience with better access, understanding and reception of the actual music It encourage the mobility of artists and artistic exchange, the transnational dissemination of works incorporating digital technologies and innovative artistic practices It will  foster the dialogue of artists - performers, composers and audiences.  It promotes the dialogue between various actual  music currents.


-

The innovative music has to be respected as well as the music of the museums.
3. Because the project encourages to develop a common international  musical space and provide the audience with better access, understanding and reception of the actual music It encourage the mobility of artists and artistic exchange, the transnational dissemination of works incorporating digital technologies and innovative artistic practices It will  foster the dialogue of artists - performers, composers and audiences.  It promotes the dialogue between various actual  music currents.


-

story:
ABOUT US:
The World Over was created in 2013 by some hooligans living in Los Angeles. Xavier Moreux(Rhythm Guitar) and Tiaday Ball(Vocals) created the band while attending music school together. They recruited lead guitarist, Ryan Knecht, Eric Gledhill for bass and vocals, and Anthony Dellaripa on drums. They, together, conceptualized a band who could represent many different cultures and promote messages of hope and empowerment. Within one year of forming, TWO collaborated with former Escape the Fate guitarist Omar Espinosa to create “Rampart District” EP now available for purchase on iTunes, Amazon, Spotify, Google Play, etc.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Every touring band needs their chariot to get them around. We need at least $2,500 to buy a van to get us through the west coast with all of our equipment safely (without breaking down). 
  • That's where you come in! If you donate to our campaign, we'll send you a free download of the "RAMPART DISTRICT" EP! 
  • Depending on how much you donate (See section "Perks"), you can choose your prize of choice from the following: Personal thank you video from the whole band, FREE music lesson from a band member of your choice, shout-out on stage (if attending one of our gigs), backstage pass to hangout and get to know the whole band, and/or FREE ticket to one of our shows near you!

    The Impact

    With your help, we can build a bigger following and tour the West Coast! 
    Our last campaign on Indiegogo to pay for the "RAMPART DISTRICT" EP was a HUGE success and we greatly appreciate every donation received. 

      Risks & Challenges

      The road across the West Coast will be tough and strenuous on all of us. But with your help, the journey can become a lot easier and we can get to your location much faster. Every donation, even a mere dollar, brings us one step closer to our goal of bringing great shows to the people of the West Coast. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Even if you absolutely can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

        • Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
        • You can share this campaign with the indiegogo share tools :)

        Thank you for your support!

        -The World Over

story:
Hey everyone!  My name is Mathias Michael and I am a budding Christian musician from Maryland.  I am twenty years old and this past year I transitioned from full-time college student to full time musician.  When I was a senior in high school, I was fortunate enough to win a competition at the National Catholic Youth Conference in Indianapolis, Indiana.  As a result of my winning, I was given the opportunity to record my very first album, "I Believe."  Upon releasing this album, I was immediately thrust into the wonderful world of youth ministry.  For the past two years, I have been traveling the country singing and speaking to youth about God's amazing love.

  During my ministry travels I have met many people, seen amazing things, and grown so much closer to God.  He has blessed me abundantly and I am just beginning to see the fruits of these blessings.  One of these fruits has been a burst of inspiration in my songwriting.  Since the day I released my first album, I have been working tirelessly to write more material for album number two.  After two years, I'm ready to get to the studio!  This is where my Indiegogo campaign comes into play.  Studio time with a quality producer is expensive these days.   Not only does the artist have to pay for use of studio space, but other expenses include airfare, music gear, lodging, and food.  These are the essentials, and I need YOUR help to make this project happen!

  By contributing to my fundraising efforts, you are able to help me minister to today's youth.  I work hard to provide quality music to the young church.  I believe that through good music, Christ's message of love can reach the most hardened of hearts.  Your contribution gives me the means to reach the ears of young men and women across America, giving them hope in something greater than themselves.

  Let me break it down...to record an album you need about 12 songs.  Recording and producing ONE song in a quality studio costs about $1200.  So $1200 times 12 songs comes out to about $12,400.  Add travel and equipment expenses on top of that...the costs really add up!  Even if I don't reach my $10,000 goal, every single penny counts!  Every cent raised from this campaign will go towards the production of my next album, be it $20 or $20, 000, I can't do this on my own!

  Here's something else to consider...the amount of time that goes into producing a new album is surprising to many.  Months are spent on recording, mixing, producing, mastering, and making the album a true work of art.  With so much time dedicated to the studio, there isn't much time to go out and generate a second source of income.  Music is my full time job and every day involves me working overtime. The financial rewards that come from a new album do not appear until long after the album is released, and even then, the income is generally used to pay off past studio expenses.  By contributing to my Indiegogo campaign, you not only help ease the burden of a hefty financial load, but you secure my peace of mind when the album finally releases.

   Finally, I understand that some people may not have the means to make a financial contribution.  That is okay!  There's other ways to help me achieve my goal!  First and foremost, please pray for me.  All things are possible through God.  Pray for the people I minister to and pray for the people I work with.  Secondly, please tell all your friends and family about my campaign!  I can only reach so many people...your word of mouth is much appreciated!  Lastly, please go view my social media accounts and encourage your friends and family to do the same!  I'm on Instagram and Facebook and love to keep my contributors updated!

story:
We are Afro-American.

We are Afro-Latino.

We are Afro-European. 


"We are Afro(–)."


54 Days. 


520 individual contributions of $27 or more to fund The Artist, The Image and The INITIATIVE.


An academic year of exploration, discovery and artistic collaboration amongst artists and educators across four continents awaits your support.


Afro(–) is a concept designed to unify musicians, artists and academics: the diasporic movement and cultural development of the African race across North America, South America, Europe, and anywhere else we are.

Pronounced "AfroDASH," the proposed movement serves as a point of reference, a point of inspiration, and a point of CULTURAL INTERCHANGE for musicians and interdisciplinary artists. This long-term collaborative music and performing arts documentation and creation project embodies the spirit of the root that binds us all, removed or un-removed, to the original source of our musical and cultural identities in Africa—both as Afro- people and as non-Afro people that identify with our cultures.

Over the course of two years, Project Afro(–) aims to:
  • Foster a conscious intellectual and artistic exchange amongst people of mixed African descent by creating a platform for the discussion of racial identity based on social circumstances, foreign immigration and mixed-racial influence. Through the building of this collective, we are building a system of teachers and performers  in various languages, musical styles and ethnic backgrounds with whom our community will collaborate. These interactions in the form of classes, discussions, and workshops will be continuously documented using video journals, photo albums, writings and demonstrative concerts. The project proposes to publish a dedicated website and mixtape that depicts this journey of revival, creation and cultural exchange.
  • Collect and publish these documents in digital format in both independently and partnership with one or more academic institutions in our countries in order to serve as a teaching tool for studies in humanities, liberal arts and the performing arts.
  • Finally, develop a diverse performing ensemble of the same name—AfroDASH—of talented performers based out of the culturally-rich center of Madrid, Spain dedicated to the revival, preservation, fusion and, most importantly, the production of these impactful video documents, concerts, community discussions and field recordings both within Madrid and in as many of our home countries to which we can fund travel. Through the teaching and sharing our languages, cultures, and musical traditions, we aim to foster understanding, expand knowledge and inspire social advancement amongst ourselves, our communities and audiences in our native countries.

***NEW: Check out our 2 minute entry into National Geographic's "Expedition Granted" project competition! Finalists are announced on or around September 12 and voting opens on September 16!

***Click HERE to access the Wordpress campaign blog where you will find the FULL project synopsis, see a detailed run-down of funding goals and read periodically posted narrative blog entries by Erin Marisol Corine. Subscribe for more updates along the campaign cycle!

***Para leer una sinopsis completa del proyecto en CASTELLANO, pulsa AQUÍ!***


So, If the goal is not met...

$14,000 USD (Roughly 10.500€—yesterday, anyway... ::serious face::)

Every little bit helps. All funding goals have been outlined in order of importance, and therefore, any donated funds will be a HUGE help towards inter-city moving costs, travel expenses associated with the move (turning 26 last year means that although airline travel is still not as expensive as it could be, it is longer free. I've already cried my tears over this—it's okay). Any additional funds will go towards saving for the purchase of equipment and supplemental living expenses.


...But, Heaven Willing... What if the goal is EXCEEDED???

Not only would this be cause for so many tears of joy, excitement and celebration, but it would mean that less focus can be placed on working odd-jobs to supplement living and project expense and more focus on lifting this incredible vision off of the ground and getting Project #WeAreAfroDASH to more listeners, more educators, more artists, more students—more PEOPLE. 
Funding of the initial Phase I would be an incredible dream-come true—but the funding of our stretch goal would mean more concerts, more collaborations, more travel to find more artists like ourselves, deeper relationships and a more broad reach without so many financial limitations.
There is a campaign stretch goal of $27,000 that would build an additional contingency fund for travels to relevant destinations for interviews, video-logged collaborations and to spread the word about Afro(–) where the people are that can BEST CONTRIBUTE to this cause! We come from so many countries, so many communities and so many backgrounds—my dream is for this project to pull from and to REACH as many of the countless places where our people reside.
Most importantly, it would mean seeing this crazy former band-geek turned world music activist's dreams COME. TRUE.


In lieu of your donation... There ARE other ways to help!

We all know that we live in tough times, and not all of us are financially equipped to help every cause that speaks to our hearts. This is okay, because you know what? I've been blessed enough in my life to have a strong circle of prayer, positive energy, well-wishes and motivation in the form of loving friends and family members for nearly twenty-seven years. There are sometimes tools much more useful than money!

Other ways to support:
  • Are you an artist manager, grant writer, consultant, tax preparer, financial advisor or other image development or advising professional? If so, your TIME and advice is a valuable asset during this pivotal time in my career. Please do not hesitate to reach out via email to offer donations of Skype sessions, in-person consultations and any words of wisdom that you may have to share!
  • Are you professionally connected to a media source? Newspaper? Magazine? YouTube channel? Website? Local News Station? Radio Station? Help me to network and spread the word! The only thing more powerful than how many you know is the influence of each individual that you know!
  • Are you a culturally-focused or otherwise relevant (Natural Hair, African-American arts and Culture, Music, Photography, Arts, etc) magazine source, online or print, that would like to sponsor the YEAR THREE image photo shoot with KORTO Photography in exchange for rights to publish the photos and my story in your magazine? Contact me for details on the specific amount that we are looking for to fund this year's installment in the location that we have chosen!
  • Know of any exciting grant or artist funds that sound like they would be perfect fit for my campaign? Let me know! Send links, emails and contacts this way and I will check them out!
  • Have any second-hand (functioning, gently-used) equipment or un-used software to donate or sell at a discounted price? Please check this Google Document (forthcoming) for a list of "wish list" equipment to see if anything matches! I will update this link and document anytime donations are made. I am happy to give any of your beloved items a new home!
  • Are you a venue, gallery or performing arts space owner in the area that would like to host an Afro(–) Campaign Presentation or Concert? Planning for a series of pre-launch PHASE II Project AfroDASH presentation events here in Chicago, Boston, New York and a few other potential cities is underway; I am looking the right location(s) and accepting proposals! Gallery owners and concert venue managers, please contact me via email at afrodashcampaign@icloud.com if you are interested in hosting an event!
  • Are you a secondary or university-level institution, Ethnomusicology society, cultural program, community outreach center or independent educator interested in hosting a virtual exchange using the output of this project? I am looking to connect with educators in Chicago, Valencia, Madrid, Latin America... really, anywhere on the globe to "host" Project AfroDASH! As a hosting institution or classroom, you will receive updates on progress, themed micro-projects, and will have the opportunity for your students to interact with involved musicians via blog correspondence, Skype discussion sessions or any other proposed media outlet. I am open to suggestions in order to tailor our interaction to your classroom. ***Availability is LIMITED! Please contact as soon as possible with collaboration ideas!
  • Do you live in Chicago, New York, Boston and the surrounding areas? ATTEND the series of PHASE II Project AfroDASH Presentation/Fundraising Concerts, in mid December (date TBD)! Stay tuned via Facebook and Twitter for save-the-date city and venue announcements!
  • And, last but not least... please SHARE this campaign!! This is where HOW MANY you know comes in handy. Remember:

    This PHASE I goal can be EXCEEDED with only 520 individual donations of $27!! 

    (The Phase II STRETCH GOAL can be exceed with only 1000 donations of $27!!)

    This means that the more people that believe in me, this project and the potential it has, the more likely it is to be successful. Connections are invaluable assets! It is not only about the amount of individual donations, but the NEW CONNECTIONS just waiting to be forged as a result of this campaign!


So, with all of this said... THANK YOU TO ALL for embarking on this campaign journey with me! Looking forward to continuing to share stories, experiences, ideas and progress on the #WeAreAfroDASH campaign blog over these next four weeks!  

Now, TIME TO MAKE SOME MAGIC HAPPEN AND RAISE SOME FUNDS FOR THE NEXT ADVENTURE!!!


With So Many Thanks,

Erin

[afrodashcampaign@icloud.com]




©Celia García | 2014

story:
Here's the Scoop

Crazy huh?! It took me quite some time to muster up the courage to take on making an album. This is the most excited I have ever been about a musical project, and I want you to be a part of it with me! This album is a collection of songs that each point to a specific time and feeling in my life throughout the past year. Being able to open up to people is something that has never come easy to me, and so that is exactly what I set out for this album to do. I challenged myself to be honest and vulnerable and to make a piece of work that would show my development as both a songwriter and a person. John Mark Nelson is producing this album, and I could not be happier to have him alongside me throughout this process. The songs are already coming to life and sounding much better than I could have ever imagined!

How I Will Use the Funds
The fact that you would believe in my music enough to donate your money actually blows my mind, and I can never fully express how much that means to me. Here is a breakdown of how I will use the funds:

Production: I will use most of the funds to pay for the studio time, producer, engineer, mixing, and mastering.

Band: I'm so happy to be recording with a full band! I want to be able to pay these folks for their time and talents because they are my best friends and the most talented people I know.

CD duplication: Physical copies of the album will be made to sell at shows and through my online store. 

In exchange for your generosity, you will receive the corresponding perks listed on the side!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are not able to donate, there are still ways you can help! Share this page with your friends and family. Spreading the word about this project helps so much, and that is all I could ask for!

    I am giving you a hug right now. Thank you so much!

    Kara

The fact that you would believe in my music enough to donate your money actually blows my mind, and I can never fully express how much that means to me. Here is a breakdown of how I will use the funds:

Production: I will use most of the funds to pay for the studio time, producer, engineer, mixing, and mastering.

Band: I'm so happy to be recording with a full band! I want to be able to pay these folks for their time and talents because they are my best friends and the most talented people I know.

CD duplication: Physical copies of the album will be made to sell at shows and through my online store. 

In exchange for your generosity, you will receive the corresponding perks listed on the side!



  Other Ways You Can Help If you are not able to donate, there are still ways you can help! Share this page with your friends and family. Spreading the word about this project helps so much, and that is all I could ask for!
I am giving you a hug right now. Thank you so much!
Kara

story: Like Joseph, we're dreamer's who are dreaming big dreams. Our greatest dream is to see the kingdom of God advancing out of a move of the spirit that is both pure and genuine. There are no tricks or gimmicks here, just humble hearts that are absolutely in love with Jesus. Throughout this eclectic album you will get a glimpse into our journey with the King. I believe through this worship project you will be blessed and the Father will spark again the dreams in your heart. Thanks for dreaming with us.

story:
I'm shooting to get 1,000 CDs pressed not only for this campaign but for future gigs, press releases, radio, etc.  If you'd like to help me accomplish this you can order your copy here!  I'm hoping to go way past my humble goal of $750.  I don't want to bore ya'll with numbers, but pressing cd's, production, mastering, etc. is super expensive for an indie artist.  

     Now for the fun part - the music!  I wanted to create a collection of songs that would not only tell my story, but would hit home on a personal level with people across the board.  It didn't really matter to me if they were MY songs, I just wanted great songs that I could feel  good about producing.  With this in mind, recording them with simple acoustic arrangements seemed the best way to go.  And by acoustic, I mean this EP is 100% acoustic.  Of the five songs on this EP three of them are my own compositions, and two were written by friends that I have utmost respect and admiration for.           

     Ian Thomas's song "Honey Can I Count on You" has won over many fans and musicians already.  It's been recorded not only by Ian as a solo artist, but also by The Avett Brothers and The Bus Driver Tour.  John Gillette also gave me his blessing to record another one of his tunes - "Blackberry Breakfast".  I really enjoyed recording "Eeny House" for the "Moonlight Waltz" record, so I knew it would be a pleasure to do another one of his songs.

     Allow me to brag on the musicians that are on this thing.  Geoff Henderson plays upright bass.  Holy Tone, Batman!  Geoff plays with several Nashville acts besides me including Frazier Band, Brian Ashley Jones, and The Gypsy Hombres.  On drums we have Justin Amaral, who has played the Conan O'Brien Show with Jim Lauderdale, toured with blues legend Junior Brown, and has backed up several Americana greats including David Olney and Tommy Womack.  The amazing, incredible, unbelievable Billy Contreras plays fiddle on this record.  BIlly played fiddle for George Jones (RIP Possum)!  And last but not least Charles Butler plays banjo (and dulcimer) on three of the tracks.  Charles "went viral" on YouTube with his banjo cover of Daft Punk's "Get Lucky", reaching over 1.7 million views!  Vocals, guitar, mandolin, and tambourine were done by yours, truly.

     The cover image and artwork were done by Melanie Davis.  I saw this picture and was floored.  It's not only stunning but it fits perfectly with the themes I examined in these songs.

     If you'd like to be a part of making this EP come to life I would be extremely grateful and humbled.  There are several options including T-shirts so check it out and see what works for you.  Thank you!

-Jeff

story:
<------------------------------------------------------------------------------------>

UPDATE! June 13th 101% of our goal raised, 12 HOURS TO GO!!!

#VallenatoInTheBox made it!!! We are giving away some of the great perks in  really good prices, spread the word and stay tune :) Please like us on Facebook for updates of concerts, recording & more... See you at the Vallenato Collective & Hugo Carlos' concert! Thank you so much!! 

Alejandro Zuleta Music

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Alejandro-Zuleta/38115019000

Alejandro Zuleta Vallenato Collective 

https://www.facebook.com/vallenatocollective 

The Mini Agency

https://www.facebook.com/TheminiA

   <------------------------------------------------------------------------------------>

UPDATE: May 20th 36% of our goal funded & 24 days to go!!!

What is Vallenato in the Box? Here is a detailed explanation of what would you get if you donate and help Alejo and the Vallenato Colective to reach the goal.


Vallenato in the Box*: An initiative to preserve the memory and advance the artistry of this beautiful Colombian folklore. We want to create an ever growing Box* of  songs, memories and new sounds in the Vallenato landscape.

Chapter 1: Help us reunite the Vallenato emerging band in NYC scene Alejandro Zuleta Vallenato Collective with the best of the Colombian tradition the actual Vallenato king of kings Hugo Carlos Granados. They will perform a series of concerts in NYC and record the debut album of the Vallenato Collective with the guidance and special collaboration of Maestro Hugo Carlos.

What you'll get: For every donation you will get a Vallenato Box including Vallenato Collective's new CD, Thank You Postcard and a special surprise based on your Vallenatero Degree.

* The Box In spanish La Caja is the typical colombian drum essential to the sound of traditional Vallenato.

Who is Alejandro Zuleta check it out here:


This is the sound of the Vallenato Collective:

Sebastian Cruz (Guitar), Diego Obregón (Bass), Nestor Gomez (Caja and Bk Vocals), Jonathan Gomez (Guacharaca and Bk Vocals), Alejandro Zuleta (Piano and Ld Vocals)


This is the Sound of Hugo Carlos Granados Rey de Reyes:


Vallenatero Degrees:

1- 10 VirtuaI Vallenatero*

25- Vallenato Fan

35- Vallenato Lover

50- Vallenato Collector

75- Vallenato Specialist

100- Full Vallenatero

200- Intense Vallenatero

300-Rey Vallenato

500- Rey de Reyes


Special Categories


1000- Your Vallenato: Vallenato Box + Surprise + Short a copla for You or your loved one.

2500- Vallenato VP (CEV): Vallenato Box + a coba (I will say your name and a special mention to you one of the album tracks).

3000- Chief Executive Vallenato: Vallenato Box + a coba (I will say your name and a special mention to you one of the album tracks) + Credit as Executive producer.

3000- Parranda Vallenata: Vallenato Box + Live show with Vallenato Collective and at any place you decide in NYC or its surroundings, anywhere else if you cover our expenses.

* this will be a virtual box.

story:
Dear Family, Friends, and Fans,

Regarding my next record, which I plan to begin within the next two months,  I've decided to reach out and hope to appeal to your own possible generosities and interests due to my short comings to: 1) speed up the production of the record and 2) maximize the quality of the production. 

It's been roughly four and half years since the release of my last record, Music Man, which is the longest time span between my CDs since my first solo recording released in 2000.  I don't blame that on anything… it simply has to do with the move I made from Austin to the country side of West Texas back in 2009 where I had decided to focus on the goal of building our house. We've now reached a good stopping point where we are already able to live in it. So now is the opening i've been waiting for to make this record.  

I've got a load of new songs (and some old) and I can't wait to put them down and share them with you. Any generosities you should decide to donate would all be spent solely on studio time, i.e. recording, mixing, mastering, as well as compensation for accompanying studio musicians. That's the primary goal - anything on top of that will be used for the promotion of the CD, and anything left beyond that will be used towards the manufacturing of CD's.

The above video for my new song Out of Sight includes a raw, acoustic version of the song that my wife anna Oakley and i shot near terlingua texas. A fully orchestrated version will be on the new CD.

I want to thank everyone beforehand who has decided to help and look forward to seeing you via one of the perks, on the road, or elsewhere!

Sincerely,

Jim Keaveny

story:
Who we are and what it's all about?

Wendy & DB is a Kids music duo, writing, creating & performing positive, upbeat, fun & important songs to be enjoyed by kids of all ages! 

These are our top priorities:

  • To create fun, educational & inspiring music for kids!
  • To help music program funding and help kids everywhere get basic needs met!
  • Be globally responsible.

With your help we can help others with our contributions from CD sales.

Our song "Shine A Light" from our new and upcoming CD and the song "People are People" from our "Pockets" CD  will have a direct impact on the school kids that sing these songs and learn these positive and inspiring lyrics!  It is our hope that kids everywhere will have an opportunity to share the song.

Our needs (push the little engine up the hill)

  • We have worked very hard to complete a fantastic collection of 12 kids songs
    ranging from inspiring to silly to downright important lessons about self love!
  • All the funds received will be put towards the manufacturing costs of the CD packaging & production costs.

Dolls & Toys (your perks)

  • You will receive a CD and a gracious note from us!
  • You will have the pride of knowing that you played a part of helping us help children right here and in Ghana, Africa (through a better life for kids - more below.)
  • Most importanty you will be entered in a raffle to win a free house concert with Wendy & DB performing for your kids & guests or a private voice lesson with Wendy Morgan (in person or via Skype)

Shine A Light

We are all a part of a bigger picture and together we weave the tapestry that is the world in which we live.  If we can do one thing to "Shine A Light" on even one child in another country or one right here at home, woundn't that would be a wonderful and remarkable accomplishment.  We promise to look for other opportunities to help the world grow with love and music.

With our last CD, a percentage of the proceeds benefitted VH1 Save The Music and helped put more music funding in schools.  We will continue our relationship with VH1 Save The Music.   And with our new "It's A Doo Da Day" CD we will contribute to A Better Life For Kids helping them help children (many orphans and children with disabilities) with getting basic needs met through a better life for kids   .org.

We are almost finished

Wendy & DB perform for kids and parents throughout Chicagoland.  Wendy is a parent and she and Darryl Boggs have been musicians, songwriters and music teachers for years .  This new CD is just about finished but it would be wonderful to have your support to get us over the hill (remember the little engine that could) to give the CD to all the good boys and girls and the folks waiting down in the valley.

This is Morgan's third CD project and her track record speaks for itself. "She gets things done!"

Sharing and helping without actually funding

We understand not everyone is able to help but we appreciate your time letting others know about our good work!

  • SHARE SHARE SHARE - get the word out about our campaign.
  • PLEASE USE THE Indiegogo share tools!
We really appreciate your support and friendship!

story:
Music at No.14 Bacon St 

For nearly six years now, No.14 Bacon St - or as it was previously known as , The Vintage Emporium - has been at the very heart of the underground East London music scene. It all started with the local community of buskers coming in after their weekend sessions on Broadway Market and the Flower market to warm up and drink tea in the incredibly cosy environment that proprietors Oli & Jess had created. Having made their money on the markets, as musicians will do with a willing audience they would then start to play more for the love of it. More importantly, these musicians would break free from their busking sets and would play with the other musicians there, creating once in a lifetime groups playing each others music.

As the reputation of the musical magic stemming from No.14 grew, so did the amount of music - it is the main focus of the place. We have regular nights every Wednesday, Thursday and Friday, and the weekend apres-busk sessions are now legendary! 

The music that happens upstairs at No.14 is always absolutely unique, whether it's cross-cultural musicians that have never played together melding their individual musical histories together for the first time, or bands that are adapting their music to the beautiful genial surroundings that they find themselves playing in. 

What we aim to achieve here is two-fold:

Firstly, to be able to offer bands the ability to have their gigs at No.14 recorded and mixed into a professionally produced live album. Both the sound and the atmosphere of the venue space are perfect for this type of album recording, and it is an opportunity that comes along all too little for bands and musicians. 

Secondly, to have the ability to unobtrusively record to a professional level the organised and eclectic sessions that happen at No.14, so we can capture the music that will only happen once, mix, produce and share it around for all to hear!

What we need 

Last month, we invested £1,000 in building a recording/mixing room downstairs at No.14. We now have a fully functioning great sounding room, equipped with Pro Tools 11 and the latest software for recording and mixing. 
Here is a look at what we have created so far



To be able to produce the recordings mentioned above, we need a few more things to add to our existing setup to make the operation complete! These are:
- Three new microphones to capture the sound in the venue space upstairs
- A patch box and 10m snake to carry the signals from the microphones down from the upstairs room into the studio downstairs
- An 8-channel interface to link up with our existing 2-channel one to carry the signal into the software in the studio so we can record and mix the music!
These things total £1,600, and with them we will have a brilliantly equipped studio and live room manned by professional engineers capable of producing second-to-none live recordings of musicians doing what they do best!

What we will create

Bands that choose to have their gigs at No.14 recorded will receive a fully mixed and mastered recording of their whole gig in press-ready digital format! Bands can then choose to either sell or release the album for free. 

From the live gigs, we will keep one track from each band to create our own compilation album of the gigs that happen here which will be available for digital download.

The recordings from the sessions will be mixed and released in digital format for people to listen to online for free or download for a small fee. 

In creating these recordings we will be preserving some of the magic created by both local and touring musicians that is fast being pushed out of the East End of London. These things don't hang around forever and it would be criminal to let them pass without being archived in some way.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that a fair few people who are reading this simply don't have money spare to donate, but fret not - there are other ways that you can help!

Please share this page around your friends and family, we have a lot of money to raise to make these recordings happen so the more people that hear about it the better!

You can also share our Facebook Page page around to let people know of the gigs and events we have coming up so that they too can get involved in the music!

Finally, if you know musicians who would be interested in getting their music recorded in the great space that is No.14 then please send them our way.

Thank you for your time and help, we hope to be sending out the fruits of our efforts soon! And remember, in the words of Confucius:

 "Music produces a kind of pleasure that human nature cannot do without"



***If we manage to make more than our target, then we will spend the extra money on more and better microphones! 

If we don't manage to make our target, then the money raised will still go into making this dream a reality. It may just take a little longer.

story:
PROBLEM!

After an amazing run of touring this year, our beloved van was stolen from us. With mucho gear in its trunk…..!!
But... our van was found!(gear still missing)
With many shows ahead of us we want nothing more than to get back out on our feet to bring our music to you all. Fortunately a few pieces of gear were safe at home, but for the most part we are gearless.
The money we raise will go directly towards replacing:
  • amps
  • guitars
  • pedals
  • merchandise
  • drums/cymbals etc.
(etc.)
 It is quite a wrench thrown in our workings for a band at our status, still working to get out there. The instruments we lost not only affected us monetarily, but were sentimental objects as well.
Your support will be more invaluable to us than we can explain. We love playing shows and want to get going again as soon as possible to see your beautiful faces! 
In thanks for your help, we will be personally thanking you with lavish gifts to attempt to repay the immense debt of your fanship and friendship!
story_txt:
PROBLEM!After an amazing run of touring this year, our beloved van was stolen from us. With mucho gear in its trunk…..!!But... our van was found!(gear still missing)With many shows ahead of us we want nothing more than to get back out on our feet to bring our music to you all. Fortunately a few pieces of gear were safe at home, but for the most part we are gearless.The money we raise will go directly towards replacing:

amps
guitars
pedals
merchandise
drums/cymbals etc.

(etc.)

story:
Hey there!

We are Super Water Sympathy!


Our band is home grown from Shreveport, Louisiana, and we formed in August of 2010.

Over the past three years we have been on several independent national tours, including Vans Warped Tour 2013-2014 and The McMenamins Great Northwest Music Tour.

After our second album, Hydrogen Child was released, we received lots of great feedback, especially after releasing our single, "UH-OH" (see below). 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wrRdQb4GUtM 

However, we just finished recording the start of our third album at Blade Studios in Shreveport, with producer Bryan Fryzel (Frequency), who is best known for his work with Eminem and Rihanna on their recent hit, "The Monster". We tried to do a kick starter campaign to fund this recording, but did not meet our goal. However, we pushed through and prevailed! And even though we somehow paid for everything out of pocket, we got it done!

The five songs we recorded with Bryan Fryzel have given us more attention from the music industry than we could have imagined. There are some great folks who want to meet us and see us perform and we couldn't be more humbled and flattered by this!

We have been selected to play FOUR SHOWCASES on the RED BULL STAGE during South By Southwest (SXSW) 2014 in Austin, TX!!!

Only 230 bands were selected out of 20,000+ !!!! And we are one of them!!!

March 8 - March 15

The problem is, we cant get there!


When we are on the road, we travel six to a vehicle. And most of the time, we sleep in the van! South by Southwest is a different story.

If you've never been to SXSW, it is absolute mayhem. It's a wonderful experience, but if you don't get a good night's sleep every night, you're bound to go insane.

Each bar has about 15 bands play there per day. The load-in process is quick and chaotic, as is sound check, and load out. The food is expensive, and you can't really buy groceries because you're gone from early morning until late at night. So you have to eat on the go.

Although being able to have a hotel room and food while we're there would be nice, we just need to get there. So every dollar counts!

Financial break down for you :)


Gas for our 12 passenger van for eight days - 5 tanks - $500

Cheap hotel to comfortable sleep 6 people - $1,000

Feeding 6 people at least two meals per day - $1,000

Our goal for this project leaves no room for unnecessary spending.

What SXSW could do for SWS


SXSW is an opportunity for us to play our music in front of hundreds of music industry representatives. Without events like these, we would have to some how fund an entire tour to track these people down!

SXSW is an awesome commonplace to meet these people. All we have to do is tell them when and where we are playing and they'll be there! So now, we need to BE THERE!

Join us in keeping independent music alive! And we promise to give you the best rewards ever!


WE LOVE YOU!

-Super Water Sympathy

story:
Our project is now featured on Crowdfusion

Greetings. My name is Nate Dal Cais and I have been playing music for most of my life. 

Along the way, I learned the business of music.I have always enjoyed networking with other musicians, which is how I joined forces with my partner, Charles Cudd. 

I have been studying how to do publicity,bookings,advertising,design and video. We are always willing to share our knowledge with other passionate artists. 

The video above will explain this further. Seeking funding we need to operate properly as a business, and helping other artists along the way. Contributors can receive consultations from us, as well as help receiving press,and filming for their live shows.
 

Our Goal:

  • The funding goal is a bare minimum needed to have cds pressed professionally for both bands: Imbolg & Of Beauty and Madness (or OBAM for short) actual replicated cds are a must so we can get our cds distributed to stores around the country and receive radio play. If we go well over our goal we can have our artists played on the radio, hire a professional management firm, pay for a line of merchandise, tour the country and possibly sign other bands to the FAR Label.
  • As a thank you for helping us reach our goal, we will give you free music, merchandise(such as shirts,and keychains which are all custom made,no two are alike) a thank you letter and in some cases a personal concert for you and your friends! ( Even Bar Mitzvahs! Oy Vey!! )
  • Also, we offer our expert advice and possible networking opportunities to other artists that contribute to our campaign. As well as help them understand more about the music business, getting publicity, and filming your next live show(see donations and perks for more details)
After years of learning the business of music, and building up contacts we have successfully received some airplay, reviews in magazines and performed around the Northeast. This funding will help us continue to do this for a lifetime on a national and worldwide level.
If you can't donate even a small amount, you can still help us by reposting on social media and by telling your friends about our artists and campaign. 

Thank you so much!

Sincerely, Nate Dal Cais, FAR CEO

Imbolg album art/shirt design

Of Beauty and Madness "Litany" album art/shirt design



Of Beauty and Madness Newspaper Feature (one of the things we can help your band receive,see publicity perks)

Forever Autumn Records Logo Shirt Design

Our lovely friend Violet Tendency modeling our Imbolg Flame logo


Imbolg "Shattered" EP (available in download form only)/Shirt design



Imbolg Cross & Steel logo shirt deisgn

story:
If you follow us, you know we tour a ton but we've never owned a van that wasn't at least 12 years old and had over 200,000 miles upon us buying it from some freak on Craigslist.  Honestly, we feel weird about crowd funding so we tried to offer stuff that we would be selling anyways in some other format.  We would buy it with our own money but we're borderline animals with no careers because we've thrown our lives in the toilet to tour 6 months a year and surprisingly, yelling to people doesn't pay like it did in the 80's. 


------> PICTURES OF THE STUFF IN THE GALLERY PAGE <---------

------>WE'LL GET IN TOUCH WHEN EVERYTHING'S DONE TO GET EVERYONE'S SHIRT SIZES SO YOU DON'T GOT TO WORRY ABOUT IT WHEN YOU CONTRIBUTE<--------

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING:

After clicking "Contribute Now" and selecting your package, you can increase the contribution amount to cover shipping for all packages, except stickers, which are no extra shipping charge:

+ (1) STICKER PACKAGE: no extra charge!

+ (1) KOOZIE OR CD PACKAGE: add $5

+ (1) SHIRT PACKAGE: add $10

+ (1) TEST PRESSING RECORD PACKAGE: add $10

+ If you order more than 1 package, just add another $5 per additional package to make it $15 (instead of $20).
EX: You want a shirt package and a record package–add $15 to the contribution amount.

+ If you order a record or a shirt package, plus any smaller items (CDs or koozies), just add $2 making it $12 (instead of $20).
EX: You want a record package and a koozie cuz being drunk is the only way to deal with your shitty job, then just add $12 to the contribution amount.


* Sorry for the postage prices. The USPS be crazy. :(

story:
Summary & Description of Video

The Council has maintained a compliant society for generations by outlawing art  and artistic expression. After hundreds of years, the spirit and passion of the people has withered and dreaming has ceased. Jeanne has a secret. She can dream. "Maid of Heaven" is the story of a dreamer that uses her gift to lead a creative revolution.

For more detailed information, please look at our concept board here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxadhxqkNJQcZW...

The video will tap into color contrasts, visual effects, and high fashion/avant garde wardrobe and props. Being more of a music film, dialogue will precede the live action music video. This project is unique because it is a marriage of conceptual storytelling, powerful music, and visually stimulating video. 

Our goal is also to use “Maid of Heaven" as a conduit to raise awareness about the importance of art education. This video will allow us to use our shows and events to collect donations of instruments and art tools for school programs and art education charities.


Please enjoy the song "Maid of Heaven" here:

https://soundcloud.com/officialreveband/maid-of...

Our incredible director, Charlie Anderson's reel and credits:

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2381085/ 

www.charlieandersondp.com


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $25,000. This is going to cover the following:

  • All cast (35-40), creative crew (3) and production crew (10-12)
  • Permit pulling for any shots on location
  • Traveling & lodging for on location shoots. 
We are offering 100% transparency with this campaign. If we raise over the $25,000, we will offer updates as to how the money was used. Any additional money will mostly be used for PR/marketing campaigns. If we do not reach our entire goal, we will put what we do receive in a project bank and we will continue attempting to raise the necessary funds needed to reach our goal.  

    The Impact

    This video has been two years in the making. From the time we began working on "La Marionnette" to the inception of this project, it was always a goal of ours to constantly create beautiful and professional products. By contributing, you will be personally helping us achieve our biggest endeavor yet and our most personal goal through this music video. 

      Risks & Challenges

      The biggest challenge is funding, which you can help! The crew and cast are both very excited to be apart of this project. Once we secure funding, we will be working diligently on this project.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you can't contribute monetarily, we would love if you should share this project with people that you know that might be able to help!

story:
Max Pain and the Groovies "Electro Cosmic"

Max Pain and The Groovies are a five-piece from Salt Lake City, Utah who play psychedelic blues-influenced rock ‘n’ roll.  Their self titled EP released features scorching guitar lines, hypnotic vocals and a woozy beat. It drones at times and explodes moments later. It’s an album you can zone to or dance your ass off too.  With your help through indieagogo they are releasing "Electro Cosmic" on New Years Eve and need your help to cover recording costs, radio campaigns, Vinyl Duplication and get them back on the road for all of 2015.

  • Your support through indiegogo will be a timeless decision to help these guys get "Electro Cosmic" heard all through out the world. 
  • You can help Max Pain and the Groovies cover costs for Electro Cosmic and in return be the first ones to receive the record.

story:
This is the 6th year of our collaboration with the Austin Chamber Music Festival, and we are once again delighted to bring to you a concert of music by gay and lesbian composers.  This year we are featuring  major works by Julius Eastman  andBen Weber along with other works by British and American composers.  As always we look for new and exquisite pieces to present.  Be prepared to expand your mind and your musical knowledge.
 

This concert has always been and will always remain FREE to the public.

We are coming to you to help support the musicians who have generously offered their time and talent to make this concert happen.

100% of the money we raise goes to the musicians.

For the past 5 years the community has come together to support this concert by giving to our campaigns or to the Austin Chamber Music Center.  We thank you so much for your past support.  Let's make it another wonderful year!
