story:
McKenzie Music Business Model

Say if you have two pieces of paper and you rip it in exactly half, you are left with two halves. One half is kept by me so for conversation purposes, disregard it. The other half is what's left. Using auction language, lets say the "auction" of the other half has a reserve of $100,000. 

One person buys it all for $100,000. They now own 50% of the rights to this music. Say one person spends $50,000 and two people spend $25,000 and $25,000. The person that spent $50,000 owns 50% of the 50% available and the other two people own 25% each of the 50% percent available. 50% + 25% +25% equals 100%. Very simple mathematics. A little more difficult is when one person decides to pay $200,000 for the 50% available. They still own 100% of the 50% available, just at a higher $200,000 price. Even more difficult still is if one person puts up $200,000 and two others still put $25,000 each then the total becomes $250,000 and the one person who payed $200,000 now owns 75% of the 50% available and the two others that payed $25,000 each now own 12.5% of the 50% available each. $50,000 is 25% of $250,000. Etc etc etc. This will music rights model will revolutionize everything music commerce related.

A revelation has happened. An epiphany of sorts. I, Donald Sturge Anthony McKenzie II, will no longer participate in the "pay for exposure" game (more on what I define as "pay for exposure" later). I can no longer sell myself short or undercut my art by grouping myself with slackers, people that are still trying to decide what instrument they're gonna play to get the most fans, people that want to croon and have roses thrown to them onstage cause they were an outcast in high school and psychologically still want to impress that chick that dated the football star but ignored the nerds.

Those days are over. Don't even ask me to consider your artistic existence unless you are willing to compensate me like a senior oncologist at Sloan Kettering.

Embracing ones artistic integrity means that one might as well do EXACTLY what they want, perform with exactly who they want, and create exactly the art that's going to psychologically stimulate them the most. This Indiegogo campaign is the first (albeit initially small) step to further this personal, creative and psychologically empowering agenda. More details to come........


PENETRATION WITH A FOREIGN OBJECT
---an exhibition of aural and visual duo musical improvisations---

Elliott Sharp
Brandon Ross

Graham Haynes

Melvin Gibbs

Jimmy Lee

David Hofstra

TM Stevens

THE FAILING "CLUB" BUSINESS MODEL:

The historical business model of a musician that wanted exposure for their creative output was that they played "clubs". Clubs consisted of venues relatively close to their home base where for minimal advertising they could showcase or exhibit their work for interested parties in hopes of peaking interest in said work and that interest spreading by word of mouth. As that interest spreads, the artist can do more of the same type of venues gradually increasing the size of his or her audience. Larger audiences in turn brings a larger economic recompense by allowing the artist to dictate more of his or her "take" in negotiations with the venue. What's usually up for negotiations with a venue or club owner is the revenue from concert receipts. The "door" per se. The club owner usually wants to cover his overhead for the exhibition of your music. His or her overhead could include, security, sound engineer, logistical people, clean up crew. etc and whoever else they may decide to tack on to your "bill" for the honour of performing in their hallowed venue. More on this later..........

Elliott Sharp has now agreed to participate in the aural and visual recording and presentation. Elliott Sharp in an ICON artist and a recent Guggenheim Award winner. http://www.elliottsharp.com

His bio is as follows:

Sharp is an American multi-instrumentalist, composer, and performer.

﻿A central figure in the avant-garde and experimental music scene in New York City for over 30 years, Elliott Sharp has released over eighty-five recordings ranging from orchestral music to blues, jazz, noise, no wave rock, and techno music. He leads the projects Carbon and Orchestra Carbon, Tectonics, and Terraplane and has pioneered ways of applying fractal geometry, chaos theory, and genetic metaphors to musical composition and interaction. 

His collaborators have included Radio-Sinfonie Frankfurt; pop singer Debbie Harry; Ensemble Modern; Qawwali singer Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan; Kronos String Quartet; Ensemble Resonanz; cello innovator Frances Marie Uitti; blues legends Hubert Sumlin and Pops Staples; pipa virtuoso Min-Xiao Feng; jazz greats Jack deJohnette, Oliver Lake, and Sonny Sharrock; multimedia artists Christian Marclay and Pierre Huyghe; and Bachir Attar, leader of the Master Musicians Of Jajouka.

Sharp has composed scores for feature films and documentaries; created sound-design for interstitials on The Sundance Channel, MTV and Bravo networks; and has presented numerous sound installations in art galleries and museums. He is the subject of a new documentary "Doing The Don't" by filmmaker Bert Shapiro. 

More, including discography, at wikipedia.

Listen to a recent interview on NPR's "All Things Considered".

More to come.............

Peter Karl has now agreed to participate in the aural and visual recording and presentation. All audio and visuals will be recorded at Peter Karl's Studio in Boerum Hill.

Address
  • 295 Douglass St # 2
  • Brooklyn, New York 11217
Phone (718) 625-5282
Peter Karl's resume is long, vast and varied. Here are two videos which were recently recorded in the facility.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sqG8doMW2pA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mgZwqI1KKDo

Although the music we will record is stylistically different, It will share the same high fidelity.

You are in for a treat. EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS. EVERY PENNY. Donate now and share this groundbreaking journey with us.....More significant announcements to come........

GRAHAM HAYNES has agreed to participate in the aural and visual recording and presentation. Graham Haynes is an ICON instrumentalist and composer.

His bio is as follows:

Regarded as an innovator on cornet and flugelhorn, an extraordinary composer, and an emerging force in contemporary electronic music and world music, Graham Haynes has redefined and deconstructed that genre we still call "jazz".

Graham Haynes was born in 1960 and raised in Hollis , Queens ,NY. He is the son of jazz legend Roy Haynes . His neighbors growing up were Milt Jackson, Jaki Byard and Roy Eldridge.

His two years at Queens College (1978-1980) studying composition, harmony and theory spurred his interest in classical and electronic music (Robert Moog was professor of electronic music at the time). Haynes became a disciplined student , studying privately with Gillespie alumnus Dave Burns while playing in the Pentecostal church.

In1979 he met alto saxophonist Steve Coleman. They formed a band called Five Elements, which launched the M-Base collective, an influential group of NY improvisers. Haynes spent much of the 1980's collaborating with Coleman and Cassandra Wilson. In the late 1980's he formed his own ensemble, Graham Haynes and No Image, and recorded his first album as a leader, What Time It Be ?


During the late 1980's Haynes immersed himself in a wide range of African, Arabic and South Asian music which prompted his move to Paris in 1990. There he recorded Nocturne Parisienne and The Griots Footsteps, for French Polygram records.


Haynes spent the next three years studying and performing with masters of African and Asian music, occasionally returning to NY to work with artists such as Ed Blackwell, George Russell, Uri Cain and David Murray among others. In 1993, Haynes moved back to New York City, where he began investigating sampling and hip hop music. The album Transition came out of this investigation. His next project, Tones for The Twenty-First Century, combined sound effects, textures, drones, and samples , layered over Haynes electronically manipulated horn.


Since 2000 Haynes has collaborated as music director and composer on the following multimedia projects:


Electric Church ,an ongoing multimedia event series he created and curated at Walker Stage NYC.

Sights and Sounds,multimedia collaboration with visual artists at the Bronx River Arts Center (2000).

Afrofuturistic, with writer Tracie Morris, presented at the Kitchen (2003).

A Cruel New World, a dance work by choreographer Donald Byrd, performed by the Spectrum Dance Theatre in Seattle,WA (2003)

Improvizions  with choreographer Roxanne Butterfly (2005)

51st Dream State  multimedia project by Sekou Sundiata (2006).

Speak in Tones an ongoing Jam session at Walker Stage Tribeca NYC

The Greatest  a dance work by chroreographer Peggy Choy (2010)


in 2003 Haynes composed score for Flag Wars, a film funded by PBS. During 2004-2005 he composed and produced original soundtrack for the film The Promise by Maria Norman.


Throughout his musical career Graham Haynes has brought together different musical traditions from Africa , Asia and  Arabic countries. He has been a perennial guest at the Gnawa Trance Music Festival in Morocco.



Graham Haynes has received the following grants:

National Endowment for the Arts Study Fellowship (1979)

Meet The Composer Grant to compose and perform original music with No Image group at Jam'88

(1988)

Meet The Composer  Grant to compose original music for Afrofuturistic

Haynes was nominated twice for Alpert Award in (2000) and (2003)


Graham Haynes has recorded fifteen critically acclaimed CD's as a leader and countless CD's as a side person with such artists as Steve Coleman, Roy Haynes, Ed Blackwell, Abbey Lincoln, Cassandra Wilson, Sting, Butch Morris,The Roots, David Murray, Karl Berger and many, many more top musicians.


Since 1986 Graham Haynes tours annually in Europe, Asia, and Africa and has appeared several times on national tv. He is in high professional demand as a musical director and composer by film, theatre, dance and multimedia artists .


In 2003 Graham lectured at NYU on the subject of Music and Trance 

Mr. Haynes has taught as an adjunct professor at The New School for Jazz and Contemporary Music in 2010 and taught and taught and lectured at Banff Creative Center in 2013


Since 2013 Haynes has been a member of the Vijay Iyer sextet , performing in NY and international jazz festivals .

He is currently performing and is music director of a jazz flemenco project with top flamenco and jazz musicians as well as composing a string quartet .





Graham Haynes

story_txt:
McKenzie Music Business ModelSay if you have two pieces of paper and you rip it in exactly half, you are left with two halves. One half is kept by me so for conversation purposes, disregard it. The other half is what's left. Using auction language, lets say the "auction" of the other half has a reserve of $100,000. One person buys it all for $100,000. They now own 50% of the rights to this music. Say one person spends $50,000 and two people spend $25,000 and $25,000. The person that spent $50,000 owns 50% of the 50% available and the other two people own 25% each of the 50% percent available. 50% + 25% +25% equals 100%. Very simple mathematics. A little more difficult is when one person decides to pay $200,000 for the 50% available. They still own 100% of the 50% available, just at a higher $200,000 price. Even more difficult still is if one person puts up $200,000 and two others still put $25,000 each then the total becomes $250,000 and the one person who payed $200,000 now owns 75% of the 50% available and the two others that payed $25,000 each now own 12.5% of the 50% available each. $50,000 is 25% of $250,000. Etc etc etc. This will music rights model will revolutionize everything music commerce related.A revelation has happened. An epiphany of sorts. I, Donald Sturge Anthony McKenzie II, will no longer participate in the "pay for exposure" game (more on what I define as "pay for exposure" later). I can no longer sell myself short or undercut my art by grouping myself with slackers, people that are still trying to decide what instrument they're gonna play to get the most fans, people that want to croon and have roses thrown to them onstage cause they were an outcast in high school and psychologically still want to impress that chick that dated the football star but ignored the nerds.

Those days are over. Don't even ask me to consider your artistic existence unless you are willing to compensate me like a senior oncologist at Sloan Kettering.
Embracing ones artistic integrity means that one might as well do EXACTLY what they want, perform with exactly who they want, and create exactly the art that's going to psychologically stimulate them the most. This Indiegogo campaign is the first (albeit initially small) step to further this personal, creative and psychologically empowering agenda. More details to come........

PENETRATION WITH A FOREIGN OBJECT---an exhibition of aural and visual duo musical improvisations---
Elliott Sharp
Brandon Ross


Graham Haynes
Melvin Gibbs
Jimmy Lee
David Hofstra

TM Stevens

THE FAILING "CLUB" BUSINESS MODEL:
The historical business model of a musician that wanted exposure for their creative output was that they played "clubs". Clubs consisted of venues relatively close to their home base where for minimal advertising they could showcase or exhibit their work for interested parties in hopes of peaking interest in said work and that interest spreading by word of mouth. As that interest spreads, the artist can do more of the same type of venues gradually increasing the size of his or her audience. Larger audiences in turn brings a larger economic recompense by allowing the artist to dictate more of his or her "take" in negotiations with the venue. What's usually up for negotiations with a venue or club owner is the revenue from concert receipts. The "door" per se. The club owner usually wants to cover his overhead for the exhibition of your music. His or her overhead could include, security, sound engineer, logistical people, clean up crew. etc and whoever else they may decide to tack on to your "bill" for the honour of performing in their hallowed venue. More on this later..........
Elliott Sharp has now agreed to participate in the aural and visual recording and presentation. Elliott Sharp in an ICON artist and a recent Guggenheim Award winner. http://www.elliottsharp.com
His bio is as follows:
Sharp is an American multi-instrumentalist, composer, and performer.
﻿A central figure in the avant-garde and experimental music scene in New York City for over 30 years, Elliott Sharp has released over eighty-five recordings ranging from orchestral music to blues, jazz, noise, no wave rock, and techno music. He leads the projects Carbon and Orchestra Carbon, Tectonics, and Terraplane and has pioneered ways of applying fractal geometry, chaos theory, and genetic metaphors to musical composition and interaction. 
His collaborators have included Radio-Sinfonie Frankfurt; pop singer Debbie Harry; Ensemble Modern; Qawwali singer Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan; Kronos String Quartet; Ensemble Resonanz; cello innovator Frances Marie Uitti; blues legends Hubert Sumlin and Pops Staples; pipa virtuoso Min-Xiao Feng; jazz greats Jack deJohnette, Oliver Lake, and Sonny Sharrock; multimedia artists Christian Marclay and Pierre Huyghe; and Bachir Attar, leader of the Master Musicians Of Jajouka.
Sharp has composed scores for feature films and documentaries; created sound-design for interstitials on The Sundance Channel, MTV and Bravo networks; and has presented numerous sound installations in art galleries and museums. He is the subject of a new documentary "Doing The Don't" by filmmaker Bert Shapiro. 
More, including discography, at wikipedia.
Listen to a recent interview on NPR's "All Things Considered".
More to come.............

Donate now and share this groundbreaking journey with us.....More significant announcements to come........
GRAHAM HAYNES has agreed to participate in the aural and visual recording and presentation. Graham Haynes is an ICON instrumentalist and composer.
His bio is as follows:
Regarded as an innovator on cornet and flugelhorn, an extraordinary composer, and an emerging force in contemporary electronic music and world music, Graham Haynes has redefined and deconstructed that genre we still call "jazz".
Graham Haynes was born in 1960 and raised in Hollis , Queens ,NY. He is the son of jazz legend Roy Haynes . His neighbors growing up were Milt Jackson, Jaki Byard and Roy Eldridge.
His two years at Queens College (1978-1980) studying composition, harmony and theory spurred his interest in classical and electronic music (Robert Moog was professor of electronic music at the time). Haynes became a disciplined student , studying privately with Gillespie alumnus Dave Burns while playing in the Pentecostal church.
In1979 he met alto saxophonist Steve Coleman. They formed a band called Five Elements, which launched the M-Base collective, an influential group of NY improvisers. Haynes spent much of the 1980's collaborating with Coleman and Cassandra Wilson. In the late 1980's he formed his own ensemble, Graham Haynes and No Image, and recorded his first album as a leader, What Time It Be ?
During the late 1980's Haynes immersed himself in a wide range of African, Arabic and South Asian music which prompted his move to Paris in 1990. There he recorded Nocturne Parisienne and The Griots Footsteps, for French Polygram records.
Haynes spent the next three years studying and performing with masters of African and Asian music, occasionally returning to NY to work with artists such as Ed Blackwell, George Russell, Uri Cain and David Murray among others. In 1993, Haynes moved back to New York City, where he began investigating sampling and hip hop music. The album Transition came out of this investigation. His next project, Tones for The Twenty-First Century, combined sound effects, textures, drones, and samples , layered over Haynes electronically manipulated horn.
Since 2000 Haynes has collaborated as music director and composer on the following multimedia projects:
Electric Church ,an ongoing multimedia event series he created and curated at Walker Stage NYC.

Afrofuturistic, with writer Tracie Morris, presented at the Kitchen (2003).
A Cruel New World, a dance work by choreographer Donald Byrd, performed by the Spectrum Dance Theatre in Seattle,WA (2003)
Improvizions  with choreographer Roxanne Butterfly (2005)
51st Dream State  multimedia project by Sekou Sundiata (2006).
Speak in Tones an ongoing Jam session at Walker Stage Tribeca NYC
The Greatest  a dance work by chroreographer Peggy Choy (2010)
in 2003 Haynes composed score for Flag Wars, a film funded by PBS. During 2004-2005 he composed and produced original soundtrack for the film The Promise by Maria Norman.
Throughout his musical career Graham Haynes has brought together different musical traditions from Africa , Asia and  Arabic countries. He has been a perennial guest at the Gnawa Trance Music Festival in Morocco.

story:
(Deutsche Version: siehe unten)

Short description

IMOGEN is the chamber ensemble of the International Mahler Orchestra. IMOGEN is a brand new ensemble - and is celebrating its birth with a concert tour in Germany in May 2016:

1 May - Frankfurt (Goethe Universität) - 6 pm

2 May - Hamburg (resonanzraum) - 7 pm

3 May - Kassel (documenta-Halle) - 7 pm

4 May - Berlin (Konzerthaus Berlin) - 7 pm

5 May - Berlin (Stummfilmkino Delphi) - 7 pm


For this tour we need your support.

Listen to IMOGEN

An IMOGEN concert is no ordinary concert experience. It is an artistic adventure where the audience sits as close as possible to the stage. We believe that music is best experienced authentically and emotionally; up close and personal. As supporters of IMOGEN, you are enabling us to compensate our talented musicians. We also have to pay fees to GEMA and the venues and finance the travel costs, as our musicians come from all over the world.

What you give/What you get

We need 12.000 Euros for the musicians' fees, bus transport and hotel rooms. We are paying all of the participants - including the organizers - very small fees. This is a passion project if there ever was one and for everyone involved, a huge leap of faith. IMOGEN loves its audience. We don't just want to play for you - and give everything that we have. We want to know you - and share our love of music with you in a personal way. That's why we are offering you tickets, meet and greets with the musicians and even an insider experience in the tour bus and hotel with the musicians.

The results

With IMOGEN, you can experience a fresh, new musical experience. IMOGEN doesn't like routine. We play Björk, Bartók and Bach. Passion, unfiltered energy and unlimited beauty are the ideas closest to our hearts. If you help us with this project, we promise you our deepest emotions.

The International Mahler Orchestra - the big brother of IMOGEN - performed the world premiere of Yoel Gamzou's reconstruction of Gustav Mahler's 10th Symphony on the 5th of September, 2010 at the Jewish Cultural Festival in the Synagogue in the Rykestraße in Berlin. That was the day a group of musicians found each other and decided to take a leap of faith to build a fresh, new ensemble that exceeds the standard musical expectations.

Risks and Challenges

To make music means to take a risk. In particular, what and how we play. IMOGEN is completely new - so it isn't easy for us to find sponsors for this project. That's where you come in.

Other ways to help us

We understand that not everyone is in the position to finance our project. You are still more than welcome to come support us live at our concerts - and are also very welcome than welcome to share our campaign via social media. If you come to our concerts and/or share our campaign on your social media pages, it's just as helpful as 50 euros.

IMOGEN on Soundcloud

Kurzbeschreibung

IMOGEN ist das kleine Ensemble des 2006 gegründeten International Mahler Orchestra. IMOGEN ist ein besonderes Kammerorchester, das die Musik von Björk genauso schätzt wie die von Bartók und Bach.  IMOGEN ist ganz neu -  und feiert seine Geburt mit einer Deutschland-Tournee im Mai 2016:

1. Mai- Frankfurt (Goethe-Universität) - 18.00 Uhr

2. Mai - Hamburg (resonanzraum) - 19.00 Uhr

3. Mai - Kassel (documenta-Halle) - 19.00 Uhr

4. Mai - Berlin (Konzerthaus Berlin) - 19.00 Uhr

5. Mai - Berlin (Stummfilmkino Delphi) - 19.00 Uhr


Für diese Tour brauchen wir Ihre Unterstützung.

Hören Sie mal zu

IMOGEN teilt eine ungewöhnliche musikalische Erfahrung mit Ihnen. Bei uns sitzt das Publikum immer ganz nah an den Musikern. Denn wir glauben daran, dass Musik authentisch, emotional und hautnah erlebt werden sollte. So, als ob die gespielten Werke zum ersten Mal erklingen würden.

Unsere Unterstützer helfen uns, unsere Musiker bezahlen zu können. Außerdem spielen wir auch Werke, die GEMA-pflichtig sind. Und natürlich müssen wir zwischen den Konzertorten reisen und nachts mit einem Dach über dem Kopf schlafen.

Was Sie uns geben

Was Sie bekommen

Wir brauchen 12.000 Euro für die Musikerhonorare, die Bus-Reisen und die Hotel-Übernachtungen. Wir zahlen allen Beteiligten - auch den Organisatoren - nur kleine Gagen. Das Ganze ist ein Herzensprojekt - und für alle ein Risiko.

IMOGEN liebt sein Publikum. Wir wollen nicht nur für Sie spielen - und dabei alles geben, was unsere Saiten hergeben. Wir wollen Sie kennenlernen - und unsere Liebe zur Musik gemeinsam teilen.

Deshalb bieten wir Ihnen für Ihr wertvolles Geld unter anderem Tickets, Treffen mit den Musikern und eine aufregende - und sicher lustige - Reise mit den Musikern im Tourbus an.

Die Folgen

Sie können mit IMOGEN eine besondere abenteuerliche Erfahrung mit ganz viel Musik machen. IMOGEN mag Routine nicht. Wir spielen Musik von Björk, Zappa, Ravel, Bartók und Bach. Wichtig ist nur die Leidenschaft, die Wildheit, die unaufhörliche Schönheit. Unsere Emotionalität im Spiel ist unser Versprechen an Sie!

Mit IMOGEN ist eine Gruppe von Musikern entstanden, deren Arbeit wir wichtig finden - und nun seriös in die Zukunft führen möchten.

Risiken & Herausforderungen

IMOGEN ist ganz neu - und es ist nicht leicht für ein noch nicht bekanntes Projekt Sponsoren zu finden. Deshalb wenden wir uns an Sie.

Wie man sonst helfen kann

Nicht jeder ist in der Lage, mit finanziellen Mitteln zu helfen. Sie sind aber genauso herzlich zu unseren Konzerten willkommen - und können uns jederzeit persönlich oder über die sozialen Medien ansprechen.

Wenn Sie unsere Konzerte oder diese Kampagne beispielsweise auf Facebook teilen, dann ist das genauso großartig wie eine Unterstützung von 50 Euro.


IMOGEN - Soundcloud

As supporters of IMOGEN, you are enabling us to compensate our talented musicians. We also have to pay fees to GEMA and the venues and finance the travel costs, as our musicians come from all over the world.
What you give/What you get
We need 12.000 Euros for the musicians' fees, bus transport and hotel rooms. We are paying all of the participants - including the organizers - very small fees. This is a passion project if there ever was one and for everyone involved, a huge leap of faith.

IMOGEN loves its audience. We don't just want to play for you - and give everything that we have. We want to know you - and share our love of music with you in a personal way. 

That's why we are offering you tickets, meet and greets with the musicians and even an insider experience in the tour bus and hotel with the musicians.
The results
With IMOGEN, you can experience a fresh, new musical experience. IMOGEN doesn't like routine. We play Björk, Bartók and Bach. Passion, unfiltered energy and unlimited beauty are the ideas closest to our hearts. If you help us with this project, we promise you our deepest emotions.
The International Mahler Orchestra - the big brother of IMOGEN - performed the world premiere of Yoel Gamzou's reconstruction of Gustav Mahler's 10th Symphony on the 5th of September, 2010 at the Jewish Cultural Festival in the Synagogue in the Rykestraße in Berlin. That was the day a group of musicians found each other and decided to take a leap of faith to build a fresh, new ensemble that exceeds the standard musical expectations.
Risks and Challenges
To make music means to take a risk. In particular, what and how we play. IMOGEN is completely new - so it isn't easy for us to find sponsors for this project. That's where you come in.
Other ways to help us
We understand that not everyone is in the position to finance our project. You are still more than welcome to come support us live at our concerts - and are also very welcome than welcome to share our campaign via social media.

If you come to our concerts and/or share our campaign on your social media pages, it's just as helpful as 50 euros.
IMOGEN on Soundcloud 
Kurzbeschreibung

IMOGEN ist das kleine Ensemble des 2006 gegründeten International Mahler Orchestra. IMOGEN ist ein besonderes Kammerorchester, das die Musik von Björk 
genauso schätzt wie die von Bartók und Bach.  IMOGEN ist
 ganz neu -  und feiert seine Geburt mit einer Deutschland-Tournee im 
Mai 2016:
1. Mai- Frankfurt (Goethe-Universität) - 18.00 Uhr
2. Mai - Hamburg (resonanzraum) - 19.00 Uhr
3. Mai - Kassel (documenta-Halle) - 19.00 Uhr
4. Mai - Berlin (Konzerthaus Berlin) - 19.00 Uhr
5. Mai - Berlin (Stummfilmkino Delphi) - 19.00 Uhr

Für diese Tour brauchen wir Ihre Unterstützung.
Hören Sie mal zu


IMOGEN teilt eine ungewöhnliche musikalische Erfahrung mit Ihnen. Bei uns sitzt das Publikum immer ganz nah an den Musikern. Denn wir glauben daran, dass Musik authentisch, emotional und hautnah erlebt werden sollte. So, als ob die gespielten Werke zum ersten Mal erklingen würden.


Unsere Unterstützer helfen uns, unsere Musiker bezahlen zu können. Außerdem spielen wir auch Werke, die GEMA-pflichtig sind. Und natürlich müssen wir zwischen den Konzertorten reisen und nachts mit einem Dach über dem Kopf schlafen.


 
 
Was Sie uns geben
Was Sie bekommen

 
Wir brauchen 12.000 Euro für die Musikerhonorare, die Bus-Reisen und die Hotel-Übernachtungen. Wir zahlen allen Beteiligten - auch den Organisatoren - nur kleine Gagen. Das Ganze ist ein Herzensprojekt - und für alle ein Risiko.


IMOGEN liebt sein Publikum. Wir wollen nicht nur für Sie spielen - und dabei alles geben, was unsere Saiten hergeben. Wir wollen Sie kennenlernen - und unsere Liebe zur Musik gemeinsam teilen.


Deshalb bieten wir Ihnen für Ihr wertvolles Geld unter anderem Tickets, Treffen mit den Musikern und eine aufregende - und sicher lustige - Reise mit den Musikern im Tourbus an.


 
 
Die Folgen
 
Sie können mit IMOGEN eine besondere abenteuerliche Erfahrung mit ganz viel Musik machen. IMOGEN mag Routine nicht. Wir spielen Musik von Björk, Zappa, Ravel, Bartók und Bach. Wichtig ist nur die Leidenschaft, die Wildheit, die unaufhörliche Schönheit. Unsere Emotionalität im Spiel ist unser Versprechen an Sie!


Mit IMOGEN ist eine Gruppe von Musikern entstanden, deren Arbeit wir wichtig finden - und nun seriös in die Zukunft führen möchten.
 
 
 
Risiken & Herausforderungen
 
IMOGEN ist ganz neu - und es ist nicht leicht für ein noch nicht bekanntes Projekt Sponsoren zu finden. Deshalb wenden wir uns an Sie.


 
 
Wie man sonst helfen kann
 
Nicht jeder ist in der Lage, mit finanziellen Mitteln zu helfen. Sie sind aber genauso herzlich zu unseren Konzerten willkommen - und können uns jederzeit persönlich oder über die sozialen Medien ansprechen.


Wenn Sie unsere Konzerte oder diese Kampagne beispielsweise auf Facebook teilen, dann ist das genauso großartig wie eine Unterstützung von 50 Euro.

IMOGEN - Soundcloud

story:
Our First Album!

The award-winning Young Women’s Chorus of San Francisco is excited to professionally record its first album in June 2016 at a world-class Northern California recording studio. The recording will be released in November 2016, just in time for the holidays.

Here are some reasons we’d like you to support this project:

  • Your support will demonstrate your belief in our mission of transforming the lives of young women through exceptional artistry in choral performance.
  • Working with a professional producer and recording engineer in a world-famous recording studio is a once-in-a-lifetime experience for our young women. Through the process of preparing repertoire and making a professional recording, our singers will learn a great deal and refine their music making.
  • In just three years, YWC has won two national awards, and received critical acclaim from renowned performers. A high quality recording will enable us to share this high artistic quality of our music making with audiences all over the world.
  • The album will include several new works, as well as works by Bay Area composers, including three never before recorded.
  • A professional recording of our young women’s voices inspires other young women to sing.

The cost of making this recording at with a professional engineer, producer, and recording team, and post-production costs will be over $25,000. We hope that you - our friends, community of supporters, and choral enthusiasts - will join with our Board of Directors in helping us make this dream a reality. We are looking to you to help raise our target amount of $10,000 to fund part of this recording.

Your Support Will Make the Difference

  • Please donate now! Check out our perks and choose from a variety of unique options.
  • Help us spread the news! Please share our campaign with your friends on Facebook, email, or Twitter. The bigger our social network, the more likely we will reach our goal.



The Young Women’s Chorus of San Francisco is the premiere ensemble of a larger nonprofit organization, the Young Women's Choral Projects (YWCP). Founded in 2012, YWCP transforms the lives of young women through exceptional artistry in choral performance and brings the expressive power of their music to the community, the nation, and the world. Through YWCP, participants from diverse cultural, educational and socio-economic backgrounds find their voices as singers, artists and women in a nurturing musical environment that empowers them to achieve artistic and personal excellence.

"I don't think there's anywhere else in the Bay Area where
high school-age girls are so passionate about learning and
performing a wide variety of music, and are challenged
and expected to do it on a professional level. I'm constantly
striving to meet and achieve higher levels of excellence."
- Kayla, age 17

Now in its 4th season, the Young Women’s Chorus has inspired audiences in the San Francisco Bay Area, on the East and West Coasts of the United States, and in Italy and Germany. In 2014, the Chorus won two national awards, The American Prize in Choral Performance (youth and high school division), and the Dale Warland Singers Commissioning Award from Chorus America and the American Composers Forum. This year we commissioned two new works for the Chorus, Qui creavit coelum, by Frank La Rocca (which will appear on the recording), and A Singer’s Path, by Karen P. Thomas, a set of five songs on Sara Teasdale’s poetry to be premiered on May 21, 2016.

From all of us at the Young Women's Choral Projects, we thank you for your support. Please check out all the opportunities of our full choral program, and come and hear us in concert!

story:
Introduction

Welcome everyone, and thank you so much for visiting. 

I am Tricia Hastings, an Irish fiddle player who loves to record and make music, and I would like to ask for your help in attending Ethno Norway this summer, representing Ireland in a Folk Ensemble.

This annual gathering attracts musicians between the ages of 16 and 30 from many different countries, and I will be part of the  first Irish group delegates to participate. The participants each bring a traditional tune from their home culture, forming a "folk orchestra" that performs at local concerts and outdoor arenas in mid August.


The aim of my participation is to compile recordings, transcripts to offer funders and incorporate my learning into my future teachings.

Below is a picture of a sample 8GB flash card I hope to produce:


Bio:


With over twenty years of experience I have a folk album under my belt with my band 'Just Us' and teaching and festival experience in Belgium, UK, Australia and Ireland.



I completed my Grade 8 in Irish Music with distinction in 2013 and taught at the Turning Wave Irish Festival Australia in 2014

Following this I was fortunate to attend Ethno Australia in Brisbane and be part of a Folk Ensemble of 30 musicians who performed to 10,000 people at The Woodford Folk Festival(thats me in the red dress!)


I have always wanted to learn more Scandinavian music and attending Ethno Norway will enhance my current skills and enable me to study other folk genres intensely within a week.

With your kind support, I will be able to attend Ethno Norway and return with lots of music recordings, videos, photographs and music notations!

My educational background in in Digital Media/Television Production so I hope to produce strong audiovisual content that funders will treasure..

How the funds will be used

Your contribution will help me to afford: (sterling equivalent)

- Travel from Ireland (Dublin) to Norway (Bodø) 240
- Participation Fee for Ethno Norway 120
- Cost of Materials & Production (Postcards, Cd's, Flash Drives, Books) 400
- Data Loading & Editing 150

 - Fees(Indiegogo & Credit Card Fees) 240 

- Postage 240 

Total: 1390 pounds sterling.

Working in Australia

Currently I am working in Australia as a carer and I teach and perform music in my spare time in the Sydney region.

I hope to gain employment when I return to Eire (Ireland) in late July.

Having a funded trip to Norway would be a dream come true and one of the highlights of my musical career to date.

I am no stranger to Ethno and have attended Ethno Flanders (Belgium) in 2012 and again in 2014.


You can find links to my album and link to live performance at Ethno Flanders last summer.

Album-Tap of the Foot Review& Sample Tracks

Irish tune live @ Ethno Flanders in Gent

Thanks

story: The Bloomfield String Quartet has the opportunity to present at the Young Audiences National Conference in Kansas City. The conference theme is "Building Partnerships Through Community Connections". They will share their experiences on presenting over 100 "Kinder Concerts" to the Wichita School District over two years, the importance of arts integration in schools, and their personal education through this wonderful program. All four presenters are students and alumni of Wichita State University, members of the Wichita Symphony Orchestra, and performing artists in the Wichita, Kansas area. Your funds will go towards conference fees, travel, and housing. Please help support their endeavor by donating today.

story:
FANS, FRIENDS & SUPPORTERS

I AM BEYOND THRILLED TO EMBARK UPON RECORDING MY SECOND EP! 
THE NEW SONGS I'VE WRITTEN & CRAFTED HAVE BEEN SIMMERING & WAITING IN THE WINGS SINCE THE RELEASE OF MY LAST ALBUM. 
FROM WRITING IN THE SOLITUDE OF MY LOFT DURING THE MIDNIGHT HOURS, TO SHOWCASING THEM IN LIVE BAND PERFORMANCES, THESE SONGS ARE READY TO BE RECORDED & DELIVERED WITH SOUL. 
WITH YOUR HELP…                                                                                                                       NOT ONLY WILL I HAVE THE BENEFIT OF RECORDING THIS MUSIC WITH SOME OF THE BEST PLAYERS IN NASHVILLE BUT I WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO REACH A BROADER AUDIENCE DIGITALLY & PHYSICALLY THROUGH TOURING & DISTRIBUTION.
AFTER COMPLETING A SUCCESSFUL RADIO/TV CAMPAIGN WITH MY LAST EP, I'M EVEN MORE ANXIOUS TO GET THIS NEW MATERIAL TO THE 150+ RADIO STATIONS & MAJOR TV NETWORKS I'VE ALREADY CHARTED ON & CONTRACTED WITH...NOT TO MENTION ALL OF THE LISTENERS THAT HAVE BEEN ASKING WHEN WE'LL BE IN THEIR TOWN NEXT!? 

THE BUDGET & THE PERKS FOR YOU

THIS CAMPAIGN TO RAISE $20,000 WILL RUN FOR 60 DAYS, BEGINNING NOVEMBER 26TH. 

THE COSTS OF THIS EP WILL CONTRIBUTE TO RECORDING WITH PRODUCER  CHRIS GRAINGER, AMAZING MUSICIANS LIKE KENNY OLSON, MASTERING, DUPLICATION, MERCHANDISE, TOUR SUPPORT, PHOTOGRAPHY, MUSIC VIDEOS, RADIO CAMPAIGN & TV/FILM SYNC.  

SINCE THIS CAMPAIGN WILL BE RUNNING THROUGH THE HOLIDAY SEASON, I'VE DECIDED TO OFFER SOME PERKS/INCENTIVES THAT YOU CAN MAKE YOUR SEASON BRIGHT AS YOU GIVE!

OTHER PERKS LIKE DIGITAL DOWNLOADS, SIGNED COPIES OF THE ALBUM, T-SHIRTS, EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CREDITS, PRIVATE HOUSE CONCERTS & MORE, WILL BE AVAILABLE.


THANK YOU - YOU ARE MY LABEL 

THIS CAN BE A TOUGH INDUSTRY & A HARD ROAD FOR INDEPENDENT (INDIE) ARTISTS, LIKE MYSELF. THAT IS WHY YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS MEAN THE WORLD TO ME! 
WITH YOUR SUPPORT, YOU ARE KEEPING THE MOMENTUM OF MY MUSIC CAREER ALIVE, AND ALLOWING ME TO DO WHAT I LOVE…CREATE & PERFORM ORIGINAL MUSIC!
THAT IS THE BEAUTY OF THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN ARTISTS & LISTENERS IN TODAY'S MUSIC INDUSTRY. WE CAN CONNECT AND MAKE MUSIC TOGETHER!  I HAVE EXPERIENCED IT FIRST HAND. IT IS MOVING AND POWERFUL. 
ANY & ALL MONETARY CONTRIBUTIONS ARE GRACIOUSLY ACCEPTED! 
ALSO, SHARING MY LINK FOR THIS CAMPAIGN WILL BE OF GREAT HELP & SUPPORT. SOCIAL MEDIA OUTLETS LIKE FACEBOOK, TWITTER & YOUTUBE MAKE IT EASY TO DO!
AGAIN, THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR BELIEIVING & CREATING WITH ME. 

SINCERE GRATITUDE,
JACLYN

SINCERE GRATITUDE,JACLYN

story:
The down-low low-down!!

Thank you for taking a minute to check out my campaign! For those of you who are un-familiar with what this campaign is exactly, let me explain.. A 'kickstarter campaign' is a way for independent musicians to get the funding for their project up front, in this case recording my second studio album!! As you may know or may assume, creating an record can get pretty expensive from studio time, to paying studio musicians, to mixing and mastering, and of course mass replication of the cd which is what this money will be going towards. 

More than a fundraiser!!

This isn't your traditional fundraiser where you donate and thats the end of it because when you pledge to this campaign you get things in return!! Its essentially pre-ordering your copy of the album and it also gives you a chance to support the powerful ministry of music!! Check out the various packages you can pick from and choose the one that best suits you!!

Spiritual impact!!

The songs that have been written for this album are very personal to me and make me vulnerable because it's my heart, my experiences, my failures and my worries which is my lack of faith! But I have been called to turn these experiences into songs. The way I write is to challenge the listener but give resolution and encouragement. In the midst of various struggles and trials in my life i've thought that I was alone but after reminder from God I know there are many fellow brothers and sisters that are in or have gone through the storms!! I believe these songs will be applicable to you in there own special ways :)

story:
the GOAL.

Arthur Vint & Associates went in to record "Through The Badlands" at the Bunker Studio in Brooklyn, NY on February 11th, 2015 and the album was mixed and mastered at Bass Hit Studio in Manhattan in April. Now the album is done. Es completo. C'est fini!  The only thing remaining to be done is to press these soundwaves into grooves and send them out into the world!  Once I reach my goal and manufacture the product, Ropeadope Records will add the album to their catalog and release, distribute and promote the album worldwide in January of 2016!  Ropeadope Records has been around since 1999 and is a progressive, artist driven record label that has released albums by Antibalas Afrobeat Orchestra, Tin Hat Trio, MMW, Sex Mob, Snarky Puppy, and Christian Scott.  I'm thrilled to be in such good company!

So far, I have invested 100% of my own funds into this project, but am now looking for some help. By pre-ordering a copy of "Through The Badlands" on CD or vinyl you can help finish finance this project - and be one of the first people to hear it!  I am aiming to raise $2,500, which will help cover the expenses of manufacturing the physical CDs and LPs.  If I'm able to raise more money than this, than I may be able to cover all the manufacturing expenses...

_________________________________________________________

Breakdown of remaining costs...

• Artwork: $500

• Song Licensing: $500

• CD manufacturing: $1,100

• Vinyl manufacturing: $2,500

• TOTAL: $4,600 (<--more than $2,500)

That's it!  I've already paid for everything else myself in cash, so this is the final frontier. 

 

_________________________________________________________

My "rewards" are pretty straightforward: I'm basically using this campaign as a pre-order method for the album in different formats.  However, there will be a few extra "perks" as well.  The album artwork is currently being designed by my brother in-law Eric W Palmer and the drafts that he's sent me look uh-maz-ing, so I'm going to print a limited number of posters with the artwork (and maybe some T-shirts) that can be ordered here as well.  Also, If you live in the New York City area and donate $150, you will be invited to a private cocktail/listening party!  Not only will you get to imbibe fancy cocktails made by yours truly whilst listening to my new album, but you will get to HANG OUT WITH MY BABY SON HENRY!!!!  You can even hold him if you want and change his diapers for no extra cost!!  (For those of you that don't know, I'm a bartender at the world famous Village Vanguard jazz club...my drinks are LEGIT.)

I'm extremely proud of how this record turned out and am still blown away by the sounds and performances that were captured in the studio. I'm already at work planning what's next for this band, but first thing's first - getting this record out.  They say no one buys music anymore - prove them wrong and pre-order my album! 

THANK YOU!!

-->ARTHUR

(In addition to pre-ordering a copy of "Through The Badlands," please consider spreading the word to those you may think would be interested in this music - or buy an extra copy for a friend!!)

_________________________________________________________

the BAND.

 

Originally from Tucson, AZ, drummer Arthur Vint has lived in the New York area for eight years where he has established himself as an in demand session musician for projects spanning jazz, latin, country and rock genres. His debut album as a leader, "Through The Badlands" draws upon all these influences and is the culmination of several years of composing and arranging for his unique ensemble that features violin, harmonica, tenor saxophone, bass clarinet as the lead voices, with accompaniment by the more traditional rhythm section of guitar, piano, bass and drums.  The songs conjure images of his native southwest mixed with the hustle of New York City...

Although he has played drums on over 25 albums, this marks Arthur's first official release as a leader. The band he assembled, Arthur Vint & Associates, includes Rich Perry on tenor saxophone, who was a teacher of Arthur's at both William Paterson University and the Manhattan School of Music and has one of the most distinctive and recocnizable voices on the instrument today. Tony Scherr, perhaps better known for his bass work with Bill Frisell, plays guitar on the album and Jon Cowherd, of the Brian Blade Fellowship, plays piano and Hammond B3. Blanca Cecelia Gonzalez brings her beautiful style and interpretation on the violin and Yvonnick Prene plays some truly inspirational chromatic harmonica. Fellow Tucsonans Andrew Halchak and Ian Stapp join on bass clarinet and upright bass respectively, both of whom have been musical collaborators with Arthur since their high school days.  

This stellar lineup gives life to seven of Vint's original compositions and two of Ian Stapp's, as well as Vint's arrangements of songs by Neil Young and The Sons of the Pioneers.  To some, these songs will surely fall into the "jazz" category as they are instrumental and prominently feature improvisation, but the album taken as a whole is truly un-categorizable.  We hope you enjoy the music!

_________________________________________________________
story_txt:
the GOAL.
Arthur Vint & Associates went in to record "Through The Badlands" at the Bunker Studio in Brooklyn, NY on February 11th, 2015 and the album was mixed and mastered at Bass Hit Studio in Manhattan in April. Now the album is done. Es completo. C'est fini!  The only thing remaining to be done is to press these soundwaves into grooves and send them out into the world!  Once I reach my goal and manufacture the product, Ropeadope Records will add the album to their catalog and release, distribute and promote the album worldwide in January of 2016!  Ropeadope Records has been around since 1999 and is a progressive, artist driven record label that has released albums by Antibalas Afrobeat Orchestra, Tin Hat Trio, MMW, Sex Mob, Snarky Puppy, and Christian Scott.  I'm thrilled to be in such good company!
So far, I have invested 100% of my own funds into this project, but am now looking for some help. By pre-ordering a copy of "Through The Badlands" on CD or vinyl you can help finish finance this project - and be one of the first people to hear it!  I am aiming to raise $2,500, which will help cover the expenses of manufacturing the physical CDs and LPs.  If I'm able to raise more money than this, than I may be able to cover all the manufacturing expenses...
_________________________________________________________
Breakdown of remaining costs...
• Artwork: $500
• Song Licensing: $500
• CD manufacturing: $1,100
• Vinyl manufacturing: $2,500
• TOTAL: $4,600 (<--more than $2,500)
That's it!  I've already paid for everything else myself in cash, so this is the final frontier. 
 
_________________________________________________________
My "rewards" are pretty straightforward: I'm basically using this campaign as a pre-order method for the album in different formats.  However, there will be a few extra "perks" as well.  The album artwork is currently being designed by my brother in-law Eric W Palmer and the drafts that he's sent me look uh-maz-ing, so I'm going to print a limited number of posters with the artwork (and maybe some T-shirts) that can be ordered here as well.  Also, If you live in the New York City area and donate $150, you will be invited to a private cocktail/listening party!  Not only will you get to imbibe fancy cocktails made by yours truly whilst listening to my new album, but you will get to HANG OUT WITH MY BABY SON HENRY!!!!  You can even hold him if you want and change his diapers for no extra cost!!  (For those of you that don't know, I'm a bartender at the world famous Village Vanguard jazz club...my drinks are LEGIT.)
I'm extremely proud of how this record turned out and am still blown away by the sounds and performances that were captured in the studio. I'm already at work planning what's next for this band, but first thing's first - getting this record out.  They say no one buys music anymore - prove them wrong and pre-order my album! 
THANK YOU!!

_________________________________________________________

story:
Barefoot Walking is happy to announce that we've finished recording our first album, Running Through Sprinklers, to be released in September. The album merges quirky yet soulful lyrics with skillful melodic guitar work and syncopated rhythms.

And now, we're about to launch into our first music video, Mermaid Day Parade. The story is about the day mermaids walk out of the water to tell all the girls to come out of their shells to be free, to be their true selves, to be mermaid's.

Our very wonderful friends and family, we could use your help making this endeavor possible. Thank you all for making this project a reality!

Please visit Facebook.com/BareFootWalking for more. And www.BareFootWalking.com is coming soon!

Barefoot Walking
Singer, songwriter: Livia Beasley
Guitar, songwriter: Anthony Grillo
Drums: George Scoufaras
Bass: Peter Archer
Violin: Beth Sharkey

And our amazing team
Recorded by: Matt Longoria
Recording Studio: Beat Street
Back-up vocals: Justin Depuydt
Album Designer: Jesse Kuhn, Raw Toast Design
Filmmaker: Terry Golob, Aerostatic Music
Choreographer: Deirdre Powers
**Announcing our mermaid's and mermen: Sara Farber, Liz Fodor, Jen Liseo, Joanne Ruelos, Peter Duncanson, Lucas Mills, and Bryan Wilson!

story:
My Story

My name is Allison Barber and I am a singer-songwriter based out of Brooklyn, NY.  I am currently in the process of releasing my debut album, The Birds in the Bushes. I have spent the better part of the last two years working with producer and guitarist, Kyle Sanna, to put together an album comprised of my original songs. Together with Mike Savino (bass), Mathias Kunzli (drums/percussion) and Caitlin Warbelow (fiddle) we recorded the final album at Hoboken Recorders in Hoboken, NJ. Having performed for most of my life in multiple genres of music, I can honestly say this is the most excited I have been about a project. My songs draw from life experiences, lessons I've learned and the artists who have inspired me. Working through this process with such an incredible group of musicians, I have found a musical voice that is truly my own.  


The Impact

I am always searching for ways in which I can make an impact on the world and give back through music. I am beyond grateful to all of those incredible individuals in my life who have shown me support and love. It is my aim above all else to be able to provide this kind of support and assistance to others, especially those living in poverty. My searching has led me to The Microcredit Summit Campaign, a project of the Results Educational Fund. Deeply inspired by the organization's incredible efforts to end poverty in people's lives, I came to one of the most important decisions of my life - the decision to act. 


Microfinance, or Microcredit is the extension of small loans and other financial services (such as savings accounts, financial education, support groups, and health care) to individuals and families living below the poverty line, allowing them to pursue entrepreneurial projects that generate extra income. Essentially, these small loans and support groups enable these individuals and families to work themselves out of poverty - with dignity. 


A portion of sales from every album sold will be donated to The Microcredit Summit Campaign to support their efforts. It is my hope these donations not only help others to end poverty in their lives and to realize their own goals and dreams, but that my efforts will also inspire others to take action. 


For more information about The Microcredit Summit Campaign, please visit: www.microcreditsummit.org


How You Can Help

After 2 years of writing, arranging, rehearsing and recording I finally have a debut album of original material that I am beyond excited to share with everyone. As an independent artist, the cost of recording, production and promotion can be overwhelming. Now as I enter the final phase of the project, I'm turning to friends, colleagues and fans for support and am inviting all of you to be a part of this exciting process. Over the next 90 days my goal is to raise $10,000 to complete the album and send it out into the world. Funds raised will go towards mixing, mastering (by West West Side Music), manufacturing and promotion. To me the most important part of this last phase is the promotion. Meeting my fundraising goal will help me to put my music in as many hands and to reach as many ears as possible. In the end, the more people I can reach, the more people I can help in return. 


Thank you!

My favorite aspect of working with Indie Go Go is that I get to give back to my supporters, almost immediately. I am offering a number of fun perks for anyone who pledges to the project. (As seen on the right side of your screen) 


Spread the Word

I believe in the power of grass roots efforts. Spreading the word about my project is just as a vital to our success as pledging. Through word of mouth and by sharing my project on Facebook, Twitter, and Myspace you can help me achieve my goal. 


Thank you for taking the time to consider my Indie Go Go project. For all of your support, whatever form it takes, I am deeply grateful. 


xoxo Allison

story:
Our Story

A deadly tornado steamrolled through the city of Joplin, Missouri on the night of Sunday, May 22nd. It caused damage to St. John's Medical Center, causing many hospitalized victims death. As well as damage to many homes. People are left houseless, without their belongings, and powerless. For more information, visit the New York Times online.


The Impact

Joplin is a city with a population of about 49,000 people. Our goal is to restore the lives of the affected.

All proceeds will be donated to Christ's Church of Joplin in support of their relief efforts.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share the mission on facebook, your blog, and on twitter! Make sure to include the link to the donation page and the hashtag, #PrayForJoplin!


Contact

http://-jaigurudevaom.tumblr.com

http://twitter.com/MoniqueHanna

story:
The Story

After learning a lot about what goes into making an album, promoting it and getting it heard, I realized that although I had some songs on the radio, I needed a lot more power behind me to get those songs played over and over again. Now, there are so many ways for a song to get exposure- television, movies- and you like to hope that the video you shot for it goes viral overnight ;)
But along with this 'do-it-yourself' market, comes expenses that a single person cannot put forth on their own. That's what record companies used to do. Now it's up to the artist. I've been singing a set of songs live for over a year that people keep asking me for a way to download or purchase- that's always a good sign. But all I have to offer is my original product, which as an indie artist was a great accomplishment- but also full of good teaching tools, called mistakes. This time around I have a great team of musicians behind me, a plan of musical direction, contacts in the industry, a sense of humor, and a lawyer.

The Goal

My $24,000 goal is actually a pretty humble sum for what I want to do with it. It should be enough to create a rocking record, with cool (green-conscious) packaging & design. The money will pay for production, studio costs, musicians, mixing, mastering, and manufacturing. Should the goal not be reached, I will move forward with production- after figuring out how many songs we can get done within the budget.

I am happy to say that all donations made to this project are deemed tax deductible through an artist sponsorship by Fractured Atlas Group! It feels great to be supported by an organization that has helped many many creative projects raise enough funds to complete their goals. Fractured Atlas is a 501(c)3 non profit organization for the arts and all donors will receive a tax-deductible donation receipt for their records.

The Budget

Production: 1 @ 1000.00 per song = 80000.00
Musicians: 4 @ 100.00 per recording hour = app. 8000.00
Mixing costs: 3-5 hours per song  @ 100.00 an hour= app. 4000.00
Mastering: 1-2 hours per song @ 75.00 an hour= app 1200.00
Art work: free-lance graphic artist @ 500.00
Packaging: green- conscious recycled digipac, full color, with lyrics insert = 2000.00
Promotional items: printed postcards, download cards= app. 300.00

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand not everyone will have the means to donate funds to this project- but for those of you who have just enough time to do some clicking with your mouse, please share these urls on your facebook and twitter accounts! This too is great support and really makes a difference! Why? Indiegogo has an activity tracker to determine which are the most popular fund raisers. This is what people seeking projects to fund look for. They want to back a project that is pertinent and worthwhile. Every time someone checks out this campaign and cross-posts or forwards to friends, it is noted as activity and literally drives more traffic to the campaign's page!

www.indiegogo.com/Strange-Confessions

*In The Event...

that the monetary goal is not met by the end of the campaign, the funds collected thus far will be used to start the project- and some of you may have a longer wait to get a hard copy of that second CD. However, MP3's of all finished songs will be sent to everyone who has contributed to this album drive as soon as they are available!

story:
{ Visit http://halleyelwell.com to buy or listen to the album! Thanks so much for your support, friends!}

----

WE DID IT!!! Thank you all for your support!

Now your only job is to help me celebrate by coming to my cd release party at 50 Mason Social House on Friday, August 19th from 7-10. See you there!

....

UPDATE!

Check out the front page of the Maine Kennebec Journal's Women's Quarterly Summer 2011 issue!

My Indiegogo campaign and album are mentioned! Thank you to Nancy McGinnis @ http://www.communicado.us!

....

The Story of Last Spring

After I graduated from college with a music degree, I figured the only way to productively pursue music without being swallowed whole by my student loan debt would be to get a day job and gig at night. Well, the day job changed everything, including my musical goals. I ended up recording for free at a student-run studio at the art school I worked for, and that's how Last Spring was born. It was premature and not very well planned, but in the months since the recording sessions went down, this baby has gotten healthy and much stronger. It's busting out of it's 6-12 month clothes and wants to run!


Made up of 5 original songs (one of which just won an ASCAP Young Jazz Composers Award) and three of my favorite standards, the album features some of the Bay Area's best musicians, including saxophonist Dayna Stephens, flutist Gerald Beckett, guitarist Jack Riordan, bassist Jesse Cafiero and drummers Jimmy Gallagher and Brandon Etzler. It has been mixed by engineer Gary Hobish, who will also master it. Jazz vocal sensation and my mentor Kitty Margolis has arranging credits on this, and a surprise producer has just signed on to do some final pro bono work to ensure this album sounds stellar. We're not going to let you down!

The Impact

Last Spring was recorded last year and has since been funded mostly by my administrative assistant salary. It is in it's final stages of production, but it needs your help! I have already had some phenomenal photos taken for the album cover by San Francisco photographer Veronica Weber (as seen on this page), but am still finalizing the artwork. From there I will need to package and distribute the album, pay royalty fees, and pay for continued promotion (radio, print, web, etc.). 

On a broader scale, this album is significant because it's new, original work by a young group of jazz artists in the Bay Area. It is notably lamented that many talented young jazz artists of the Bay Area move to NYC for better work. This album is proof that there is still a scene and still musicians working hard to keep jazz alive in San Francisco. By supporting this album, you are also supporting this fact.

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $2,500. This will cover studio fees for extra sessions with the producer that graciously offered his time to make this album sparkle. Additionally, this will cover mastering costs, album artwork fees, cd duplication for a run of 300 cds, and payment of royalties. I do not anticipate left over funds, but in the event there are any, they will go directly toward promotion.


There are some cool incentives to this donation process if you're in the mood to give! I'm excited to share them with you. If you love the idea but cannot make a monetary contribution, no problem! Just by stopping by you have shown that you care, which means the world to me. If you want to stay in touch and hear about my musical endeavors, I hope you will sign up for my mailing list (which you can do while simultaneously downloading one of my songs for free! See below).


Other Ways You Can Help

Here are some other ways to help this campaign:


Spread the word via facebook, twitter, your blog or email (or some other social networking site I know nothing about) with a word or two of acknowledgment. My hope is to have many donors contributing less than $50. The coolest part of the crowd funding phenomenon is that it's community based. No one needs to put themselves out to contribute. Also, with Indiegogo, you don't have to sign in and make a new account. I have made contributions on this site for other deserving artists and like how quick and easy the process is.


Spread the word at work and drag your co-workers out to my next happy hour gig! By the time the cd release party rolls around, we'll all be good friends.


As promised, as a thank you for stopping by today, here is the link to download my song, 'Nobody Bothers Me' from Bandcamp for free! I recorded it back in 2008 for a demo with Larry Dunlap, an incredible Bay Area pianist.

http://halleyelwell.bandcamp.com/track/nobody-bothers-me


Sincerely yours,


Halley Elwell



SPECIAL THANKS TO THOSE WHO ARE SUPPORTING ME IN THE HOME STRETCH!


Kitty Margolis

Dr. Alfonso Montouri

Nancy McGinnis

Gary Hobish

Veronica Weber

Angela Snyder

Cassie Bouton

Heidi Agustin

Well, the day job changed everything, including my musical goals. I ended up recording for free at a student-run studio at the art school I worked for, and that's how Last Spring was born. It was premature and not very well planned, but in the months since the recording sessions went down, this baby has gotten healthy and much stronger. It's busting out of it's 6-12 month clothes and wants to run!

Made up of 5 original songs (one of which just won an ASCAP Young Jazz Composers Award) and three of my favorite standards, the album features some of the Bay Area's best musicians, including saxophonist Dayna Stephens, flutist Gerald Beckett, guitarist Jack Riordan, bassist Jesse Cafiero and drummers Jimmy Gallagher and Brandon Etzler. It has been mixed by engineer Gary Hobish, who will also master it. Jazz vocal sensation and my mentor Kitty Margolis has arranging credits on this, and a surprise producer has just signed on to do some final pro bono work to ensure this album sounds stellar. We're not going to let you down! 

The Impact

Last Spring was recorded last year and has since been funded mostly by my administrative assistant salary. It is in it's final stages of production, but it needs your help! I have already had some phenomenal photos taken for the album cover by San Francisco photographer Veronica Weber (as seen on this page), but am still finalizing the artwork. From there I will need to package and distribute the album, pay royalty fees, and pay for continued promotion (radio, print, web, etc.). On a broader scale, this album is significant because it's new, original work by a young group of jazz artists in the Bay Area. It is notably lamented that many talented young jazz artists of the Bay Area move to NYC for better work. This album is proof that there is still a scene and still musicians working hard to keep jazz alive in San Francisco. By supporting this album, you are also supporting this fact. 

What We Need & What You Get
I am asking for $2,500. This will cover studio fees for extra sessions with the producer that graciously offered his time to make this album sparkle. Additionally, this will cover mastering costs, album artwork fees, cd duplication for a run of 300 cds, and payment of royalties. I do not anticipate left over funds, but in the event there are any, they will go directly toward promotion.

There are some cool incentives to this donation process if you're in the mood to give! I'm excited to share them with you. If you love the idea but cannot make a monetary contribution, no 
problem! Just by stopping by you have shown that you care, 
which means the world to me. If you want to stay in touch and hear about
 my musical endeavors, I hope you will sign up for my mailing list (which you can do while simultaneously downloading one of my songs for free! See below). 


Other Ways You Can Help
Here are some other ways to help this campaign:

Spread the word via facebook, twitter, your blog or email (or some other social networking site I know nothing about) with a word or two of acknowledgment. My hope is to have many donors contributing less than $50. The coolest part of the crowd funding phenomenon is that it's community based. No one needs to put themselves out to contribute. Also, with Indiegogo, you don't have to sign in and make a new account. I have made contributions on this site for other deserving artists and like how quick and easy the process is. 

Spread the word at work and drag your co-workers out to my next happy hour gig! By the time the cd release party rolls around, we'll all be good friends. 

As promised, as a thank you for stopping by today, here is the link to download my song, 'Nobody Bothers Me' from Bandcamp for free! I recorded it back in 2008 for a demo with Larry Dunlap, an incredible Bay Area pianist. 
http://halleyelwell.bandcamp.com/track/nobody-bothers-me

Sincerely yours,

Halley Elwell


SPECIAL THANKS TO THOSE WHO ARE SUPPORTING ME IN THE HOME STRETCH!

Kitty Margolis
Dr. Alfonso Montouri
Nancy McGinnis
Gary Hobish
Veronica Weber
Angela Snyder
Cassie Bouton
Heidi Agustin

story:
Bio:
Like all human beings, Kevin’s search for truth has always directed the course of his life. But this search intensified tremendously during a dark and transformative period in his teenage years. It was at that time when he was first exposed to rhyming as a means of self expression, planting a seed for his future incarnation as a hip hop artist. In and out of corrective institutions, he struggled to find meaning in life... until he discovered modern spiritual texts, bringing a clarity to his experience. The birth of his hip-hop music arose out of a necessity to process his experiences, serving to heal himself and inspire change in others through a positive, uplifting message of self realization. Kevin’s background as a yoga instructor shapes his unique style of hip-hop music by teaching conscious transformation through his lyrics, over modern, approachable hip-hop beats. It is his intention to share this message globally, playing his part to help in the co-creation of Heaven on Earth.

The Intention of the Music:
My intention is to share a universal message of Self Realization(understanding), love, and peace that serves to awaken and inspire people. To do this through hip hop music that sounds good and feels good to a global audience. To offer a product that can simply be enjoyed like all forms of music, or can be specifically utilized to shift one's consciousness/mind state into a place of greater alignment, clarity, and peace. The music works very much like a guided meditation, only in a much more active, convenient, and fun way! Your funds will help me make this transformational music accessible to the countless people who will benefit from listening. Please help me share it with the world!

*All of my music can be heard on my "Konscious" Facebook page(link at the bottom of page)
and on Reverbnation at www.reverbnation.com/konsciousness.

My Goal:
This projects goal is to raise funds for producing my first professional "Konscious" Hip Hop Album and music video, and to have a 1000 CDs manufactured for distribution. I have been and will continue to perform at open mics, bars, conscious events, yoga studios and other venues to develop my performance capability and make "Konscious" a familiar name to an ever increasing fan base.


Achieving this goal will specifically require funding for:
-Professional studio production services - $4,500
-Video production services - $ 3,500
-Musical production of Instrumentals - $1,000
-Rights and Legal fees - $1,000
-Professional CD Manufacturing - $1,000
-Graphic Design Costs - $500
-Merchandise - $500

Perks:
In return for your financial support I will offering Konscious Stickers, CDs, T-Shirts, Personal Live Freestyle(Improvisational rap) in person or via Skype, Private Yoga Lessons, and Live Music Performances!

How I'm going to do it: I already have all of my songs made. I just need to have a music producer(whom I know and is ready to do this now) produce 3 new instrumentals for me and upgrade a few of my beats to a more dynamic, higher quality sound. I will then take these tracks in to a local Professional Studio that I've connected with to get everything recorded and mastered to sound amazing. I will have 1000 CDs manufactured and make my music available through various sites such as itunes, amazon, and reverbnation. I will then get to work on my first music video, to create an amazing experience that will serve to help the song/music go viral. Boom!

Love and Gratitude to infinity and beyond! :D

Namaste <3

"Konscious" Kevin

story:
Short Summary

Vicious Phishes, known as "San Diego's best jam band",  is a San Diego band with their own unique style.  Outside of traditional genres, VP plays a blend of Acoustic Hip Hop, Rock, Blues, and more! 

The band is releasing its first EP, and going on tour to the Bay Area.  We are currently self-funded, but need help with financing some costs of the tour and EP production.  These are two important milestones for Vicious Phishes and our music community.  Your donations are a vital part of making this dream happen!

What We Need & What You Get

We are offering awesome perks: VP swag including buttons, stickers, tshirts, EP, private shows and personal thank yous on Facebook, Twitter, album sleeve, or tour postcard!  Perks available in many different price ranges, but for the most bang for your buck, we recommend a private show!

VP has been putting on succesful shows for 2 years now, and are ready to take the act on the road.

The campaign funding will go toward tour expenses: tow hitch, trailer rental, gas, etc.

The Impact

Vicious Phishes gives back to the community too!  Some of charity contributions include: Locks of Love, Wounded Warrior, Jeans for Justic, May Ride, Operation Homefront, and more.  We've also been recycling cans & bottles from our shows to help fund our tour!

Music is our dream, and what we love doing.  We have worked hard to make our dreams a reality, and any help is still greatly appreciated!  :)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please consider helping us spread the word by reposting this on Facebook, on Twitter, tell your friends, use the sharing tools here on IndieGogo... etc

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

On our new album GMO (Genetically Modified Oppression) we share our experiences with not only oppression politically and mentally, but also nutritionally. Myself, Role Pley and my cousin Juice ET Hugo, speak from our own perspectives. Me, at one time was a so called "illegal" immigrant that came with his family to the US to save his brother’s life when he was born with health defects. I share my story about growing up in a society which fostered cultural shame. Being Mexican and speaking a different language was something I tried to hide.

Juice ET Hugo speaks from a political and health perspective, in 2001 he was separated from his father because of immigration laws. In 2010, Juice was diagnosed with leukemia. Juice is convinced and presents evidence that genetically modified foods: things like soda, fast food, white flour, high fructose corn syrup, milk and other ingredients found in our everyday food made him more susceptible to cancer. In 2011, he drove his cancer into remission using a combination of medical marijuana and healthy eating. The purpose of the album is to expose these situations so that others can relate and be motivated by it.

GMO (Genetically Modified Oppression) is set to release December 7, 2013. With the help of conscious hip-hop names such as Dizzy Wright of Funk Volume, The Reminders, Rebel Diaz, DJ Cavem and a special appearance from Immortal Technique we hope to empower our listeners to pay more attention to their food, mind, spirit and the consumption habits that society finds acceptable.

What We Need & What You Get

This new album means so a lot to us because we believe that it can change someones life for the better. We figured its worth the investment we've made so far, getting us so close to our goal. We are so close to completing this project as planned. 

The be flat out out honest as we could be, we're struggling artists yo! 

We don't have a major company behind us to help get our message out so we took it upon ourselves and hopefully you can join us in our mission.

We have some perks that will give us chance to connect and shout each one of you! We always thank you on Facebook & Twitter, or give you all our music and sign anything you want us to (that is shipped to you), set you up with one of our cool shirts and if you hook us up enough we could arrange a performance to see us live ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD! (live streamed video performance option available)

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO HELP US PAY FOR THE FALLOWING THINGS

The next run of 1000 Retail ready eco friendly CD with booklet (we only could afford 200 copies the first time and we need more for our tour in 2014)

CD release posters

Stickers 

Banners 

Flyers 

The Impact

The ultimate goal of this album besides entertaining you and giving you something you can vibe to, we hope to save lives! We made it specifically to help cancer patients, depressed teenagers, dreamers, struggling artists and of course, as always, to give pride to people all around the world born with unique qualities and cultures.

Following our critically acclaimed "The Party of Revolucion Mixtape" ft Denver Nuggets DJ Psycho and our experimental album "Case Study 20:12", we currently have out our 2013 debut EP "The Translation" and "La Traduccion" where we takes you through the english and spanish versions of their lives. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate any money, no worries we will still give you a Twitter & FaceBook shout out! All you have to do is help us promote this campaign and mention us wherever you share it! Just click on the share button and choose your preferred social network.

story:
Time is running out. We can really use your support NOW!

These are a couple of actors from previous projects.

 

Let us introduce ourselves

I am Eric Anderson and I would like to ask to become an art patron and support a photographic project some friends and I are working on.

We are a collaborative group called team sparks. We are a group of artist with many skills that include dancers, models, fire performers, cinematic makeup artists and of course a photographer.

Sylvia Vale

The Valkyrie

Ivan Van Norman

The Dragon

KC Mussman

Freelance Makeup Artist

KC is a graduate of Cinema Makeup School in Los Angles, CA

 

Team Sparks

The crew behind the camera magic.
Here is Team Sparks in action from a segment of LAaRTS for PBSSOCAL.

This is the 3rd photo project we are working to create and want to level up to create something we hope will be something unique.  The basic concepts are the battle between good and evil.  We are planning to create a powerful and beautiful Valkyrie battling a fire breathing dragon.  We have a talented team of artist to create our dragon that can breathe fire and our Valkyrie with a flaming sword.

We are asking your help to cover the costs of creating the cinematic makeup and custom made fire sword.

Support the Arts and become a Patron

We will need to make armor for our Valkyrie that will include a custom fire sword and shield. Our dragon with have extensive prosthetic makeup. There is also body paint, costume and beautiful makeup.

In the past we have covered the cost through donation and just out of our pocket.  We do these art projects for the love of art.  This next project is something we hope to be a signature piece for our group.

  1. The estimated cost for the Dragon is between 750-850.
  2. The Valkyrie is about 600-700.
  3. The sword will be about 300.
  4. The remaining amount is to cover costume, additional final look makeup and fuel and other additional expenses.  Everyone is giving their time and energy to make this happen.

There will be test shooting and proof of concept shots. Our Valkyrie will be training to work with a large sword on fire.  We will need to shoot with our dragon so our exposure on location is perfect.  We will share our progress so you can see the concept take shape.

 

Inspire Artistic Minds is a 501c organization with the goal growing and supporting the artistic community. They are a generous sponsor of our production and we are so pleased to be associated with this forward looking group. If you are looking some support for your creative effort click the logo and visit their sight. They are really great people.


Join us!

We all want to invite you to become a critical part of the project and became a patron.  We will keep you posted on our progress. There will be opportunities to participate. Depending on the level of your support,  you will get digital images and prints.

There is also an opportunity to join us on the shoot. We wanted to get this project started and will fill you in with bios and details very soon.

Thanks again and we hope you will be a part of our next creative event.
