story:
Walking Revival

Hello everyone.  Thank you for visiting our Indiegogo campaign!  We appriciate the time that you are taking to consider helping our group with our Debut EP release "A Letter To The Fallen"!

Walking Revival is a group of musicians that got together about a year ago with a goal in mind:  To write, record, produce, and release an EP album then perform where ever we can.  We started with the end in mind and are just about to finish the first part of the project which is where you come in!

Walking Revival is Justin Kopchick-Front Man Lead Vocals, Bobby Fielder- Bass Guitar and background vocals, RJ Butler-Guitar and background vocals, and Cole Sandin keepin' the beat goin' on the drum kit.

We all played with other groups before we put WR together.  So when we started we decided that we would concentrate on writing and arranging music first and once we had enough songs we would release an EP and then begin performing.

Thats is where we are at now and why we are asking for your help!  We have been working with DSC Studios since January arranging, recording and producing our music.  (Huge Thanks to Drew Hodge our Producer!) 

Since we are all still in school and have to concentrate on our studies a project of this magnatude could take a very long time to complete. By releasing this campaign and your willingness to pre-order our music and merchandise we will be able to Rock a lot sooner than later!  With your help we will be able to achieve what would have taken at least a couple of years (maybe even 3 or 4) now.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have just about completed our songs at DSC Studios in Albuquerque, NM.  We have paid for most of the recording fees at the studio already to show the commitment that we have made and to have some skin in the game!

So what we are trying to achieve by this campaign is to be able to raise the balance due to DSC Studios, press our EP album on CD, and distribute our music digitally to the world.  Our goal is to raise $ 1,600.00.  This is the minimum amount that we need to cover:

  • The balance to DSC Studios.
  • Produce our first CD run.
  • The cost of digital distrubution (Including barcodes, registration fees, etc.)
  • Produce the mechandise pre-sold on this campaign
  • Indiegogo fees

You get an opportunity to help a young band get off to a solid start, get introduced to some great music, score some Awesome stuff and get lots of recognition in the process.  Some of the perks even give you an opportunity to be named as one of 3 levels of producer on the project!

You can help Walking Revival... RUN!!

If you want to hear a little of our music check out our recently released single "No One To Live For" on Band Camp.   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't do one of the perks right now we understand.  We are students and know sometimes it can be tough.  No worries!   You can still help us get the word out and get some excitement going about our music!  We have a post on Face Book We would love for you to share with your friends.  Indiegogo has some cool share tools too.

  • Like and Share our Face Book Page.
  • Follow us on Twitter.
  • Become a fan on our Reverbnation page.
  • Join our mailing list.

If you like our music help us share it with the world!

We appreciate the fact that you took the time to review our project!

WR

You get an opportunity to help a young band get off to a solid start, get introduced to some great music, score some Awesome stuff and get lots of recognition in the process.  Some of the perks even give you an opportunity to be named as one of 3 levels of producer on the project!
You can help Walking Revival... RUN!!
If you want to hear a little of our music check out our recently released single "No One To Live For" on Band Camp.   


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't do one of the perks right now we understand.  We are students and know sometimes it can be tough.  No worries!   You can still help us get the word out and get some excitement going about our music!  We have a post on Face Book We would love for you to share with your friends.  Indiegogo has some cool share tools too.

Like and Share our Face Book Page.
Follow us on Twitter.
Become a fan on our Reverbnation page.
Join our mailing list.

If you like our music help us share it with the world!
We appreciate the fact that you took the time to review our project!
WR

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mike Morrisseau and I am a guitarist based out of Edmonton, Canada.

I am going to be recording an EP of all original compositions. A very guitar driven and heavy jazz sound with lots of great harmony and melody. I am very excited about this project and will have some of Canada's best musicians on board. I have been working on the tunes for this album for 4 years and am ready to get them recorded and out to an audience.

I will need about $5000 to get this project out and pressed, so any contribution will help me out alot.

Where does the money go?

I need to pay for studio time which does not include mixing and mastering, Musician fees for my band, artwork, mixing, mastering, Pressing and distribution. All of these factors add up to be quite expensive, so any donation will be greatly appreciated.

I really want to get this album out, it has been sitting and stewing in my mind for way to long now, its time to get the music out!

story:
What is the Michigan Recital Project?

The Michigan Recital Project grew out of a love for our home state and a desire to program a recital that celebrates Michigan’s history and culture.  Early on, we realized that there wasn’t enough music out there to make up an entire recital.  “Well, this is criminal!” we said to ourselves, “Especially since there is such a wealth of musically talented Michiganders out there!”  So we commissioned four young composers to write some Michigan chamber music for us.  We are very excited about what they came up with, from poetry to pop music to urban gardens.  And they agreed to work for much less than they’re worth.  We would like to compensate them a little bit better for creating such amazing pieces.  This is where you come in!

The Big Picture 

We believe that all 21st century musicians have a responsibility to commission new works to help create the music that will define our time.  Your donations will directly impact the livelihood of young composers, and because we want to continue supporting emerging composers, 100% of any funds raised above our goal of $2500 will go to future Michigan Recital commissions. 

 We are still looking for:

Commissioning fees: 4 x $500 = 2000

Any amount is helpful, and we also have a "Sponsor a Composer" donor level.  If you are inspired by one of our four amazing composers, please let us know if you would like to support them specifically with your gift!

PHILIP RICE (b. 1988) is a composer of sacred and secular vocal and instrumental works. He graduated with distinction from Westminster Choir College with a Master of Music in composition in 2012, and summa cum laude from Central Michigan University with a Bachelor of Music degree in composition and theory in 2010. He is currently pursuing a Doctor of Musical Arts at Michigan State University.  Philip set a lovely poem about Lake Michigan into a short, 7-movement piece that intersperses solos with duets.

MARY MONTGOMERY KOPPEL (b. 1982)is a composer, teacher, music director, and soprano. DMA, Boston University School of Music; BA, Middlebury College; Diplôme in Composition, l’Ecole Normale de Musique de Paris. Before coming to Boston, she taught at Bennington College, where she also founded and conducted the Bennington College Chamber Singers. She is a founding member and composer-in-residence of the Lorelei Ensemble, a Boston-based women’s vocal group specializing in new and early music, engaged in commissioning composers in the US and internationally.  She has turned an excerpt from Longfellow's "The Song of Hiawatha" into a moving dramatic scena utilizing the full Michigan Recital Project ensemble.

SCOTT R. HARDING (b. 1968) is a lifelong Michigander, born in Bay City and growing up in rural small-towns Auburn and Cass City. Dr. Harding earned his BM in Theory/Composition from Central Michigan University in 1991, studying with award-winning band and percussion composer David R. Gillingham.  Dr. Harding went on to earn the MM and PhD in Composition at Michigan State University, working primarily with Gillingham's teacher Jere Hutcheson. His piece for the Michigan Recital Project is a mini-history lesson about all the musical and comedic talents that have emerged from Michigan over the years.

SCOTT J. ORDWAY (b. 1984) is Visiting Assistant Professor of Music at Bates College. He earned his Ph.D. in 2013 from the University of Pennsylvania, where he was the Benjamin Franklin Doctoral Fellow. He also holds degrees from the University of Oregon (MM, 2008), and in English literature at the University of Puget Sound (BA, 2006). He studied conducting at the Curtis Institute of Music and at the University of Oregon. In Europe, he  studied at the Accademia Chigiana in Tuscany and at the Freie Universität Berlin. Scott was inspired to create a piece about the urban gardens movement in Detroit. 

$500 = Fee for our videographer, Russ Anderson from TStop Pictures.  We had a great time putting together this video and Russ is amazing to work with!  If you like the video, please let us know and send your friends to TStop Pictures for their video needs! http://www.tstoppics.com/index.html

How can I experience it?

If you live in Boston or in Michigan, you can see the finished product!  We will have a world premiere recital in Boston (early September date TBA) and then we go on tour to Michigan in October!  Please visit https://www.facebook.com/TheMichiganRecitalProject for all tour updates and email us if you have any questions!

story:
Arison Walton & Products of Restoration (AWPOR) is an outreach ensemble which consists of young people from various backgrounds, with one goal in mind, and that is to make an impact in the world. AWPOR had the opportunity to open up for artists such as Kelly Price, Jagged Edge, Avant, also shared the stage with Vickie Winans, CeeCee Winans, MaryMary, Paul Porter and The Christianaires , and many others. We are grateful for everything that we have been able to do, but excited for the things to happen in the future. It is our goal and hope to use our platform to help others. We've started an initiative called Project U, below you will read what prompted this.

Christopher Wilson was a young man, dedicated to Christ and his spirit touched anyone he came in contact with. He was also the guitarist for AWPOR. During a drive with AWPOR’s band members, a fatal car accident occurred. Christopher, tragically lost his life while the others in the car were spared. Arison and POR took the loss of their friend and guitarist very hard. Through his pain, Arison began to write. This was the beginning of the album titled “U”. Arison decided to dedicate this album to Christopher. When Arison shared the vision God gave him about the dedication of the CD to Christopher’s mother, she was deeply touched. In addition, a portion of the proceeds will also go to a scholarship fund in Christopher's name. 

So we need your help to finish this project, so that we can simultaneously help someone else.

story:
Our Story

This is my very first Delisco James national independent original tour. I want you guys the fans to be involved for the artist, we've all worked countless hours putting together this show and the tour for you all to enjoy. 

The Impact

The impact of this tour is infinite, from bring you good vibrations to uplifting the spirits of displaced children around the nation and eventually around the world. If our tour doesn't happen we will try again, but with the help of you and your network we are confident that the manifestation of this campaign will occur.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5,000 to rent an RV and cover most of our travel expenses.  This is very important for us to make it safely to each venue and put on an amazing show for you.  We have some great incentives for all who help us with this part of the campaign. If we don't meet our entire goal we will try to explore other options to fulfill the mission of this campaign until we achieve our mission. 

Here is a list of some of the things you may get depending on how much is given to the campaign:

You may get a personally signed EP, other merchandise, discounted and/or free concert tickets, backstage passes, private parties.   


Other Ways You Can Help

If you guys can't donate any funds for the RV, then you can also help by sharing with all your friends within your demographic and outside of it about the, "Music is "Light" Tour. We appreciate all you guys assistance and support in achieving our mission.

story:
Our Story

We are Shameless to Say, an energetic four piece pop rock band hailing from Cheyenne, WY. We have been captivating crowds since summer of 2010. We have been known for our great stage presence and chant like chorus' that will have everyone in attendance singing along and jumping around with us.


 We have matured with creativity and experience over the past year and after the recording of our demo "History in the Making" we decided to sign our Manager Dave Skinner. With his help we have recorded at the famous Colorado Sound Studio (where artists such as Eminem, Panic At The Disco, and NSYNC have recorded) in Denver and have released the recordings to ITunes as well as releasing our first single "Call It A Victory" on Promo Only which is distributed worldwide to radio stations, pro DJâ€™s and Club owners.

 

In this past year we have gotten to play with some amazing musicians like Alien Ant Farm, Acidic, Lansdowne, Warped tour bands like Shut Up and Deal and many others. We projected a highly energetic stage presence on tour this past summer and are now working towards performing for the U.S. Troops in the Mideast Early 2012 followed by a U.S. Tour with up and coming band ACIDIC from L.A. But we need a few things to get us on our way. This is where you come in!

The Impact

This campaign is a major step in our dream to conquer the music industry. With our music we hope to bring people together and bring joy to all our listeners and gain new fans. Growing up we have looked up to all of our influences hoping one day we could be performing across the nation. Though we have managed to do all of these great things at our own expense it hasn't been easy! It has taken much hard work and dedication. With your help and sufficient funding, we plan on taking our musical inspirations to the next level. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $25,000. With this money we will be able to purchase:

1-      A Band Van for touring

2-      A Hitch Trailer for touring

3-      Studio time

4-      CD Duplication

5-      Upgrade band equipment that needs to be replaced (Travel cases, guitars, cables, etc.)


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help donate then donâ€™t worry, you can help us just by letting others know about our cause. Just add this link to your Facebook page or website. Thanks for your support

story:
Our Story

There's a dream among many people in Cebu right now to have an orchestra development program available for its youth, especially the underprivileged.

A family in Cebu once funded a 10-year orchestra development program for gifted, underprivileged kids from the year 1990 to 2000. At least 30 of these kids have gone on to become professional musicians and teachers around their country and other parts of the world. 


There is a program in Venezuela which has transformed the lives of more than 2 million children from lives of crime and destruction to lives of responsibility and inspiration, through music education and performance. The dream in Cebu now is to have such a program available for her people.


As a member of the family that funded the first long-term orchestra development program in Cebu, the mission to continue this work is very much a part of me.


The Impact

Out of my being given the chance to go on a 3-month trip to North and South America for the observation of music systems, volunteer work, and network building, I hope to come home to Cebu, Philippines, and develop what we have now into a sustainable world class music education and performance system, in partnership with  individuals,organizations and artists throughout the world.


What We Need & What You Get


Below are the list of items and expenses for Phase I of this project: my 3-month immersion abroad:


Budget



US and Venezuelan Visa Application

$500


Airfare

$3,000


Cebu-LA-Cebu



LA to New York



New York to Caracas, Venezuela



Caracas to Atlanta



Atlanta to Texas



Texas to LA



Accommodation

$3,000


Meals

$3,000


Transportation

$2,000


Cultural program observations

$500

Any amount above $500 will be covered by the participant

Violin Pedagogy Studies

-$500.00

Care of participant

Other living expenses

$1,000


Total

$13,000



I have partnered with a local foundation in Cebu to provide official receipts and documentation for each of my sponsors, and you will be counted as one of them, if you wish.


I promise to keep you updated on the progress of this immersion abroad followed by its implementation, and any time you choose to drop by Cebu, you are welcome to see our progress first hand. 


GETTING THE WORD OUT

If you know of friends, family, or organizations who have a heart for contributing to music for underprivileged children, please send them a link to this project. Your effort will go a long way.

story:
HELLO EVERYONE :)  

                          From the whole band to you the viewer THANK YOU :) in advance for taking the time to take a look at our campaign and for your consideration. We (Find The Fallen) are a Yorkton, Saskatchewan based Christian Rock/Worship band that has just formed over the last year and a half. But we have been truly blessed in our short time to have already done two Western Canada Tours with (2x) Christian hip hop Grammy nominee Fresh IE out of Winnipeg, Manitoba along with many other gigs around Saskatchewan and Manitoba. The Band consists of five members, Jon Tieszen (lead vocals), Crystal Tieszen (lead/backup vocals/Piano), Kyle Brewer (drums), Troy Janzen (bass) and Dustin Wilson (Lead Guitar).

    This campaign is so important to us because of our passion for this generation of hurting youth. As a young band between the ages of 23-33 we desire to let this generation know that they don't have to live broken and destructive lives. That there is a purpose and plan for everyone of them where they themselves can make a difference in the world with their gifts and talents. With Alcohol, drug , sexual, physical and mental abuse along with teen suicide on the rise, our hearts desire to leave a mark of love upon each and everyone of them. As individuals we have all faced this in one form or another and through out testimonies we've been able to minister at many youth events sharing our hearts and gifts to make a positive impact in their lives. With the pressures they face each day continually growing, we want to bring the message hope of Love and Purpose through Jesus Christ (who is Love). We have played our own personal music and give our own personal testimonies everywhere we go, but we do not have a CD to get into the hands of youth. That is why this campaign is so important, because it will give us that opportunity to reach more and more youth, not just in our own back yards, but around the world.

    As i mentioned, our desire is to get this message world wide. There are many that say they want to do it and there are few that actually commit themselves to doing it. We are one of the committed few who are going to do this. Your support will not just effect the lives of each of our band members but impact a whole generation. We truly believe no matter how much you are able to contribute, any heart that is reached and every life that is transformed will be laid to your account as well as ours. We are in this together and no one is greater than the other but all have an equal roll. 

What We Need & What You Get

   There are three major needs we have at this point. We need funds to be able to get our CD mixed and mastered so we can release something of quality. Our second need is to be able to get the CD's printed and labelled for distribution. Finally, the distribution itself. There are a few companies that we are aware of that can help us get our songs to radio and that will get the ball rolling for sure.

The cost for mixing and mastering for our 10 song CD is $3000 (We have started this process at Studio 11 in Winnipeg, Manitoba) and we already have raised half of this ($1,500) through shows, performances, family and friends. We are trying to raise as much of this cost without this so we can have our mixing and mastering process compete by mid-May. But if we are unable to do that we will use what we get from here to finish that part of the project.

The cost of the CD printing and labeling for 2000 CD's (our target) is about $1.25-1.50 per CD (between $2,500-3000 dollars).

The cost of distribution will run right around $1000. This will get our product to radio stations across north america and possibly even around the world.

The Total we would really like to achieve and would make all this doable is $4,500

NOTHING of this campaign is going into our own personal pockets and that is our promise!

If we do not reach our Goal all of the contributions will just continue to pave the way for our CD to be produced. That is our focus and desire.

The Impact

Our Vision is not a selfish or one of small proportion for that matter. We truly want to go to all the world for the cause of seeing lives transformed and changed and this is just one of the avenues that we are able to do that. We desire to go on missions trips and do tours that will take us to places where few want to go. Everyone these days desires a big stage and a huge audience, of course that would be nice, but more important than all of the is the ones that don't seem to be noticed or heard. The poor, the broken, the orphan and any other who is in drastic need of change. This is who we want to reach. Our band name speaks of our desire to reach the fallen soldiers of life who are casualties of a broken society. I heard a man say one time " If your not willing to go to all the world and make a difference, then support someone is willing". We've made up our minds that we are willing and are asking your assistance so we can do this together. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are grateful for all those that are able to help financially very much so, but if you are unable to help financially here are a couple ways that you can be a difference maker as well.

1.Prayer - if any of you pray who read this, say a prayer for us that all of this work out and that lives will be changed

2.Tell someone else - You can always spread the word about us and our project to friends or family or anyone who is looking to make a difference to where they can see their money at work

3.Share - Please share our link to all the friends, family and people you know  

We want to make sure that each contribution is recognized, so you will have your name mentioned on our website and a shout out on our YouTube channel. Donations will obviously come with perks. YAY, FOR PERKS!! :)
story_txt:
HELLO EVERYONE :)  
                          From the whole band to you the viewer THANK YOU :) in advance for taking the time to take a look at our
campaign and for your consideration. We (Find The Fallen) are a Yorkton,
Saskatchewan based Christian Rock/Worship band that has just formed over the
last year and a half. But we have been truly blessed in our short time to have
already done two Western Canada Tours with (2x) Christian hip hop Grammy nominee
Fresh IE out of Winnipeg, Manitoba along with many other gigs around
Saskatchewan and Manitoba. The Band consists of five members, Jon Tieszen (lead vocals), Crystal Tieszen (lead/backup vocals/Piano), Kyle Brewer (drums), Troy Janzen (bass) and Dustin Wilson (Lead Guitar).
    This campaign is so important to us because of our passion
for this generation of hurting youth. As a young band between the ages of 23-33
we desire to let this generation know that they don't have to live broken and
destructive lives. That there is a purpose and plan for everyone of them where
they themselves can make a difference in the world with their gifts and
talents. With Alcohol, drug , sexual, physical and mental abuse along with teen
suicide on the rise, our hearts desire to leave a mark of love upon each and
everyone of them. As individuals we have all faced this in one form or another
and through out testimonies we've been able to minister at many youth events
sharing our hearts and gifts to make a positive impact in their lives. With the
pressures they face each day continually growing, we want to bring the message
hope of Love and Purpose through Jesus Christ (who is Love). We have played our
own personal music and give our own personal testimonies everywhere we go, but
we do not have a CD to get into the hands of youth. That is why this campaign
is so important, because it will give us that opportunity to reach more and
more youth, not just in our own back yards, but around the world.
    As i mentioned, our desire is to get this message world
wide. There are many that say they want to do it and there are few that
actually commit themselves to doing it. We are one of the committed few who are
going to do this. Your support will not just effect the lives of each of our
band members but impact a whole generation. We truly believe no matter how much
you are able to contribute, any heart that is reached and every life that is
transformed will be laid to your account as well as ours. We are in this
together and no one is greater than the other but all have an equal roll. 
What We Need &
What You Get
   There are three major needs we have at this point. We need
funds to be able to get our CD mixed and mastered so we can release something
of quality. Our second need is to be able to get the CD's printed and labelled
for distribution. Finally, the distribution itself. There are a few companies that we are aware of that can help us get our songs to radio and that will get the ball rolling for sure.The cost for mixing and mastering for our 10 song CD is $3000
(We have started this process at Studio 11 in Winnipeg, Manitoba) and we
already have raised half of this ($1,500) through shows, performances, family
and friends. We are trying to raise as much of this cost without this so we can have our mixing and mastering process compete by mid-May. But if we are unable to do that we will use what we get from here to finish that part of the project.The cost of the CD printing and labeling for 2000 CD's (our
target) is about $1.25-1.50 per CD (between $2,500-3000 dollars).The cost of distribution will run right around $1000. This will get our product to radio stations across north america and possibly even around the world.The Total we would really like to achieve and would make all this doable is $4,500
NOTHING of this campaign is going into our own personal pockets and that
is our promise!
If we do not reach our Goal all of the contributions will just continue
to pave the way for our CD to be produced. That is our focus and desire.
The Impact
Our Vision is not a selfish or one of small proportion for that matter.
We truly want to go to all the world for the cause of seeing lives transformed
and changed and this is just one of the avenues that we are able to do that. We
desire to go on missions trips and do tours that will take us to places where
few want to go. Everyone these days desires a big stage and a huge audience, of
course that would be nice, but more important than all of the is the ones that
don't seem to be noticed or heard. The poor, the broken, the orphan and any
other who is in drastic need of change. This is who we want to reach. Our band
name speaks of our desire to reach the fallen soldiers of life who are
casualties of a broken society. I heard a man say one time " If your not
willing to go to all the world and make a difference, then support someone is
willing". We've made up our minds that we are willing and are asking your
assistance so we can do this together. 
Other Ways You Can
Help
We are grateful for all those that are able to help financially very
much so, but if you are unable to help financially here are a couple ways that
you can be a difference maker as well.
1.Prayer - if any of you pray who read this, say a prayer for us that
all of this work out and that lives will be changed
2.Tell someone else - You can always spread the word about us and our
project to friends or family or anyone who is looking to make a difference to
where they can see their money at work
3.Share - Please share our link to all the friends, family and people
you know  
We want to make sure that each contribution is recognized, so you will
have your name mentioned on our website and a shout out on our YouTube channel.
Donations will obviously come with perks. YAY, FOR PERKS!! :)

story:
BIG CITY DIVAS

Big City Divas is a music project consisting of 17 musicians and one bandleader. The band is not an old school Big Band, but a large band playing pop. soul, and r&b. We plan play 4-6 gigs on festivals this summer. To every gig invite five popular and well known swedish female artists to front the band with their own songs specifically arranged for Big City Divas.

It's time for more women on today's music scenes! Big City Divas will set the standard - so far so good!

www.bigcitydivas.se


ALTHOUGH!

Music scenes of today is so unequal that we would probably perish if we don´t get the opportunity to show you how many fabulous female musicians there is.

Big City Divas has been put together for this summer, it´s not a consisting band from before. This means that musicians and artists will not have a chance to rehearse unless we create that opportunity.

We don’t have the possibility to give them that opportunity, without help from amazing people like YOU!


THE IDEE AND INSPIRATION


Gudrun Hauksdottir has worked with a number of the most popular artists i Sweden for the last 15 years and says last summer two things happened which lead to us starting up this 

1. A well known non-profit organisation in Sweden looked at all festivals and found out the following figures; about only 15-20% of the bands are female. Some has a bit more but then again lot of them are much worse with 0%. These figures were more or less the same 15 years ago.

2. I saw this clip with Beyonces all female band "Suga Mamas" on the internet and immediately thought YESSSSS  this is what i´m gonna do, a swedish version of Suga Mamas!



PEOPLE ON STAGE

We have searched our network of people carefully, to finally put together the best of Sweden’s top female musicians and artists, making Big City Divas shows the best possible!

The musicians forming the band are current, been active on the Swedish music scene for many years and has played with artists such as Frida Hyvönen, Oskar Linros, Jenny Wilson, Malena Erman, Tommy Körberg, Serengeti, Orup, Alina Dvereski and many others. They will all contribute with creativity and professionalism from their diverse musical backgrounds, and give Big City Divas a unique sound and energy.


WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU

In total we need to raise an amount of 17,000 Euro. Funds raised from this campaign will finance one week of rehearsal, supporting salary for musicians and artists preparing for this summers gigs with Big City Divas. The musicians get paid on invoice so they pay their taxes themselves

Salary for 1 musician, 1 day = 200€

1 musician X 5 days= 1000€

17 musicians x 1000€ = 17000€ for one week


WHY WE DO THIS

The lack of equality in the music industry and on the music scenes affect us all, in one way or another, more or less. We are influenced, inspired and effected by of the rolemodels we encounter. Big City Divas wish to inspire and boost people to work together towards equality in the music business. For us to succeed in this, it is required that bookers and music industry as a whole ensures that there is a substantial increase in female-dominated acts to music scenes, and that  this is taken as a matter of course from today.



Today, musicians are not getting paid for preparation and rehearsal time. Big City Divas is seeking finance to provide musicians and artists with a rehearsal week.  One week where artists will be paid for the whole of their creative process. To do this we need your help and would love it if you would share our video and give a donation. Get involved in this summer's heaviest musical projects on, and spread the campaign!!

If you work you should get paid, simple as det. Working as a musician for Big City Divas will be a full time job during the rehearsal week, for at least 5 days - 8 hours a day. We see it as a given that the musicians should get paid for their work and the whole of their creative process. Big City Divas is a project with a purpose, a goal and a vision. Musicians and artists take time away from their personal career because they see the importance of contributing to the common goal of equality in the music scene ... and because it's gonna be a hell turn on stage of course!


WHY CONTRIBUTE?

By contributing to Big City Divas rehearsal week you:

  • make a statement for a gender equality on the music scenes.

  • contribute so that YOU can experience COMPLETELY amazing concerts this summer!

  • make possible, joint with Big City Divas, a project that will bring a big impact for female musicians and artists on the festival scenes in summer of 2014.

  • make a continuous work possible. Because: the more rehearsal time we can give the musicians, the bigger pervasive beat on the scenes. This in turn produces a ripple effect in terms of real impact there and then. and also a bigger possibility to continue working with BCD for equality in the music scenes. We do not want to quit after this summer.





SHEMUSIC

SheMusic who is the organizer of the project Big City Divas is a non-profit organization that has been operating in Sweden for 20 years. Initially SheMusic organized various concert projects with only female musicians, this developed into a SheMusic-festival in the same spirit. In order to provide a scene which is represented by both men and women, SheMusic arranges concerts that vary from traditional line-ups, with a minimum of 50% (often 100%) women booked. SheMusic is joyous to announce it´s next initiative towards balance in the music business, Big City Divas!

SheMusic manifest says: ”SheMusic want to stand as a beacon and be a constant source of inspiration for women's musicianship. SheMusic hopes to see the collaboration of various feminist approaches and perspectives; with the ultimate goal of gender equality in the music scene”.

SheMusic have a large and active music network and has worked with artists such as; Robyn, Agnes, Neneh Cherry Sarah Dawn Finer, Jenny Wilson, Mapei, Titiyo, Linnea Henriksson and others. Saying that, Big City Divas does not expect any problems booking artists to the gigs this summer but we are not able to go out officially with all the names until festivals are booked and ready. We have to keep in mind that participating artists need to be able to keep a hold of their own tour plans and also book their gigs with Big City Divas.

 

                                

REHEARSAL AND GIGS

Preparations and rehearsal for the gigs are planned to begin with Big City Divas and artists getting together for a joint rehearsal week in early summer (which is why we are doing this campaign). Here they get to join in on a creative process to rearrange the artists songs for Big City Divas. The artists will thus play their own songs, for you to feel at home and stoked. The songs will then be reworked, made ​​bigger and thicker to fit in with a band in the size of Big City Divas!


THE FUTURE FOR BCD

After this summers gigs a goal is to find one or more additional gigs for Big City Divas in the autumn of 2014. The idea is to focus on areas which at a current state are male-dominated, such as christmas-shows, television programs etc. Big City Divas goal is to continue as a beacon for gender equality in the music business, even after the summer’s shows. This will either be made ​​possible through continuous reservations like above, or through collaborations with additional artists in Sweden and Scandinavia. The idea is to further develop and expand the concept so that Big City Divas can influence and inspire female musicianship outside of Sweden.


IMPACT- MORE INFO AND BACKGROUND

Today only 15-20% female musicians are booked to festivals around Scandinavia. Unfortunately this has not improved much in recent years. In 2013, you could see that among 25 festivals 77% of the bands booked were dominated by men, only 19% of these were female-dominated, and 4% mixed.

If we take a look at bookers and organizers of festivals, figures has not improved much in here neither. During the year of 2013 it was found that among people who booked artists for ten of the largest festivals only 12% were women, 88% male.

If we search online for equality in the music business and women on stage it's easy to find statements like, "it's all about what’s out there," or "it is difficult to find the female musicians". We mean that such a statement is a matter of convenience, habit and laziness. In this way bookers and such disclaims any liability whatsoever for a job towards an equal music industry. Today there is no drought of female creators of music, yet it is still one of the most common arguments to not book equal. SheMusic has worked for over 20 years and have never experienced this problem that bookers or other music organizers too often complains about.

Making a quick research on reviews, headlines and articles in the music business where women are central, we can still see an excessive focus on their fashion choices, attitude and behaviour, than the actual music itself. Big City Divas and SheMusic are certain that in time it is possible to change those structures that maintain the fact that today's music scene is mostly made up of men.

Big City Divas is a project wholly made by people who define themselves as a women. The change towards an equal music scene requires commitment from both bookers, artists, men and women. It is time to change, to advance the work for gender equality and provide clear feminist initiatives to all music scenes around the globe.

Big City Divas will stand as beacon and a clear example that there is plenty of female mastery in the music business, and which long ago ought to have had it´s obvious place on the stages around the country.

Best of regards

Gudrun Hauksdottir
Jeanette Karlström
Kristin Olsson

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

                               That’s all there is to it
                          SUPPORT BIG CITY DIVAS!!!

 SHARE! - SHARE! -  SHARE! - SHARE! - SHARE! - SHARE! - SHARE!

story:
Who is a MK837?

We’re an independent electronic dance music label based in Atlanta and Birmingham, Al. We’ve been around now for three years and we’ve specialized in exposing new talent to the EDM market. We’ve had the honor of breaking several artists now who are beginning to gain respect in the larger scene. What we’re trying to do is launch even more. We’re not in it for the money, we’re in it for the love of music and to help others along the way.

What are we doing?

We’re trying to take the label to the next plateau so that we can continue to find and push new EDM acts into the larger market.

How will we do it and what’s the money for?

Over the years, it’s been a lot of blood, sweat and tears. That will still be the foundation of all that we do. What we’re going to do differently is focus more on the quality of our artist’s material and push it work harder to give them the press exposure that they need.

That’s where Indiegogo comes into play. We’re going to use the funds to provide our artist’s professional mastering services at no charge to them and to hire a publicist for the label who will focus on promoting our artists and their releases. These funds will cover all of our production expenses for the next 12 months. Each release can easily cost up to $600-800 apiece even in a digital format.

Why do we think we can do this?

We started the label in 2010 after realizing how difficult it is to break new talent into a market. A lot of this came from our own personal experience and frustrations. In the end, we realized that artists need an alley and typically record labels are not an artist’s alley. MK837 was set up from the start to not screw artists over. We offer our artists a large cut of our revenue and we also do everything possible to make sure they get paid. Beyond that, we cover expenses that most labels would simple charge back to their artists. We’ve been an alley now of over 40 different artists and we have every intention of continuing that tradition.

What success has MK837 had in the past?

Here’s a short list of accomplishments:

  1. We have had multiple tracks featured as “Must Hear” tracks on Beatport.com
  2. We can say the same for our tracks on Traxsource and Satellite EDM as well.
  3. We’ve had an EP take the #5 slot on iTune’s Dance charts.
  4. We released an EP that took the #1 and #2 slots for almost 2 weeks on Satellite EDM.
  5. Just about every release we had last year charted on Satellite EDM and others. 
  6. We’ve had the honor of breaking artists like Xen Ochren, Rikki and Retchid among others.
  7. Our artists have been featured on multiple podcasts including Matt Darey’s Nocturnal Sunshine.
  8. We’ve had numerous tracks receive play on FM Radio.
  9. Looking beyond money, we’ve a socially active label and have participated in fundraising to end human trafficking.

To learn more about MK837 and what we've done, please visit www.mk837.com, www.facebook.com/mk837, https://soundcloud.com/mk837 and www.beatport.com/label/mk837/15722. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us at info@mk837.com. 

What’s in it for you?

You can read about all of our perks to the right, but here’s a graphic. Remember with each dollar level up you go; you get everything from the lower levels as well. 

More Details on Mastering and Publicity Expenses:

Mastering:

Your funds will be going to pay for the mastering of our releases over the next 12 months. Mastering, inc case you don’t know, is the final process all music should undergo before it is released to stores. It adds that polished, warm and rich sound to it. Without mastering, music often times seems dull and lifeless.  

We’re estimating that we will release close to 60 tracks during that time. One of those releases will be our annual Sounds of Summer compilation. We have a tentative agreement with Justin of Shiloh to handle our mastering. If you’re familiar with Shiloh’s work, you know that they know quality. We have a few alternates should we fall a bit short in funds.

Publicity:

Publicity is the key. It’s getting the word out to the media. The media in turn decides if our story should be their story and if they like it, we get to reach not only our regular audience, but theirs as well.

Currently, we are best equipped to reach about 1,000 people with every post we make. That’s nowhere near as many as we need to be reaching. We also need to grow that base as quickly as we can with people who are genuinely want to learn more about MK837. To accomplish this, we are potentially going to contract with Hammerica http://hammarica.com/pr/ to handle most of our publicity needs. This is where the largest portion of the $14,500 will be allocated. 

One Last Thing to Know...

Neither Dave or Kevin will be pocketing a dime of this money. Every bit will be used to cover either mastering, publicity or other operational expenses for the label. Both have decent day jobs to cover their living expenses. 

Other Ways to Help:

We know money is tight these days. Sometimes you don’t even have $5 to help a fundraiser like this out. That’s fine. We understand. We’d still like to give you a couple of ways to support us. Here’s a short list:

  • Share our Indiegogo with all of your friends. If just one supports us, you’ve helped. If they share it with their friends, you’ve helped.
  • Email us a quote we can use from you to help promote the label and the Indiegogo. We’d love to hear how our artists have touched you or helped to make your night extra special.
  • If you have 2 minutes, make us a short 1-2 minute video and then send it to use at info@mk837.com. We’ll slap our Capital Gains for Growing Pains logo on it and post it to Youtube. You’ll get credit for it as well as our thanks.
  • Got another idea? Let us know and do it! We need to get the word out so we can make our goal.

Thanks so much for taking time out to read all of this. Don't forget to contact us at info@mk837.com with any questions you have about our fundraiser. Either Dave or Kevin will respond.

Thanks!

The MK837 Team

How will we do it and what’s the money for?
Over the years, it’s been a lot of blood, sweat and tears. That will still be the foundation of all that we do. What we’re going to do differently is focus more on the quality of our artist’s material and push it work harder to give them the press exposure that they need.
That’s where Indiegogo comes into play. We’re going to use the funds to provide our artist’s professional mastering services at no charge to them and to hire a publicist for the label who will focus on promoting our artists and their releases. These funds will cover all of our production expenses for the next 12 months. Each release can easily cost up to $600-800 apiece even in a digital format.
Why do we think we can do this?
We started the label in 2010 after realizing how difficult it is to break new talent into a market. A lot of this came from our own personal experience and frustrations. In the end, we realized that artists need an alley and typically record labels are not an artist’s alley. MK837 was set up from the start to not screw artists over. We offer our artists a large cut of our revenue and we also do everything possible to make sure they get paid. Beyond that, we cover expenses that most labels would simple charge back to their artists. We’ve been an alley now of over 40 different artists and we have every intention of continuing that tradition.
What success has MK837 had in the past?
Here’s a short list of accomplishments:

We have had multiple tracks featured as “Must Hear” tracks on Beatport.com
We can say the same for our tracks on Traxsource and Satellite EDM as well.
We’ve had an EP take the #5 slot on iTune’s Dance charts.
We released an EP that took the #1 and #2 slots for almost 2 weeks on Satellite EDM.
Just about every release we had last year charted on Satellite EDM and others. 
We’ve had the honor of breaking artists like Xen Ochren, Rikki and Retchid among others.
Our artists have been featured on multiple podcasts including Matt Darey’s Nocturnal Sunshine.
We’ve had numerous tracks receive play on FM Radio.
Looking beyond money, we’ve a socially active label and have participated in fundraising to end human trafficking.
To learn more about MK837 and what we've done, please visit www.mk837.com, www.facebook.com/mk837, https://soundcloud.com/mk837 and www.beatport.com/label/mk837/15722. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us at info@mk837.com. 
What’s in it for you?
You can read about all of our perks to the right, but here’s a graphic. Remember with each dollar level up you go; you get everything from the lower levels as well. 

More Details on Mastering and Publicity Expenses:
Mastering:
Your funds will be going to pay for the mastering of our releases over the next 12 months. Mastering, inc case you don’t know, is the final process all music should undergo before it is released to stores. It adds that polished, warm and rich sound to it. Without mastering, music often times seems dull and lifeless.  
We’re estimating that we will release close to 60 tracks during that time. One of those releases will be our annual Sounds of Summer compilation. We have a tentative agreement with Justin of Shiloh to handle our mastering. If you’re familiar with Shiloh’s work, you know that they know quality. We have a few alternates should we fall a bit short in funds.
Publicity:
Publicity is the key. It’s getting the word out to the media. The media in turn decides if our story should be their story and if they like it, we get to reach not only our regular audience, but theirs as well.
Currently, we are best equipped to reach about 1,000 people with every post we make. That’s nowhere near as many as we need to be reaching. We also need to grow that base as quickly as we can with people who are genuinely want to learn more about MK837. To accomplish this, we are potentially going to contract with Hammerica http://hammarica.com/pr/ to handle most of our publicity needs. This is where the largest portion of the $14,500 will be allocated. 
One Last Thing to Know...
Neither Dave or Kevin will be pocketing a dime of this money. Every bit will be used to cover either mastering, publicity or other operational expenses for the label. Both have decent day jobs to cover their living expenses. 
Other Ways to Help:
We know money is tight these days. Sometimes you don’t even have $5 to help a fundraiser like this out. That’s fine. We understand. We’d still like to give you a couple of ways to support us. Here’s a short list:

Share our Indiegogo with all of your friends. If just one supports us, you’ve helped. If they share it with their friends, you’ve helped.
Email us a quote we can use from you to help promote the label and the Indiegogo. We’d love to hear how our artists have touched you or helped to make your night extra special.
If you have 2 minutes, make us a short 1-2 minute video and then send it to use at info@mk837.com. We’ll slap our Capital Gains for Growing Pains logo on it and post it to Youtube. You’ll get credit for it as well as our thanks.
Got another idea? Let us know and do it! We need to get the word out so we can make our goal.
Thanks so much for taking time out to read all of this. Don't forget to contact us at info@mk837.com with any questions you have about our fundraiser. Either Dave or Kevin will respond.
Thanks!
The MK837 Team

story:
Hi, my name is Lisa Mychols. I'm a songwriter and musician that has worked with Wondermints, The Masticators and Nushu. I've also put out a couple of solo projects. None have ever been as important as this one, though. With all the inspirations I've taken in over the years, I feel as if I'm giving back to those very same inspirations now. So many other wonderful artists and incredible sounds that are such a big part of my musical makeup.

 

This labor of love has been in the works for over three years now. I've spent countless hours tweaking lyrics and details, trying to get my feelings across as lovingly as I possibly can. This is truly my most personal work yet. It's so personal, in fact, that I want people to be able to hold it in their hands, and not just download it on their computer. I want people to feel the way that I did, when I was in high school and clutched my copy of "This Is Gene Pitney," as I listened to sounds that I knew would change my life forever. The next question is, how do I do this? I've seen friends do fundraisers to support artistic projects like this, so I thought I'd give it a try, too. They say that timing is everything, and I feel like with this album, NOW really is the time. 

 

The album is finished and mixed, but I'm still in need of funds to cover manufacturing of the compact discs and promotional items. Manufacturing is going to cost roughly $1000, and the promotional items another $200, so my total budget is $1200. As perks, most donors will get a copy of the new album, and extras like additional albums and promotional items.

 

Tom Richards and I put so much love into this music, and I really believe we have a lot to offer. What we really need, though, is for everyone to support this project, by sharing on Facebook, sending out emails and telling everyone they know that new Lisa Mychols music in on the horizon.

 

Lastly, to all the Lisa Mychols fans out there, I created this for you and it is a creation of love. It is the only way I have to return to you, the love that you've shown me in the past. Along with the artists and sounds that have always inspired me, a much bigger inspiration has been the connection that we all have together. Please donate whatever you can, and help me release my album, "Above, Beyond & In Between."

 

All my Love,

Lisa

story:
Over the years, the My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic fandom has inspired a healthy art and music scene. Some people enjoy remixing the songs from the show and writing their own arrangements as a hobby. Others dedicate every waking moment to their music in hopes of pursuing a career. Pegasound aims to promote the music of these musicians through advertising, live performances, and distribution of physical media.
 
One major goal is the distribution of physical media, CD's! If you have been to a convention recently you may have noticed a small group of musicians in some back corner of the dealers room trying to sell off a few home made copies of their CD's. Didn't see them? With Pegasound we can consolidate all of the musicians tables into one. so you can easily find the music you want, and the musicians can focus more on their music.
 
Pulling this off is not going to be easy, or cheap. We need funding to setup shows and tours, and move musicians to and from these shows, as well as advertising them. And lets not forget the equipment and software needed to make this happen.
 
Pegasound strives above all to give a boost to the careers of the musicians. if you want to help, but simply can't spare any money, then spread the word!
If you have a podcast, talk about us.
If you're an artist, how about some fan art?
Or if you're just a music lover then like our Facebook page
https://www.facebook.com/Pegasound?fref=ts

We hope to bring you, and the rest of the world, the best music this fandom has to offer.

story:
Hello, I am CJ Clark and I am 19 years old. I am a musician. I have been playing the guitar since I was 10, singing and writing songs since I was 14, a little piano since I was 17, and have played many shows and performed with a band (The Delmore Schwartz) for 5 years. 
   I have been writing my own music for over 6 years now, but have never been fortunate enough to afford the equipment to properly record my songs. (I was using my ipod touch and its earbud-microphone to record my first song.)  

  I now want to record my first official solo album and put it out for everyone to hear. I am hoping that I can somehow get $800 which would allow me to get the Tascam 24-track recording equipment. 
   Frankly, I am set on the Tascam because I have had experience with it, and it works well, but cannot afford one of my own. I am a one-man singer/songwriter and I work on all of my music by myself, so I hope to more efficiently get my recording done. 

   To be honest, I was hesitant to do this type of thing (Indiegogo), only because I did not feel it was important enought to waste people's time with. But I realized that if I don't give it a shot, no one might ever hear my music. That's all I really want to be able to do, because if no one hears my music, then I won't ever truly know if it's good. I want more than ever to become 'that song on the radio that you can't get out of your head." I just wish to be heard, and hopefully, if all goes well, I can bring joy to people's lives by giving them music. 

I ask, if you don't donate, to please atleast give my song a listen and maybe you'll like it. If you like it, spread the word. If you don't, please share it anyway. Even that can help me. I just want people to hear my music. Thank you. 

 You can follow the link on my profile if you would like to hear the only song I have an official recording of so you can hear what my music might sound like. I worked ever so hard on it to get it the way it was. Hope you like it and I hope you can make any sort of donation to help me put my music out there to be heard. I want to write, record, and perform for the rest of my life.

story:
The Rock Guitar Shelter (RGS) opened in early 2011 and is currently in the process of attaining registered non-profit status. The operation is currently mobile and we are looking to find a more permanent location.

Our Mission

RGS is a unique Calgary-based organization dedicated to bringing the gift of music to underprivileged youth and children by providing them with donated guitars and music lessons.

At the RGS, we believe in the pursuit of musical training not only for the enjoyment it provides, but also as a necessary educational gift to all ages. Benefits include:

  • Developing a causal link between music and spatial intelligence (ability to see mental pictures of things accurately)

  • Improving language and reasoning skills

  • Improving creative thinking and problem solving abilities

  • Providing a healthy means by which children express themselves

  • Teaching young people discipline and evaluating risk-taking

  • Developing a sense of achievement

  • Raising self-esteem

To facilitate these benefits, we:

  • Accept donated guitars and other musical instruments and re-gift them to qualified children and youth

  • Assist children and youth in learning about their instrument including restoration and maintenance

  • Teach children and youth how to play guitar

  • Provide a sound stage on which children and youth can edit, mix, and record their music

  • Provide a safe, drug-free environment for children and youth to form new friendships and share their love of music

History

From approximately 1998 to 2011, Mr. J.R. Fleet (JR) ran a hugely successful and award-

winning contracting business. However, despite his success, JR felt he had not yet achieved everything he wanted to in life. When his father and mentor passed away suddenly in early 2011, JR made the bold decision to leave behind what he was good at and follow a dream - “to do something with music and kids.” In particular, he wanted to assist families and youths living in difficult circumstances who were unable to afford guitar or music lessons. Music saved JR's life when he was a troubled youth and he wanted to bring the gift of music to as many young people as possible. From this arose the Rock Guitar Shelter.

RGS was modelled after the old-school garage bands common in the late 1960s and early 1970s which had given rise to rock and roll icons such as Jimi Hendrix, Buddy Holly, and Stevie Ray Vaughn. Its gaily painted exterior attracted attention and drew people in. For 17 months, JR reconditioned and re-furbished guitars. During this period he donated in excess of 700 guitars and other related musical gear, and gave lessons to over 100 children. He hosted bands and jam sessions, took part in other community-related events, and put on fun events such as face-painting and modelling shoots for the children and youth that came to the shelter. Beneficiaries of his largesse included individual children, adults who brought music to children through their own volunteer activities, and other institutions and charities, including, but not limited to:

  • Heart and Stroke Foundation

  • Cerebral Palsy Association

  • MS Society

  • ALS Association

  • Kids Up Front

  • United Way

  • Alberta Children’s Hospital

  • Third Academy School for Special Needs Children

In April 2012, a by-law issue forced the Rock Guitar Shelter out of its premises on 17th Ave. NW. This temporary set-back fuelled the development of our current mobile outreach program, which aims to bring the benefits of the old Rock Guitar Shelter to the people of Calgary.

What We've Done

To date, we've:

  • Received donations of over 650 guitars

  • Delivered over 1100 guitars to deserving children and youth

  • Provided countless lessons to deserving children and youth

  • Supported community charities and fundraisers

We Need YOU

Moving forward, the RGS is looking to lease a building for one year. We envision the new space housing a luthering station, recording facility, stage with lighting, and sound system. In addition to this space, the mobile events trailer will continue to act as community outreach. Here's how the funds will be used:

  • $30,000 – building rent for one year (including utilities)

  • $30,000 – retrofit building space for lessons and sound studios

  • $12,000 – salary for part time administration staff and stipends for volunteers

  • $3,000 – office expenses

  • $2,000 – miscellaneous expenses

  • $8,000 – IndieGoGo campaign

Each youth who comes to the RGS receives, on average, benefits in excess of $1000 comprised of donated instruments ($200-$2000), occasional amps, and guitar lessons (about $100/month). By supporting our campaign, we can continue to ensure that hundreds of youths continue to receive these benefits.

No Funds? No Problem!

There are many ways you can get involved and make a difference aside from donating to this campaign:

  • Become a role model

  • Serve on the RGS board

  • Promote us in mainstream media

  • Connect us with artists and musicians

  • Support us through social media

  • Donate an instrument

  • Volunteer your time and expertise

  • Visit us

  • Get the word out about our campaign!

Testimonial

Maureen Armstrong, a member of a prominent Toronto law firm, made a generous PayPal donation and wrote to say: “Thank you so much for starting such a wonderful organization. You are doing amazing things in Calgary, and I have no doubt that someday, we will have you to thank for one of the world's great guitarists. My fiancee and I have just made a donation through PayPal, and I wanted to let you know that our donation is in memory of Robert Druzeta, a friend who passed away last week after a lengthy battle with brain cancer. He was the lead guitarist in our band, and an incredible musician (not to mention a first-class human being). He loved music, particularly rock and metal, and he would have really appreciated what you are bringing to the lives of Calgary kids.”

story:
March 12, 1930 Mahatma Gandhi walked 241-miles across India in the spirit of truth and non-violence to bring freedom to his people.

March 12th, 2013, PeaceWalkers Jesse-Blue Forrest and Sandra Moon Dancer, in cooperation with the Gandhi King Foundation began retracing Gandhi’s steps.

They will walk a total of 25 days raising awareness for the powerful relevance of Gandhi’s message of truth and non-violence today. Along the way, they will be meeting with women’s rights organizations, other peace activists and political figures as they raise awareness for the People's Campaign to Abolish the Draft and give space for women's voices.

 

As covered by The Times of India 'Global footfalls for Dandi anniversary'

 

Meet the PeaceWalkers

Jesse-Blue Forrest is the founding Director of the People’s Campaign to Abolish the Draft. He walks for the freedom to choose peace. His campaign has now taken him to India.

“This is a spiritual calling that was 17 years in the making. It took me many years to accept this call from the Spirit and to prepare my body and mind for this task. I am walking to inspire others to mobilize and to bring the calling to others.”

www.AbolishTheDraft.org

 

 

 

Sandra Moon Dancer is the founder and Executive Director of the Centre of Circle Wisdom in Toronto, Canada. She is an internationally renowned medicine woman, shaman, ceremonialist, energy teacher and inspirational speaker. 

"I am here to learn how to walk, in particular to walk for peace, peace for the people of this planet."

www.circlewisdom.ca

 

 

Why is this Walk for Peace important?

In 1930 Gandhi walked the Salt March that shook the foundation of the British Empire through peaceful action and non-violence. It was a pivotal moment in the path to independence for India.

 

 

Now 83 years later, our great challenge and transformation is global. Jesse-Blue Forrest and Sandra Moon Dancer honour and continue Gandhi’s legacy at this powerful historic and spiritual moment by walking in non-violence for the freedom to choose peace.  

 

                                                   Photo by Che Kothari | chekothari.com   

 

What does the campaign involve? 

  • Peace building with Gandhian leaders and political figures
  • Meeting with women's rights organizations, raising awareness for women's voices in India and around the world
  • Raising awareness about the People's Campaign to Abolish the Draft
  • Connecting with thousands in the spirit of the international peace movement
  • Learning about Gandhi's way and learning from others
  • Ceremony and prayer
  • Speaking to the media
  • A documentary film to be shared and to create dialogue
  • Inspiring others to choose peace and non-violent action

 

 

How your donation will contribute

Join in this historic moment and be a catalyst for change. The PeaceWalkers need your support for this global vision. 

Your donations will fund:

  • Van for 25 days to travel with them and carry supplies.
  • Translators to help them communicate their message as they travel across India.
  • Food and shelter for the PeaceWalkers along the way
  • Documentary film crew. Help us capture and share this historic peace event with YOU and the world!
  • Administrative costs for the support of the PeaceWalkers while they are in India. This journey requires full-time support for coordination and a full-time administrator at the Centre of Circlewisdom.
  • Partial Travel expenses for the PeaceWalkers

 

Other Ways You Can Help

• Share the campaign video: Walking for the Freedom to Choose Peace

• Like and share ‘PeaceWalkers’ on facebook: www.facebook.com/peacewalkforthepeople

• Like and share Jesse-Blue Forrest’s facebook page: www.facebook.com/AbolishTheDraft

• Like and share Sandra Moon Dancer's facebook page:  www.facebook.com/SandraMoonDancer

• Talk about this important work in your communities 

                                "Be the change you wish to see in the world." - Gandhi
story_txt:
March 12, 1930 Mahatma Gandhi walked 241-miles across India in the spirit of truth and non-violence to bring freedom to his people. 
March 12th, 2013, PeaceWalkers Jesse-Blue Forrest and Sandra Moon Dancer, in cooperation with the Gandhi King Foundation began retracing Gandhi’s steps. 
They will walk a total of 25 days raising awareness for the powerful relevance of Gandhi’s message of truth and non-violence today. Along the way, they will be meeting with women’s rights organizations, other peace activists and political figures as they raise awareness for the People's Campaign to Abolish the Draft and give space for women's voices.
 
As covered by The Times of India 'Global footfalls for Dandi anniversary'
 
Meet the PeaceWalkers

Jesse-Blue Forrest is the founding Director of the People’s Campaign to Abolish the Draft. He walks for the freedom to choose peace. His campaign has now taken him to India.
“This is a spiritual calling that was 17 years in the making. It took me many years to accept this call from the Spirit and to prepare my body and mind for this task. I am walking to inspire others to mobilize and to bring the calling to others.”
www.AbolishTheDraft.org
 
 
 

Sandra Moon Dancer is the founder and Executive Director of the Centre of Circle Wisdom in Toronto, Canada. She is an internationally renowned medicine woman, shaman, ceremonialist, energy teacher and inspirational speaker. 
"I am here to learn how to walk, in particular to walk for peace, peace for the people of this planet."
www.circlewisdom.ca
 
 
Why is this Walk for Peace important?
In 1930 Gandhi walked the Salt March that shook the foundation of the British Empire through peaceful action and non-violence. It was a pivotal moment in the path to independence for India.
 

 
Now 83 years later, our great challenge and transformation is global. Jesse-Blue Forrest and Sandra Moon Dancer honour and continue Gandhi’s legacy at this powerful historic and spiritual moment by walking in non-violence for the freedom to choose peace.  
 

                                                   Photo by Che Kothari | chekothari.com   
 
What does the campaign involve? 

Peace building with Gandhian leaders and political figures
Meeting with women's rights organizations, raising awareness for women's voices in India and around the world
Raising awareness about the People's Campaign to Abolish the Draft
Connecting with thousands in the spirit of the international peace movement
Learning about Gandhi's way and learning from others
Ceremony and prayer
Speaking to the media
A documentary film to be shared and to create dialogue
Inspiring others to choose peace and non-violent action
 

 
How your donation will contribute
Join in this historic moment and be a catalyst for change. The PeaceWalkers need your support for this global vision. 
Your donations will fund:


Van for 25 days to travel with them and carry supplies.

Translators to help them communicate their message as they travel across India.

Food and shelter for the PeaceWalkers along the way

Documentary film crew. Help us capture and share this historic peace event with YOU and the world!

Administrative costs for the support of the PeaceWalkers while they are in India. This journey requires full-time support for coordination and a full-time administrator at the Centre of Circlewisdom.

Partial Travel expenses for the PeaceWalkers
 
Other Ways You Can Help
• Share the campaign video: Walking for the Freedom to Choose Peace
• Like and share ‘PeaceWalkers’ on facebook: www.facebook.com/peacewalkforthepeople
• Like and share Jesse-Blue Forrest’s facebook page: www.facebook.com/AbolishTheDraft
• Like and share Sandra Moon Dancer's facebook page:  www.facebook.com/SandraMoonDancer
• Talk about this important work in your communities 
                                "Be the change you wish to see in the world." - Gandhi

story:
Hi!

My name is Adriana and I am a concert pianist. I love playing the piano, I started by the age of 5, in my transilvanian village. (yes, I am a Transilvanian girl :) ) 

Meanwhile, there are 27 competitions that I won, a university that I graduated (the famous University of Music and performing Arts in Vienna) and a PhD that I am writing (about the beauty of music).

Due to the fact that I have the honor to take a master class in Luxembourg (July 14-25, 2013), I offer you the oportunity to join my class. 

There, I can perfect my playing of French music: Maurice Ravel (the one who wrote the Bolero, but also wonderful piano pieces) and Francis Poulenc (the one who died exactly 50 years ago - in 1963 - and wrote an Hommage to the great French singer Edith Piaf). 

The teacher Gabriel Tacchino was the last student of Francis Poulenc. This is my one chance to get all the little details from the first hand.

That is why I am kindly asking YOU for help. You can help me get this knowledge, which would help me play better, more beautifully. You would share this beauty because I am going to send you exclusive audio files from my next concert in Vienna (in October this year). Or maybe you come to the concert?

What I need

This is the list of how the money are to be needed:

320 € - airplane ticket, transport to and from the airports in Austria and Luxembourg

350 € - the participation fee at the master class

450 € - the price of the hotel (one place in a double room incl. breakfast, special price for the course participants, for 11 nights)

600 € - the price of eating in Luxembourg (one plate lunch and one plate evening; everything is pretty expensive there and I have no kitchen to cook for myself...)

150 € - indiegogo fees for this campaign

Total: 1.770 €


For this money I get the one life oportunity to prepare my French repertoire with the last student of one of the most important French composer. In Vienna, I studied the Viennese classics; I also already have a big French repertoire (played the Ravel concerto with orchester etc). The participation at this master course would qualify me as an expert. The public - and you - will hear the special French flair and this absolutely beautiful music will have that special something, that you cannot describe. 

This would bring a little more beauty to this world, because love combined with mastery cures heart and soul.

Every penny is important to me, every note of my playing will benefit from it.

 

The effect

This is not my first master class, but no one treated the French music before.

As you can see on my website and in my bio, I play music with and for the people of this world. There were charity concerts for orphan children or for sick mothers, there were concerts for old people who couldn't go anymore to a concert hall, so we went to them and brought them music.

There is no way of expressing the feeling that you have, when you see the tears of an old, paralised man who cannot speak anymore and listens to your music. There is no way but music. 

And you don't have to be other than healthy and happy to taste the sounds, to let go and fly with it. Music is beautiful. The theme of the 2.part of the Concerto in Sol of Maurice Ravel is one of the most beautiful pieces of music in the world. 

Let you be a part of it, together with me; let's make music together and make this world more beautiful through it. 

I have a Romanian blog, but on this occasion I am opening a special Luxembourg master class blog where I'm posting every day what I did and what I learned.

You will get exclusive audio files from the final concert in Luxembourg and also from my next concert in Vienna (October 2013), for your private music collection.

You can follow me online - you can also come live and meet me there and hear the music - that you helped rising.

If you don't have 100 or 10 or 1 € for me, than please...

... tell others about my piano course, maybe they have the money and need to invest them in something beautiful like music.

... check my website www.adrianapaler.com and stay in touch with my blog, future concerts and events.

THANK YOU!

Adriana Paler Nicolescu

story:
Hello

My name is Stephan Mathieu, I live as an independend full-time musician since 1989. I'm based in Saarbrücken, Germany and perform my music live worldwide. So far over 30 albums of my music were released internationally by some of the finest labels operating in the fields of electroacoustics, contemporary electronics and abstract digitalia.

 

What I do

The soundtrack for the video above is a remix I made in 2000 for the band Yo La Tengo, a little later Wired Magazine named me “one of the most important laptop musicians of our time.”

While I always wondered what a laptop musician might be (Are there ‘guitar musicians’? ‘Piano musicians’?), the computer remained a crucial tool for my work until today, when most of my music is created with acoustic instruments and obsolete media, such as mechanical-acoustic gramophones. 

I'm using a laptop as a recording studio and musical instrument, as a research tool and as a home office to run my small business. I survive by living a modest life dedicated to my music. Most of my instruments are cheap, second hand finds, my studio consists of the laptop, an audio interface and a pair of (vintage, rather amazing) monitors. Nothing special really, I like to work on a low scale and to create with the tools I can afford.

You will find more info about what I'm doing at

Bitsteam \\ Schwebung \\ Twitter \\ Wikipedia

 

What happened?

Although I had a great year 2012 with an output of several well received releases, surviving based on what I'm doing became yet a little more difficult. Some days ago, during rehearsals for a show in Lisbon, what I consider one of my professional worst-case scenarios has happened when my laptop was damaged beyond repair.

 

What now?

Since I can't afford buying a new computer for the time being, I'm asking for your support with this campaign.

I want to buy an Apple Macbook Pro 13" ‘medium’ entry level model for €1549. Possible fees going to Indiegogo are included in the goal of €1665.

 

What's the deal?

I'm offering you an exclusive digital album of new material named The Falling Rocket in return, as well as a range of digital bundles.

 

THE FALLING ROCKET

was recorded with a Farfisa VIP 233 organ and shortwave radio between Summer 2011 and now and will be completed and mastered in the next couple of days.

The album has a duration of 80 minutes and will be exclusively available as 24Bit FLAC download, unless you wish to receive it in any other digital format. The download includes a PDF booklet created by Caro Mikalef for Studio Cabina, Buenos Aires.

People who have liked my Radioland or A Static Place albums will most likely also enjoy this new work. I will forward you a download code for The Falling Rocket  the day after this campaign ends, on March 01, 2013.

  

What else?

Apart from The Falling Rocket album, there are a couple of other options, all of them based on digital purchases of my music at a reduced price than offered in my shop which is located at www.schwebung.limitedrun.com

The 50€ option includes ten full resolution digital albums, while four of them – Radioland, The Sad Mac, Full Swing Edits and FrequencyLib – are made available for the first time as 24Bit files and stay exclusive for this bundle option for the time being. It also includes a signed and numbered 15*20 cm professional photo print of Caro Mikalef's artwork for The Falling Rocket.

If you want to support my work by choosing one of the bundled options, I can send you a download link for the Digital Editions you are choosing from my shop within 24 hours.

  

In case

you can't support this campaign financially you might want to share www.indiegogo.com/the-falling-rocket with your social networks.

 

Thanks a lot for reading this far, your help is greatly appreaciated!

Stephan
