story:
Short Summary

"The Portion is a local Santa Barbara (Carpinteria) band. Justin Sinclair and Aaron Feeney became close friends primarily through a musical setting (church worship team), as well as at school and other events. Although they enjoyed much of life together, music was what seemed to hugely fuel their friendship. Being surrounded by Christian and pop-music culture, conversations about creative and unconventional chord progressions, classical compositions, and unique time signatures were inexplicably refreshing. Depth of lyric, as opposed to the shallow reptition of today's music, was a frequent topic as well. These conversations began to lay the foundation of what would become "The Portion". Later on a third member, Katherine Nixon, whose voice soothes the angels, was added onto several songs, completing the band.

"Crowds grew and grew after each show they played, leaving a trail of people pleading for recorded material. There was, unfortunately, none to give, other than a reference to an iPhone Facebook video. As they continued on to write and perform together they eventually received several different offers from various studios asking to record. One such offer came from Playback Studios in Santa Barbara, CA. Upon entering the studio they knew Playback was the way to go.

So now, The Portion is devoting much of their energy in preparation to record."

What We Need

"In order to take advantage of this opportunity we need to raise roughly $4,000- that includes recording, mixing, and mastering the EP.

Make up of fincances:
- $100/hour to record; To make a 4-6 song EP it will take roughly two or three days in the studio to record ($2,400).
- Another day's work to mix ($800)
- Another day's work to master ($800)

We are willing to go to extensive lengths to get this together. On this page you will see a list of things that you will be the future beneficiaries of. Please take the time to scroll through them generously, and we will be generous in return!

We understand that some of these perks are steep, and some outrageous. Please remember that these are favors in return for donations, not reasonable prices for services. 

If we do not reach our goal, but get near to it it only affects the amount of time we can spend on the EP to make it all that it could be. The more time we get, the more songs we can put on it, and the better we can make them."

The Impact

"Our honest hope in producing this EP is to glorify God through the best music we ourselves could possibly make. We want to give people to music they can enjoy on a level that's deeper than money, booty, or the same four-chord progression from song to song.

"However, we are offering more than just a melody. Though we have been inspired by musicians all around the world, our music has a foundation in a message of hope. The human experience is often characterized by pain, disappointment, and brokeness. But we have come in contact with a God who has lived through the human experience and has come out victorious defeating sin, the devil, and even death itself. Because of that we can now experience true joy, hope, and love. We have not forced this message into our songs, but rather, it is there because it has affected every area of our lives. It is presented in true honesty, with no other agenda but to be genuine in who we are as people as musicians. Each song gives hope to the human experience because they each have come from the human experience.


But really, we just hope you don't think it sucks."

Other Ways You Can Help

"We are sincerely thankful for any help that you can give. If you cannot donate monetarily please donate some space on your Facebook timeline or Twitter to share this page and help us get the word out! Shoot! You can even make a YouTube video for us! 


Thank you!"

story:
R E D  B E A R D   |  INDIGOGO CAMPAIGN

 

Hey guys, we have put together a pledging campaign to help us get around Australia and New Zealand for our next tour with The Red Jumpsuit Apparatus.

Lots of cool stuff up for grabs!

Why are we asking for you to help? Because being an independent band has a lot of money going out, but not a lot coming in. We fund our own recordings, van hires, accommodation, fuel, time off our usual jobs (as a band at this level, we don't get paid much; if anything sometimes), we pay publicists, pay for our own marketing... the list really goes on and ADDS THE F*CK UP.

However, we don't stop funding it ourselves, but it has come to a point where some help would be rad. We are not asking for charity, we of course want to give back and see you get hooked up with some cool stuff, please check it all out and see if you are keen to jump on some stuff.

story:
Hi,

I'm Yonatan (Jonathan ). I'm 12 years old.
When I was 7 I started playing the clarinet.
When I was 9 I started saxophone, it was a dream come true.
Three years I'm practicing and playing with a borrowed chinese Sax.
I realy love playing.
This year I went to the Music Academy tryouts.
The tension was high, but I passed the exams.
One of the best teachers asked to teach me, it makes me proud, excited and afraid.
The teacher requires that I have my own saxophone and a pricey one as well.
I can not afford such a saxophone and any help will be great and helpfull.

I ask for your support in purchasing a saxophone.
Any amount will help.

You will help me fulfil my dream.
I really want to play at the Music Academy.

It would also help if you get the word out and share this with others.

In the movie you can see and here me play at my elementary school graduation 2 weeks ago.

Thank you,
Yonatan

היי,

אני מבקש את תמיכתכם ברכישת סקסופון.

כל סכום יעזור.

קוראים לי יונתן. ואני בן 12.

בגיל בן 7 התחלתי לנגן בקלרינט.

בגיל 9 התחלתי לנגן סקסופון, זה היה חלום שהתגשם.

שלוש שנים אני מתאמן ומנגן עם סקסופון שאול תוצרת סין.

אני ממש אוהב לנגן.

בשנה זו הלכתי להיבחן באקדמיה למוזיקה.

המתח היה גבוה, אבל עברתי את הבחינות.

אחד מהמורים הטובים בארץ ביקש ללמד אותי, זה גורם לי להיות גאה, נרגש וחושש.

המורה דורש שיהיה לי הסקסופון משלי וגם דורש אחד שעולה המון כסף .

אני לא יכול להרשות לעצמי כזה לי הסקסופון וכל עזרה תהיה נהדרת ומועילה.

העזרה שלך תעזור לי להגשים את חלום .

אני באמת רוצה לנגן באקדמיה למוזיקה.

זה גם יעזור אם לחלוק את זה עם אחרים.

בסרט ניתן לראות אותי מנגן כאן בטקס סיום בית הספר היסודי שלי לפני שבועיים.

תודה לך,

יונתן
story_txt:
Hi,
I'm Yonatan (Jonathan ). I'm 12 years old. When I was 7 I started playing the clarinet.  When I was 9 I started saxophone, it was a dream come true. Three years I'm practicing and playing with a borrowed chinese Sax. I realy love playing. This year I went to the Music Academy tryouts.  The tension was high, but I passed the exams. One of the best teachers asked to teach me, it makes me proud, excited and afraid. The teacher requires that I have my own saxophone and a pricey one as well. I can not afford such a saxophone and any help will be great and helpfull. I ask for your support in purchasing a saxophone. Any amount will help. You will help me fulfil my dream. I really want to play at the Music Academy.
It would also help if you get the word out and share this with others. In the movie you can see and here me play at my elementary school graduation 2 weeks ago.Thank you,Yonatan
היי,
אני מבקש את תמיכתכם ברכישת סקסופון.
כל סכום יעזור.
קוראים לי יונתן. ואני בן 12.
בגיל בן 7 התחלתי לנגן בקלרינט.
בגיל 9 התחלתי לנגן סקסופון, זה היה חלום שהתגשם.
שלוש שנים אני מתאמן ומנגן עם סקסופון שאול תוצרת סין.
אני ממש אוהב לנגן.
בשנה זו הלכתי להיבחן באקדמיה למוזיקה.
המתח היה גבוה, אבל עברתי את הבחינות.
אחד מהמורים הטובים בארץ ביקש ללמד אותי, זה גורם לי להיות גאה, נרגש וחושש.
המורה דורש שיהיה לי הסקסופון משלי וגם דורש אחד שעולה המון כסף .
אני לא יכול להרשות לעצמי כזה לי הסקסופון וכל עזרה תהיה נהדרת ומועילה.
העזרה שלך תעזור לי להגשים את חלום .
אני באמת רוצה לנגן באקדמיה למוזיקה.
זה גם יעזור אם לחלוק את זה עם אחרים.
בסרט ניתן לראות אותי מנגן כאן בטקס סיום בית הספר היסודי שלי לפני שבועיים.
תודה לך,
יונתן

story:
Summary

Hi! My name is Tony Ortega and I'm a songwriter of over ten years based out of Southern California.

I've played in and/or written for bands including The Legacy of Luna, Two-Bit Charlie, the Littlest Man Band, The Righteous Harmonious Fists (of California), Orem the sink, and What We Doobie.

It's 2013 and as part of my commitment to being a career songwriter, I want to join the NSAI. They're the world's largest not-for-profit organization that supports and develops aspiring songwriters, globally. NSAI stands for Nashville Songwriter's Association International, they are a 501 not-for-profit based in Nashville, TN. 

Membership will provide some great opportunities to grow my craft of songwriting, including two one-on-one mentoring sessions a year, twelve professional song evaluations a year, invites to event workshops, and membership in the local NSAI 'Los Angeles' chapter. 

This will also be pretty much the best place for me to establish myself in the music industry, and it's another step toward my dream of hearing my songs on the radio!

What We Need & What You Get 

The $500 I'm looking to raise is going to pay for 2 years membership in the NSAI and the shipping and supply costs for all the reward perks. 

We've got a bunch of cool perks at the different levels of funding including a bunch of self-released material I've put out over the years, exclusive access to a new e.p., a limited edition t-shirt collaboration with Andress Yourself, a zine collaboration with Wesley Francis, and even the chance to have me write you a song!

The Impact 

So this is an awesome opportunity because it's going to open up a lot of doors for me, maybe you'll hear one of my songs on ABC's "Nashville" television show, or coming out of your car's FM radio, and if I owe you money, well maybe I'll finally be able to pay you back. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Continue to support me, send me an email, come out to shows when they happen. Don't forget to share this campaign by word-of-mouth and through social-media, send up awesome prayers to God, be happy, and God bless!

story:
From the Mourning of the World is the first album from the growing global network of tricksters and rebels who work under the banner of the Dark Mountain Project.

After four years of activity in which we have published books, curated festivals and other events, and seen a global network grow and flourish, we have decided to take a leap into recording our first album. Why? Because a wonderful collective of uncivilised musicians has gathered around the Dark Mountain banner over the last few years, and we want to bring together some of the best of their work, so that it can carry beyond the firesides and candlelit stages on which it was often first heard, and inspire others beyond.

Curated by Dark Mountain stalwart Marmaduke Dando and wrapped in the beautiful artwork of Rima Staines, with design from Andy Garside, our debut LP is a celebration of wild, beautifully uncivilised music from some of the best and brightest musicians of our time. We're very excited about it.

Here's the full list of musicians who have donated tracks for the album:

Jon Boden
Chris Wood
Chris T-T
Rebecca Jade
Bleak
The General Assembly
DRKMTR
The Boycott Coca-Cola Experience
Julian Gaskell and his Ragged Trousered Philanthropists
Bethia Beadman
The Murder Barn
Look Stranger

To read more about these artists and their work, and the journey of the album itself, have a look at the curator's blog.

We want to produce an album which is not only a joy to listen to, but a joy to look at, touch and hold. The Dark Mountain Project believes in creating beautiful objects that last and are touched with love. For this reason, we've chosen the highest quality vinyl for our first record, and we will enclose it in a traditional, double-gatefold sleeve. The album's artwork will be an exclusive commission from the remarkable Rima Staines.

You won't see another album like this anywhere else this year. And we're only pressing 500 copies! So you're guaranteed a unique piece of art.

We're a small, not-for-profit organisation, and we don't have the funds to produce an album from scratch. We also believe in producing our work with our network of supporters and contributors. So, as we have successfully done with our three books so far, we're seeking to raise the funds for this album by pre-selling copies, and offering various incentives.

We need £5000 to produce this album. Here's how the costs break down:

Mastering: £600
Processing of metalwork: £150
Test press + delivery: £55
500x 180gms vinyl: £450
Co-ordination fee: £500
Design: £200
Cover artwork: £400
Gatefold sleeve: £1000
Video production: £50
Postage/packaging/admin/crowdfunding fees: £1535

Total cost of production: £5000

If we raise more than the required amount, any surplus will be used to support other Dark Mountain projects such as our books, festival and smaller events.

We hope you can help us to make this happen. Thank you!

***

The Dark Mountain Project began with a Manifesto in 2009. We are a global network of writers, artists and thinkers who aim to challenge the stories our civilisation tells about itself, and produce honest art and novel thinking for a culture in trouble and a world heading for the buffers.

In our four years of life, we have created a wonderfully sprawling not-for-profit organisation that has birthed three beautiful hardback anthologies of uncivilised writing and art; three Uncivlisation festivals, with a fourth on the way; and dozens of local groups and events which continue to burgeon across the world.

story:
15 Years of Emery

It's hard to believe how much we still love making music. Despite the years going by, it's never gotten old. Ever since we left our label 4 years ago, partnering with you all to release "You Were Never Alone" in 2015, we've felt the momentum building towards a rebirth of Emery.

Devin, Dave, Toby, Matt, and Josh - the team behind "The Question" - are all back and fully invested in what feels like a new chapter of our band, and we couldn't have gotten here without your help.

We want to make our best album yet. We want to assemble an incredible production team. We want to spend a ton of time writing and arranging, like we used to. We're shooting for the stars, and you are the jet fuel we need to get there!

Here's a sample of "So Cold I Can See My Breath" from Emery: Classics Reimagined EP, a 3-song EP that will be delivered to every contributor within 24 hours of ordering from this campaign. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We've estimated our basic costs again at $50,000, the same goal we had for YWNA. Of course, you guys crushed this goal last time. We pressed tons of expensive vinyl, paid for recording, mixing, mastering, travel, art, manufacturing, packing and shipping of all the products. After doing it once, we're better at it, and we think we can get an even a better record out faster with your help.

So feel free to pre-order the record & exclusive merch in advance! In exchange, you'll get an exclusive immediate download of Emery: Classics Reimagined EP (see video above), which includes FULLY re-arranged and re-imagined versions of So Cold I Could See My Breath, The Smile, The Face and As Your Voice Fades. This EP will not be available anywhere else, so we're excited to give it exclusively to our backers.

On top of this basic perk, we have incredible packages that will never be on sale anywhere else, exclusive vinyl limited to this campaign, and some fun limited experiences.

 

Stretch Goals

The impact of your early contribution is huge, as it all goes directly towards the production of new music, impacting the quality and success of this album. The ability for us to write together in a room, rent incredible recording spaces, and hire an incredible production team is all contingent on the amount of backers we have. The more of you that order the rewards, the more resources we have to put back into this record to make it our best. In order to incentivize contribution, we've attributed the number of backers to what we think will impact the quality of the record:

1,000 BACKERS (UNLOCKED): The Best Production Team

1,250 BACKERS (UNLOCKED): The Best Recording Studio & Time Allotted

1,500 BACKERS (UNLOCKED): The Best Publicist

2,000 BACKERS (UNLOCKED): The Best Radio Team 

2,500 BACKERS (UNLOCKED): Emery: Classics Reimagined EP  turns into a full-length LP of more of the "classics" released to all backers!

3,000 BACKERS (LOCKED): $7 Ticket "Early Bird" Discount to any of the regional US tours we will be planning in support of the record. We'll email you a discount code before each tour so you get first dibs AND a massive discount!

 

Risks & Challenges

We have a relatively successful track record with delivering our albums this way. We've only done one crowd-fund so far for You Were Never Alone, and we learned a ton about how to make it more efficient and get deadlines in. Also, the label we own has facilitated a dozen of these things, and the team behind our fulfillment has become exceptional. 

Because there can be errors in test pressings that need to be fixed, vinyl production can sometimes experience significant delays. We will do our best to get everyone their digital music TWO WEEKS BEFORE it's officially released - but sometimes vinyl packages can ship a little later than expected.

We plan on getting art and masters in early, well before we need them, in order to overcome some of these potential production delays.

Tours will be booked based on member schedule, and those can vary, but we do plan on hitting ALL regions of the US in support of this album. We want to be able to make sure we get to play for as many of you as possible.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a spot to contribute to the production of this record, you can still help! The best way is by sharing this campaign via email and social media using the IndieGoGo Share Tools by the "BACK IT" button the top of the page!

 

The Collector Pack Wood Box

Here is a prototype of what the vinyl wood box will look like. This was handmade from walnut with wax (natural) coating. We are currently looking into burning the Emery logo into the side of the box with a branding iron, but we can't make any promises yet. Every box will be handmade, and thus unique, but each will fit into an Ikea Expedit (that square hole shelf everyone has for vinyl).

 

FAQ

Q. How do I get the downloadable songs/albums?

A. With the purchase of any of these packages, you will receive an email within 24 hours with a download link. To ensure you receive the emails, mark that you are ok with receiving campaign updates when checking out!

Q. I haven’t gotten an email with downloadable songs yet, what’s going on?

A. It may take up to 36 hours to reach you. If it’s been more than 2 days, please email emery@badchristian.com with your concerns, and we will make sure you get the downloads.

Q. Will my card be charged today or at the end of the campaign?

A. You will be charged upon purchase.

Q. What do I do if I want multiple packages?

A. Unfortunately, at this time you will have to make separate purchases.

Q. How do I tell you what lyrics I want hand-written?

A.  You will be contacted considering details of this package via email.

story:
Short Summary

True Brass Choir(TBC) is non-profit music ensemble made up of some of the finest brass and percussion musicians in the Greater Long Beach area. Founded in 2012, the ensemble has a mission of high music performance and education outreach. We've been able to fulfill our mission through full concert seasons, public school appearances, and our annual Master Class Seminar for middle/high school students. 

We've achieved a great deal in our short history and we're looking for your help in getting us to our next greatest achievement. The California All-State Music Education Conference(CASMEC) is the largest music education conference in the state. In May of 2015, True Brass Choir was one of over 40 applicants to apply for a showcase performance at the 2016 CASMEC. We're proud to announce that we were one of six ensembles that were invited to perform at the 2016 CASMEC in San Jose, CA!

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need: 

$6000!

$6000 will cover the cost of travel, housing, meal stipends, performance programs, sheet music, and percussion rental for 25 of our musicians and staff. 

What You Get:

Depending on the level of donation, you will receive a plethora of perks from True Brass Choir Wayfarer Sunglasses and Polo Shirts to name recognition in our CASMEC Program and our website. ALL donations to True Brass Choir, a 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization, are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE! (see Perks) 

The Impact

The impact your donation will have on our organization, no matter the dollar amount, will be immense. Your show of support means a great deal to our cause, whether it's $1 or $1000. 

True Brass Choir's education outreach program is a main part of our organization's mission. Through our annual Master Class Seminar we've been able to reach over 100 students in Southern California. A performance at the All-State Conference allows us to share our education outreach goals to larger audience and the visibility will allow us to reach more students throughout the state!

All of the musicians in TBC are recent college graduates who are at the very beginnings of their music careers. Attendance at this conference allows them access to professional development, networking, and social gatherings that are paramount to their futures. Making it as a musician is tough. We all need some help in the beginning.

In conclusion: The Impact = HUGE!

Risks & Challenges

Preparing for a performance of this level is no easy task. We're essentially going to be playing for the most critical audience imaginable, made up of music students, music educators, and colleagues. With the level of musicianship, artistry, and dedication of each member of our ensemble we promise to not let you down. We know the risks & challenges and we're ready to meet them head on. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If a monetary contribution is out of reach, you can help in us in many other ways. Share our indiegogo campaign all over social media to friends and family. We know that our immediate friends and family will help contribute, but what about your friends and family? I'm sure they would be interested in donating to a great cause. If they'd like to get to know us more, please have them visit our website at truebrasschoir.org. Contact us! Ask questions! We're more than willing to share!

story:
Thanks to your generosity, the author of the best work will be awarded in the amount of $ 256.50. We are still – till the 1st of August – looking forward for Your works dedicated to Future of Copyright!

Help us spread the message! Link, brag and promote this webpage, so we all get more contestants taking part in shaping the Future of Copyright.

-------------

We welcome you to the second edition of crowdfounded contest Future of Copyright 2.0

What should the future of copyright law look like? Write, sing, animate or talk about it, and win the prize funded by crowds!

Contest

The contest is set for the best work about the future of copyright. The idea is simple:

  1. People set the prize by supporting this project - it is a half of crowd founded amount, 256,50$ (the other half will be used to cover costs).

  2. People submit their works for the contest. The deadline is 1st August 2013.

  3. Independent jury consisting of Beatriz Busaniche (member of Via Libre Foundation and professor at the University of Buenos Aires), Shun-Ling Chen (copyright scholar, visiting assistant professor at University of Arizona James E. Rogers College of Law), Mike Linksvayer (part-time Senior Fellow at Creative Commons),  Joe McNamee (Executive Director od EDRi) and  Jérémie Zimmermann (spokesperson and co-founder of the La Quadrature du Net) and Jarosław Lipszyc (Modern Poland Foundation, contest organizer) chooses the winner. The decision will be announced on 24th August 2013.
  4. The winner gets the prize. Society gets a number of fresh proposals that will help shaping up the copyright system of tomorrow.

If you want to take part in the contest, publish the work on the Internet and mail us at contest@nowoczesnapolska.org.pl. Your work has to be:

On topic. The work may be of any kind (text, video, audio) and of any genre (i.e. legal analisys, dystopian or utopian story, educational video – sky is the limit here), but it must address the general subject of the Future of Copyright. Your work has to be in English or you need to provide an English translation. The question is: what should a good copyright system look like? Is it possible to live without sharing? Will artists dissapear if we make copyright less strict? Can we make culture without artists?

Limited size. The size of the work is limited to 15,000 characters for text or 10 minutes for audio and video.

New and original. We accept only original works prepared specially for this contest. You must have all the rights to the work. Team work is acceptable. If your work is a remix, you need to provide the source for the works you re-used.

Free licensed. The work must be published under the CC BY-SA 3.0 license. Your work must visibly licensed as such in the place of first publication.

Properly tagged. The work must be tagged with the text: “This work takes part in the Future of Copyright Contest” and a link to pagehttp://www.indiegogo.com/projects/future-of-copyright-contest-2-0.


Prize

256,50$, half of the raised money goes to the winner (or winners, if the prize is split). The other half will be spent on perks and sending copies of the best works to people and institutions engaged in the copyright debate. If any money is left (which seems unlikely), we will spend it on our projects, providing the world with better access to knowledge and culture, fully in line with our mission.

Last year we received inspiring voices from people all over the world. You can find them in the PDF format or in EPUB and MOBI. Let us also remind you all that the winner of first edition was Aymeric Mansoux and his work Morphology of copyright tale. We collected over 1000 USD (twice as much as what we asked for). We dare to hope that this year will be at least as big a success as last time.

If you have any questions or doubts about the rules, just mail us at contest@nowoczesnapolska.org.pl.

 

Jury

The winner of the contest will be chosen by an independent jury:

Beatriz Busaniche - is member of Via Libre Foundation and founding member of Wikimedia Argentina. She is also Doctorate Candidate at FLACSO Argentina (Facultad Latinoamericana de Ciencias Sociales), and Professor at the University of Buenos Aires, Shun-Ling Chen - is copyright scholar, visiting assistant professor at University of Arizona James E. Rogers College of Law, she worked with several NGO's dedicated to the free software and free culture, Mike Linksvayer is part-time Senior Fellow at Creative Commons. Linksvayer also serves on the boards of OpenHatch and Software Freedom Conservancy and chairs the Open Definition Advisory Council. Joe McNamee is Executive Director od EDRi, Jérémie Zimmermann is spokesperson and co-founder of the Paris-based La Quadrature du Net and Jaroslaw Lipszyc is president of Modern Poland Foundation, contest organizer.

 

The picture used above is a remix based on  Leonardo da Vinci's „Lady with an Ermine” and Johannes Vermeer's „Girl with a Pearl Earring” (remix by Radek Czajka, license: CC-BY-SA). The Modern Poland Foundation was involved in the disscusion with the Polish Ministry of Culture and National Heritage about the rights to use the image and the name of  da Vinci's painting. Though „Lady with an Ermine” was painted even before the creation of the idea of copyright and is in the public domain since the moment when it started to function,  one of the Polish foudations  wanted to sell the rights to this painting. The Modern Polanf Foundation publicly defended the right to re-use and remix this work of art.

 

Modern Poland Foundation

Why us? Modern Poland Foundation is one of the leading non-governemental organizations developing future copyright agenda in Poland. You may want to read Jarosław Lipszyc's column on remix culture, or this on digital books, or this on future of text.

Copyright restrictions are also very relevant to our projects, like Free Readings, Free Textbooks or Remix Culture, which deal with public domain, free licensing and fair use.

Poland is in the midst of heated discussion on future development of our copyright. This public debate is supported by our government, political leaders, NGO sector and even royalty collecting societies. Copyright, however, is a global system tied to international treaties (Berne, TRIPS) and organizations (WTO, WIPO). We will be not able to change it at the domestic level.

Modern Poland Foundation is Warsaw-based, registered charity working in the field of Open Educational Resources, access to knowledge and free culture. Funding comes from various sources such as Open Society Institute, Mozilla Foundation and Polish Ministry of Culture.

The Future of Copyright Contest is our way to stir up global discussion on this subject; in the European Union and beyond.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the message! Link, brag and promote this webpage, so we all get more supporters, higher prize and more contestants taking part in shaping the Future of Copyright.

story:
“Jeremy Walker may become the Duke Ellington of the early 21st century.” —Jazz Ink

About Boot

I'm Jeremy Walker - although many people just call me "Boot." When I was 32, after 24 years of playing the saxophone, I lost the instrument due to a yet-to-be-diagnosed neurological/autoimmune condition which limits my mobility and causes chronic pain. I turned to piano and composition, studying with David Berkman (Queens College, Tom Harrell), Frank Kimbrough (Juiliard) and other notables.

In my career, I am fortunate to have worked with musicians from Anthony Cox (Joe Lovano) and Wessell "Warmdaddy" Anderson (Wynton Marsalis) to Ted Nash (Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra) and Ron Miles (Bill Frisell). I have been commissioned by Jackson State University, North Dakota Jazz, and Bethel University, and have written over 70 compositions for my bands: Boot Camp, Small City Trio, Boxcar, and The Bootet. I have scored for film (Photographic Justice: The Corky Lee Story), collaborated with dance (Zenon Dance Company, TU Dance), and author a series of articles on culture for Walker Art Center and mnartists.org.

If for some reason you want to read more about me: boot-music.com

Why 7 PSALMS?

To me, the Psalms read like blues. They're full of humanity, of pain, and of hope. And I knew this would be a challenge. Writing this music has been a huge undertaking. 7 PSALMS is my first composition to include choir. Although I am a jazz musician, this work incorporates blues, country, folk and classical elements in one suite. This is the first time I have worked extensively with text/lyrics. I did not edit the verses. (I felt the music should bend to the text, not the other way around.) Writing the music for 7 PSALMS has been mentally exhausting and physically taxing - but exhilarating. And while 7 PSALMS has many ancestors, from Mozart to Duke Ellington, to John Coltrane and even Johnny Cash, I believe the work is singular.

For this project, I chose Psalms 3, 6, 13, 22, 126, 130 and 131.

Why Fund 7 PSALMS?

  • To support the free(!) kick-off concert April 13, 2013 at Bethel University in Saint Paul, Minnesota. To pay the band who has volunteered weeks of their time because they believe in this project. To provide, at the very least, a craft service (refreshments) table for our volunteer choir during dress rehearsal and performance. To pay for the publicity as we make as wide of an audience as possible aware of this new work. And to pay for some of my hours so I can, well, live.
  • To support future performances of 7 PSALMS. To ensure that this work reaches a lot of ears. My wife, Marsha, and I will take the audio and video from the debut performance, and contact churches, colleges, universities, and community venues to book two incarnations of 7 PSALMS 1) concerts for the ensemble--soloist, piano, saxophone, bass, and drums 2) concerts in which the ensemble will perform with choirs nationwide. (Community music-making!)
  • BONUS: To record 7 PSALMS. If we are wildly successful, and go over our goal by a substantial amount, we will record 7 PSALMS and release the music on CD.

What Do We Need? What Do You Get? 

  • The funds we raise will go directly to the dedicated people behind 7 PSALMS. (See above.)
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds collected will go to the musical ensemble.
  • The perks range from a personal thank you, to an arrangement of a Psalm for your own choir, or even 7 PSALMS being performed at the venue of your choice. (See the perks section.)

What Does Your Giving Mean?

  • 7 PSALMS is a special project, and it takes extra levels of commitment. Your support means 7 PSALMS can reach the broader public.   
  • I was recently told that I was not eligible for a grant because I was "too established" as an artist. I had a mixed reaction - it feels great to be recognized, and respected, but at the end of the day, it takes money to keep the work coming. This launch campaign allows us to get 7 PSALMS out to the people who want to hear it (and perform it).

Want to Help in Other Ways? 

  • Come to the 7 PSALMS concert! Details at boot-music.com
  • Contact me if you're interested in 7 PSALMS coming to your neighborhood
  • Consider telling others about our campaign
  • Use the Indigogo share tools

Acknowledgement:

7 PSALMS would not have come this far without the efforts of my brothers: Jeff Brueske (bass), Jason Harms (vocals), and Tim Zhorne (drums). Brian Link has signed on to direct our choir. And we wouldn't have an image without the painting by Greg Foley and the graphic by Lumika Creative. Thank you all.

story:
Someday This War Is Going To End EP

Kilgore is an American heavy metal band formed in Providence, Rhode Island, in 1991. The band is named after the character Kilgore Trout in the Kurt Vonnegut classic Breakfast of Champions and the Colonel Kilgore character from the movie Apocalypse Now. Kilgore released two albums, Blue Collar Solitude (1995) and A Search for Reason (1998).We landed a slot on the 1998 Ozzfest. They followed with a 1998 national tour with Slayer and Fear Factory and a 1998 European tour with Fear Factory and Spineshank. 

We reunited for a few shows in 2007 and once again last year in 2016. However, this time we decided that the old Kilgore mojo was back and we should continue on as a band and release some new recordings and play some shows to support our release. Since we no longer have a recording contract or support of a major label, we need help from our fans to help us produce our first recording of original music since 1998!!

The Songs

When we first got together, we thought we would record a number of unreleased songs that our guitarist, Brian McKenzie had written for our second album "A Search For Reason". However, Brian came to us with four outstanding new songs that not only pay tribute to our early thrash metal roots... But sound just as Kilgore sounded in the late 90's. 

So two songs from the new EP are songs written in 1996 for the "A Search For Reason" album that we never professionally recorded and four brand new brutal songs written in 2017.

The Funding

We've booked time at Power Station-New England in Waterford, CT. And we need to fund the recording sessions, mixing and mastering. Here's the breakdown:

  • $4000.00 - Recording
  • $4000.00 - Mixing
  • $2000.00 - Mastering
  • $10,000.00 - Goal

The Perks

Here’s where you come in. Every backer be a part of bringing the album to life—you benefit too. From drum heads, attending a recording session to an acoustic performance.... we have a perk for you. We want all of our fans to be a part of bringing this record to life!!

The Release 

Tracking begins the week of Memorial Day and we'll have further overdub sessions to complete vocals. Mixing and mastering of the record will occur in July. Our plan is to release the album in October 2017.

Spread the Word

Financial support is one way to collaborate with us on this project, but it’s not the only way. If you can’t contribute financially, please consider partnering with us by spreading the word.

Share it on Facebook by clicking the Facebook icon at the top of the page. 

Share the link via email.

story:
You Can Take Part in the Release of Our CD

A warm welcome to you from Aniya Jazz!  We’ve come here to announce the release of our new CD, "Colors of the Sun", filled with the unique sounds you’ve come to recognize from Aniya, and coupled with new explorations and the inclusion of some excellent outside talent.  The album will be released on December 14th, but there is a lot of work to be done before we reach that point.

Here's How You Can Help & What You Get

If you’re interested in owning this new collection of music from us, we’re asking you to contribute to this campaign.  By doing so, you will not only be pre-ordering a signed copy of our CD, but you’ll allow us to cover the costs of mixing and mastering.  The signed CD—for a contribution of $25—also comes with a free Aniya Jazz t-shirt and will get your name into the CD credits.

If you’d like to help us out even more with this release, a contribution of $60 will get you both the CD and 2 tickets for our CD release show, which will be held at the World Café in Wilmington, DE.  $75 will get you our soon to be released CD and four of our previously released CDs, and $100 will get you all five CDs plus a Colors of the Sun t-shirt.

As outlined to the right, contributions of $5 will get you a thank you note on our website and contributions of $15, a Colors of the Sun t-shirt.  Any amount is appreciated, so don’t feel like you can’t help us out if you’re unable to order the CD and t-shirt bundle.

See Our Beautifully Designed CD Cover

This Is Going to Be Huge!

We’re very excited about the release of this special CD and its’ assortment of excellent guest musicians.  Al Turner (musical director of Earl Klugh and Kem), James Poyser (Grammy winning producer), and Bill Jolly (three-time Emmy winner who scored music for the contemporary movie The Butler with Oprah Winfrey) are only some of the talents who have agreed to be a part of this album.

As you can see, this CD is an excellent opportunity to showcase Aniya Jazz’s music in larger circles and take our music to new heights.  You can be a very important part of this process.

Can't Contribute? Then Make Some Noise!

Even if you are unable to contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help us get the word out.  Use the share tools below to let others know about our upcoming CD release.  Also, feel free to listen to some of our music at aniyajazz.com.

Thank you in advance for supporting us,

Delbert Boyer and Aniya Jazz

_____________________________________________________________________

Click Here to Contribute $5

Click Here to Contribute $15

Click Here to Contribute $25

Click Here to Contribute $60

Click Here to Contribute $75

Click Here to Contribute $100

This Is Going to Be Huge!

We’re
very excited about the release of this special CD and its’ assortment of
excellent guest musicians.  Al Turner (musical
director of Earl Klugh and Kem), James Poyser (Grammy winning producer), and
Bill Jolly (three-time Emmy winner who scored music for the contemporary movie
The Butler with Oprah Winfrey) are only some of the talents who have agreed to
be a part of this album.
As you can see, this CD is an excellent
opportunity to showcase Aniya Jazz’s music in larger circles and take our music
to new heights.  You can be a very
important part of this process.


Can't Contribute? Then Make Some Noise!

Even
if you are unable to contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help us get the
word out.  Use the share tools below to
let others know about our upcoming CD release. 
Also, feel free to listen to some of our music at aniyajazz.com.
Thank
you in advance for supporting us,
Delbert Boyer and Aniya Jazz

story:
Jake Stemo's First Studio Project "New Perspective"

The Stemo's….

I love this picture because it describes our family well.  

Our vision as a family is to encourage all types of people from all walks of life with the hope that is only found in Jesus.  
If you don't know who I am and you find yourself checking out this project let me introduce myself.  My name is Jake Stemo I am a worship leader and songwriter in Wichita KS.  I grew up in the great state of Wisconsin and started leading worship/writing music when I was in 8th grade.  


      I have been privileged with many opportunities of leading the church into the presence of God.  Though the music style and sounds have change throughout the years God remains constant, always the same,  He never changes.  Our family has gone through many different season in this life.  Great times, hard times and confusing times and through all these different seasons these songs have happened.  
Our Vision as a family for this worship project is to encourage all types of people from all walks of life with the captivating power of music and the life changing message of Jesus. 

 We want people to engage with the music we create and feel like they can worship freely through the different seasons they are going through.  
Would you consider partnering with us to fund this project.  "New Perspective" Will be my first 4 to 5 song studio EP and there are major cost involved in the recording, mixing, producing and mastering of this project.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • $5,000 will help us make this project a reality
  • This will cover studio time for a 4 to 5 song project recording, mixing, musicians, producing and mastering.
  • We have some great perks that you can check out for helping fund this project!
  • We have partnered Reverie Coffee Roasters in Wichita Ks as one of our perks 
  • You can also get an In All Things Love Tshirt
  • If you don't care about the perks feel free to give whatever amount you would like!

The Impact

As a family we want to help others in need each night our kids pray for the boys and girls that have been taken by bad guys and we pray that God would protect them and free them.  We want to help put an end to sex trafficking in the state of Kansas:

  • All profits generated from the sale of this EP will go towards fighting sex trafficking in the state of Kansas.

Risks & Challenges

The money we are asking for this Ep will cover most of the costs but we will still be financially backing this project.

Any money given above our funding goal will go towards manufacturing, marketing, production and a top of the line mastering engineer. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We totally understand that you may not be able to support this project financially but you can still help in great ways.  
    • Share this project on Facebook, twitter, instagram or your blog or with your moms knitting group anyone you would like to share it with

story:
I Need Your Help!

Hey, I’m Steve Meier, a poet and hip hop artist who goes by the name Khan Vikshyn.  I live in Winnipeg, Canada and if you know anything about this place, there are a lot of starving artists and it’s fucking cold.  I’ve been working on my award-winning-critically-acclaimed-magnum-opus for 13 years now and I think it’s time that I give up and just release something!  Many artists die at 27 having led full illustrious careers.  I’m 26 and am hoping to release my debut.  Growing up I got to know a lot of other people’s stories through music and have always wanted to tell my own someday.  I’ve already recorded 2 songs for the album but things are taking too long.  If I don’t have it out before my 28th birthday in just over a year there will be absolutely no way for me to get into Club 27 if I die before then.  This is why I need your help.

To cover the costs of recording, mixing, mastering, manufacturing and mailing the album out to college radio stations across Canada before I go on tour in the Fall, I’m trying my hardest to raise $1,500.  I’m turning to my strongest supporters, you, whether you’re family, a friend, someone I grew up with, or even an obsessed fan that I never knew I had.  I’m even turning to my biggest non-supporters, or haters.  I mean, wouldn’t it be funny if I had an album out, wouldn’t that be a joke?  I appreciate anything you can donate, please help me achieve my childhood dream.  Even if you can just donate a buck it will really help and in exchange for your contribution I’m offering some perks or benefits.  They include a download of the album, a copy of the CD, a T-shirt and I’ll even write a song with your input.  If there’s anything else that you’d be interested in seeing as a perk just let me know.  Your contribution will really help me create something special and help me achieve my delusional dream of being the best rapper alive.  But really, thanks!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my campaign with your friends, family and whoever else you think might be interested.  I really appreciate all the help and support.

Preview Songs

Low Funds Is No Fun - https://soundcloud.com/khanvikshyn/low-funds-is-no-fun

What Happened - https://soundcloud.com/khanvikshyn/what-happened

story:
Short Summary

Hi,

I'm Jenny Reynolds, a singer-songwriter in Austin, TX. Once a year I produce a show called "Williams Nite: A Tribute to Hank & Lucinda Williams." Austin-based musicians play one song from each Williams plus one of their own. The proceeds from the show go to The SIMS Foundation, an organization that provides mental health and substance use recovery services for musicians and their families in the Austin music community.

Why the Indiegogo Campaign?

Artists need to be paid something for their work. Your donation helps cover the shows expenses and starts the virtual tip jar. The tip jar pays the artists.

What We Need & What You Get

Small donations of $2, $5 or $10 are great! They get things started. If you can't come to the show but would have put something in the  tip jar if you could have been there, a small donation is great!

A donation of $20 will get you an unsigned concert poster designed by Emily Shirley. The poster is 12 x 18 and lists the details of the event, including date, venue name and artists. Quantities are limited.

A donation of $50 will get you the poster described above signed by all artists. Quantities are limited.

Where Does the Money Go?

Proceeds from the $10 cover charge go to The SIMS Foundation. The cover charge does not compensate the artists. This campaign starts the tip jar that covers a few expenses and pays the artists.When we are healthy, we can make more music.

What Are the Expenses?

Our expenses are minimal, thanks to community support.  Specifically, we have to pay for the venue (including the sound guy) and PR costs. Both have been reduced thanks, again, to the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Come to the show! Bring friends!
  • Buy merchandise from the artists.
  • Tell friends about Williams Nite!
  • Tell friends about The SIMS Foundation!

Thank you!

Jenny Reynolds

story:
About Jamie Jarone:

Hello, my name is Jamie Jarone. I am Christian singer/ songwriter/musician. 

Music has always been a part of my life. I have been singing since the age of 7 and ever since have had a love for it. At the age of 13, I started to gain a real passion for music.  At the age of 15, I started making a career out of it. At the age of 15, I released my first single, "Very Merry Christmas" on ITunes.  Ever since, I have been striving to make singing a  part of my everyday life.  Music is not only music to me. Music is a way of life. I feel that music is so moving and inspiring. 


Recently,

                                         I have started Christian Music . I feel that God is taking me in a different direction. To use my gift not only for the passion and love of singing and Entertainment, but for God's love of people. I believe in God's message and I want to share it. Christian music has been a big part in my life.  The first time I felt God's calling for Christian music was at the Newsboys concert. It was so inspiring and made me look at Christian Music in a whole different way.  Ever since I have been on a personal journey of determining my purpose in music and how I can contribute. I feel like I have found a good start. I still am growing and being inspired each and every day. 


My Objective,

                                                            My Objective is to create music that can relate to everyone. I want to make sure that my music is real, original and passionate. I want to make sure that my music always comes full circle  back to God. I feel that this music can do just that. Relating to the happy, sad, confusing, Lonely, as joyful times .  I honestly hope that my music can minister to the hearts of everyday individuals. I want people to be able to hear my song and say "Wow. What song is that?" Just a song that can catch someone's attention and while doing that sharing a good message.


Why Overcome?

Everyone in their life has to overcome something. I want my music to be the helpful companion in someone's journey with God.  But there is a deeper meaning for the EP. 


When I was in 7th grade someone thing happened tremendously in my life. I was majorly bullied. It wasn't the everyday picking and teasing. It became a way of life. People mocked me for my weight, people physically harassed me and tripped me in the hallways. It was a very hard time. I wasn't able to go a day without someone taunting me about "how ugly I was" or how "fat I was" .  I wasn't able to live a normal healthy life. 

I struggled with my weight in middle school. It was hard for me to take the comments about my physical appearance because I myself questioned my body all of the time. Going to school made it 100% harder. 

I was bullied up until 9th grade. It was extremely intense towards 9the grade. The accusations became not only taunts but threats.  The bullying didn't end there, it traveled online and out of school. 

But throughout all of the tears I pulled through. I didn't do it alone though. God gave me the strength and the self determination to realize what they were saying wasn't true. Through Jesus  Christ all things are possible. I felt God's love with me everyday. For every mean or cruel thing said, God replaced that with love in my heart. And for that, I am very truly thankful. 

I want to share this message and testimony to others. It truly was a miracle of God and I am not happy for going through the things that I have, but I am happy that I could make it through them so I can share the message with others. 

I want my EP to be an inspiration for others to know that there is a way out of hard times. With God, you have the strength to do everything.  


Revelation 21:7 He that overcometh shall inherit all things; and I will be his God, and he shall be my son.


By helping to fund my project you can not only help my passion for music, but help contribute to the message that I am trying to give. I would like  others to feel like they can be apart of a bigger purpose.  By funding this project you will be helping develop music that will show others that  you can OVERCOME.

Thank you for contributing your time to reading my project. It means  so much to me. I hope that together we can make this EP happen.  


God Bless,

Jamie

God Bless,
Jamie

story:
Who am I supporting?

My name is Maria-Hélèna. 

I've been a singer all my life.

As a child I would sing in the shower and make up songs, perform shows for my family, and sing in the school choir. As a teenager, I would stay after school to rehearse songs in the stairwells, sing in more choirs, and pretend I could write songs. I've performed in musical theatre and other collective projects where I've interpreted music by other composers.

But something inside me has been wanting to write songs for a long time, and I've finally unlocked this door. 

Want to hear some of the work? Here are some scratch recordings I've been collecting on my soundcloud page:

https://soundcloud.com/mariahelenapacelli

Please listen and share!

The project: Spring in New Brunswick

In 2014 I visited New Brunswick for work, and began to feel that the land was speaking to me. I completely fell in love with the idea of being near the ocean and in the land - I spent so much time driving that I ran out of things to do. In  fact, after a while there wasn't much else to do but sing songs about the sights I was seeing.

I wrote some songs about the land, about the ocean, and other things started coming to me. 

This year I went back to New Brunswick and thought I would write more songs. But what I discovered was that it was time to put the collection together and make it into a compilation.

Why now?

Life is fleeting.

So many of my life experiences surrounding death, mortality, transition and change have highlighted this for me over the past few years. When you think you are running out of time to do the things that really matter, it becomes quickly apparent what those are. 

The lesson did not escape me:  DO IT NOW!

That's why I've been working on this campaign. I'm lucky - I have been able to figure out that my life would not be complete without pursuing my musical aspirations - but I need some help to get this project together to make my dream come true.

Will you help me?

What I'm asking for help with

Making an album can be expensive. That's where you come in!

This campaign will fund:

  • Musician honorariums for their time, dedication, and expertise (this includes rehearsal and recording time)
  • Studio recording time, and mixing for all tracks
  • Mastering all tracks for professional quality sound
  • Professional design of the album cover and insert
  • Printing and production of 500 copies of the album for distribution
  • If the goal is not reached, I will still produce the album... though it may take longer, so the funds raised will help me get there sooner! Thanks!
  • If anything is left over, I will put the extra funds towards future projects. Please contribute generously!

What's in it for you

While the expression of my gratitude may never be sufficient towards you for supporting this project, know that every donation made to this campaign is also part of the bigger picture of supporting artists and musicians give from their most authentic place and show that music matters!

Each perk includes something for you to keep in exchange for your generosity - either a physical or digital copy of the album (or both) as well as other things like house concerts, tickets to my launch party, an invitation to a recording session, and other surprises!

Supporting local and independent musicians is important to ensure that good quality and authentic music continues to be created and that these traditions don't get squished under the machine of the commercial music industry.

Stories the land will tell

This project is a prayer for the land that holds and nourishes us everyday, and it is important not only as my own pursuit for what I believe I was made to do, but it is also my way of honouring the land and all the stories it has to tell. As I was writing these songs, each of them came to me from a very deep connection with the land. This is my way of giving back!

But what if....

I'll admit it, I worried that my campaign wouldn't be funded, that if I launched it and it didn't work out I'd have to swallow my pride and find another vocation, that the costs might be more than I anticipated or that something would go wrong with the recording process.

I want you to know that I've thought about what could go wrong - and if you know me well you know that I like to think about that from every angle possible before going forward with a project.

So if you're seeing this campaign today it's because I've thought about it for months as I designed it and felt that the risk was not only worthwhile, but that this is something I couldn't NOT do. It's worth it because I'm taking a shot at a dream, and because I know that I can find solutions to overcome any obstacles along the way.

Trust me when I say that if you're contributing to this campaign I want to see it happen as much as you do so that I can deliver a product I'm proud to put my name on and share with you :)

What else can I do?

Some people aren't able to contribute with donations, but that doesn't mean you can't support this project!

Here are some ways you can help me out:

  • Share this campaign link with friends on facebook, twitter, by email... and encourage music-lovers you know to support me!
  • Like and comment on my posts about this fundraising campaign to get the buzz going
  • Join my facebook event, comment, post and invite friends: https://www.facebook.com/events/534144180068469/
  • Let me know about opportunities to promote this campaign
  • Visit and share my website www.mariahelenapacelli.com
  • Follow and share my facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/mariahelenapatchouli

If anything is left over, I will put the extra funds towards future projects. Please contribute generously!    
What's in it for you
While the expression of my gratitude may never be sufficient towards you for supporting this project, know that every donation made to this campaign is also part of the bigger picture of supporting artists and musicians give from their most authentic place and show that music matters!
Each perk includes something for you to keep in exchange for your generosity - either a physical or digital copy of the album (or both) as well as other things like house concerts, tickets to my launch party, an invitation to a recording session, and other surprises!Supporting local and independent musicians is important to ensure that good quality and authentic music continues to be created and that these traditions don't get squished under the machine of the commercial music industry.
Stories the land will tellThis project is a prayer for the land that holds and nourishes us everyday, and it is important not only as my own pursuit for what I believe I was made to do, but it is also my way of honouring the land and all the stories it has to tell. As I was writing these songs, each of them came to me from a very deep connection with the land. This is my way of giving back!   But what if.... I'll admit it, I worried that my campaign wouldn't be funded, that if I launched it and it didn't work out I'd have to swallow my pride and find another vocation, that the costs might be more than I anticipated or that something would go wrong with the recording process.I want you to know that I've thought about what could go wrong - and if you know me well you know that I like to think about that from every angle possible before going forward with a project.So if you're seeing this campaign today it's because I've thought about it for months as I designed it and felt that the risk was not only worthwhile, but that this is something I couldn't NOT do. It's worth it because I'm taking a shot at a dream, and because I know that I can find solutions to overcome any obstacles along the way.Trust me when I say that if you're contributing to this campaign I want to see it happen as much as you do so that I can deliver a product I'm proud to put my name on and share with you :)    What else can I do? Some people aren't able to contribute with donations, but that doesn't mean you can't support this project!Here are some ways you can help me out:  Share this campaign link with friends on facebook, twitter, by email... and encourage music-lovers you know to support me! Like and comment on my posts about this fundraising campaign to get the buzz going
Join my facebook event, comment, post and invite friends: https://www.facebook.com/events/534144180068469/

Let me know about opportunities to promote this campaign
Visit and share my website www.mariahelenapacelli.com

Follow and share my facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/mariahelenapatchouli

story:
Christian Eason 

I am 20 years old, and am currently working in the Music Industry, building up my name. I lived in Philadelphia until just a few months ago, when I relocated to the Atlanta area to pursue my career as a recording artist. 

I started developing as a singer after taking professional lessons at the age of ten, while also studying piano. In high school I performed in the Philadelphia All City Choir and performed for President Barack Obama, as well as been on stages with Paul Simon, Usher, Lawrence Brownlee, Terrance Howard, Renee Fleming, and James Earl Jones. 

I have now been given the opportunity to take my singing career to a new level. Through this process and the connections I've made, I've begun working with producers Khari Simmons and Daz-I-Kue, who are interested in helping me produce some my music and take it to the next level. Khari Simmons and Daz-I-Kue had produced for artists such as India Arie, Anthony David, Whitney Houston, The Roots, John Legend, Sam Smith, and various UK Artists. I am set up to record an EP of three songs, which myself, my manager, and my producers consider to be hits. After I am finished recording, my producers plan to traffic my EP to independent record labels. With the contacts I have, and my produced hit songs, myself and my team are pretty confident that someone will offer me a recording artist contract. 

Unfortunately, this process is not as easy as I make it sound. In order to rent studio time, pay my two producers, as well as the musicians who will play on my songs, I need to raise five thousand dollars. 

To those who donate $500 or more will get a special thanks on my first produced album. Those who donate $200 or more will be the first to receive my produced EP, and those who donate $100 will get a special t-shirt. Also those who would like to donate $2000 or more, I will host any event doing what I do best for you. 

Please share with anyone you think would like to help Support!!

Thank you FOLKS!

story:
Send me to the Sibelius Academy!

I'm a current student at the SCCC School of Music in upstate New York. It has been a longtime dream of mine to attend music school in Europe - more specifically, the prestigious Sibelius Academy in Helsinki, Finland.

In order to attend this school, I must attend entrance examinations there - in person - in May of 2015. Entrance exams last for close to a week, so this won't be a quick two or three day trip - it will likely last for seven or eight days before I can return to the states. Because of this, I am asking you for help in getting there so I can focus my total energy on blowing these examinations out of the water! 

My academic goals are not only my area of specialization (vocal performance), but I also seek to study Finnish sacred and folk music - a little-studied but amazing body of music! I hope to help bring Finnish music to as many shores as possible, for Finland has boasted a number of amazing composers that are well worth hearing. It is something of a specialization of mine in performing little-known pieces, and I would like to continue this trend. 

If I should get into the Academy, I must not only apply for a residence permit and travel back to Finland, I must also be able to show that I have enough money to support myself without help from the Finnish government to be awarded a residence permit to begin my studies. While I expect to have some scholarship backup, every little bit will be enormously helpful! If I do not achieve my entire financial goal, whatever I do earn will be put towards at least attending the entrance examinations, which will still allow me a bit more time and energy towards finding alternative funding sources for the start of the 2015 academic year. 

If you can contribute even just a few dollars to helping me achieve my dream, you will not only be assisting an artist of color in finally obtaining her degree in classical vocal performance, but you will be sending what will very likely be the first African-American student to the Sibelius Academy next year!

story:
Hello

Hussein Rassim made a decision to leave his home to find safety in Europe. His desperate journey took him from Baghdad, through the Balkans and finally to Belgium.

He left behind friends and family. He also left behind his beloved musical instrument, his lute.

If we can get Hussein making music again he would have a much greater chance to make a living in Belgium. It would also give him the comfort and joy music can bring to the solitary exile of life as a refugee.

We've found the lute! Now we just need the funds. Please help us to raise EUR 2000 in the next 30 days to get the lute and add some sunshine and music to Hussein's life and everyone around him!

Thanks!

Brian, Irem, Maeve & Maria

story:
Thanks for checking out our campaign. My name is Jim Donovan. I’m a musician, educator and a former founding member of the band Rusted Root (Send Me On My Way). 

Over the past 28 years as a performer, I've learned that it is possible to have a great time AND do a lot of good. Successful artists, for better or worse, attract the attention of masses of people. This is a unique position where one can communicate important messages and mobilize people to take action. The Sun King Warriors regularly do both.

Below you will learn about:

  • Who we are and why we are doing this campaign
  • Our message and mission
  • Who we actively support
  • What's in it for you
  • What we need
  • The impact of your support
  • Other ways you can help

We're pleased to announce that after 12 months in the studio, the band – Kevin McDonald, Kent Tonkin, Bryan Fazio, Joe Marini, Dan Murphy, Harry Pepper and I are ready to unleash our new album "We See Through It".

 

You Are My Everything.. Living Room Live Stream
 

If you are crazy for music with a message of truth wrapped in the big vintage rock sounds of Led Zeppelin, the emotion and melody stylings of Mumford & Sons, soaring harmonies and tons of barreling tribal drums – then this might be your new favorite album. In addition to the band, we've got a whole crew of great friends and family who contributed to this disc including my children Tupelo, Ella and Oliver and my former Rusted Root band mates Jenn Wertz and Liz Berlin.

 

Isn't it beautiful?

 

This preorder campaign helps us to earn funds to market and release the album to the world via radio, publicity and social media. You can support us by ordering autographed merchandise, getting tickets to our big Pittsburgh release party, bringing us over to your house for an acoustic house party, becoming an angel or any of the other sweet perks to your right.

 

Music with a Message 

"We See Through it" celebrates the truth and all those who hold themselves to the highest standards. The music is dedicated to all who work every day to become better people... who refuse to be separated from their neighbors and families due to differing beliefs.. and who lend a hand to those in need.

The songs are an invitation to consider the idea that you and I are not separate. That our words, thoughts and actions have a real effect on the people around us... and that together we can do a lot of good.

The Sun King Warriors recognize that the connective power of music is a powerful point of commonality between people. Though our society is experiencing division, we know there is still common ground in music. Our aim to to provide a soundtrack that brings people together.

When you choose to back our project, you support a vision that stretches beyond selling CD's and t-shirts. You see, as a former member of a band who had modest success, I've already experienced and understand the illusion of fame and its trappings. But more importantly, I've also seen the incredible capacity for service that is possible when we use our success to help others.

"We See Through It"-Group Vocal Recording Session Jan. 2018

 

Music with a Mission

The mission of the Sun King Warriors is to harness the energy and attention generated by our music and direct it toward organizations who are helping to raise consciousness and who provide service to the greater good.

We do this by: 

  • Providing unforgettable live music experiences & recordings that people want to be a part of
  • Connecting people throughout our systems and encouraging interaction and action around local causes
  • Mobilizing fans to take specific action such as bringing food for local food pantries to our shows
  • Educating people about alternative ways to use music for anxiety reduction, social connection and self expression
  • Utilizing media via radio & news interviews to spread the word about our mission

 

Action So Far

Since 2015, The Sun King Warriors have partnered with several organizations and played benefits to serve those in need including:

  • The Healing Patch- An organization committed to providing mentoring and programming for children who are grieving the loss of a parent.
  • Band Together Pittsburgh- A non-profit who provides music based educational programming for people with Autism.
  • Greater Pittsburgh Food Bank- Serving hungry families and children throughout the Pittsburgh region.
  • Beginnings Inc.- A non-profit dedicated to providing Early Intervention Services to “at-risk” children.
  • Sage's Army who actively battles the scourge of heroin addiction in our local communities, and recovery centers like Maryland Recovery who do great work helping people heal from addiction
  • The Mankind Project and the Hero's Journey Foundation who help to build emotionally mature, accountable and compassionate male role models that our communities need
The Last Dance-Live Stream from Red Medicine Studios

 

What We Need

Traditionally, getting a new album into the hands of people who might love it required signing the rights and ownership of your music to a record company. Having experienced this first hand, I can tell you that the feeling of signing away the rights to meaningful personal creations is not good.

Sometimes, (like .001% of the time), a musician can earn money from the sales of their music... that is if you have a hit, What's much more common is that a record company fronts you money (an advance) and then charges you back for the cost of making the record.

More often than not, your sales don't even cover this advance and you're left in perpetual debt to the record company. This is because they pay you a royalty rate that equals roughly $1.32 per CD sold. In my old band, we divided that by 7, minus 20% commissions to our management, minus taxes... you get the idea.

That's not happening on this record.

This is an completely independent and self-financed project. Hundreds of hours and tens of thousands of dollars of gig and personal money has already been invested into this recording. When it comes to making music, we do it right and we don't cut corners. We've got serious skin in the game and believe in the music and the message. Our mode of operation is to enter these works of art without fear. 

Now that we have what we feel is a magnificent work of art, we come directly to people like you and just lay out what we need with complete transparency. We do this so you can actually see what goes into making high quality music and how you can be a key part of spreading our music and message worldwide.

"We Have Arrived"-Live at Stage AE, Pittsburgh, PA

 

Below You Will See Two Infographics...

The first is stretch budget that shows how much we need to do specific things that will help "We See Through It" reach an even wider audience. Examples include: professional video creation, pressing vinyl, and a professional fan acquisition campaign on Facebook.

The second infographic shows a our original barebones budget that we met February 12, 2018.

 

Infographic 1: Our Stretch Goals

 

 

Here's our original "Bare Bones" budget covering the minimum essentials of running an 3 month album launch campaign.  We met this on Feb. 12, 2018 thanks to fine people like you.

 

What You Get

Our official release date for the album will be in May 2018. As a supporter of the campaign, you will get first access to the music at least one month before anyone else. Just for you, we’ve created an exciting collection of exclusive perks to select from...

  • Digital download of the album 
  • Signed copies of "We See Through it" on CD 
  • Acoustic House concerts with the Sun King Warriors 
  • Boxes of signed CDs you can use to pass out to your friends
  • Drumming party with Jim Donovan @ your house
  • VIP Album Release Tickets (SOLD OUT)
  • General Admission Album Release Tickets (On sale and selling briskly)
  • Plus many others...

Check out the great list of perks and choose the ones you want before they are gone. All merchandise will be delivered by April 15, 2018 or sooner. Premium perks that involve a program or live interaction will be scheduled on a first come/first serve basis at a mutually agreeable time.

 

The Impact

The songs on "We See Through It" are an invitation to consider the idea that you and I are not separate. That our words, thoughts and actions have a real effect on the people around us... And that together we can do a lot of good.

  • If this message resonates with you and feels important to share....
  • If you believe that music can give us a chance to bridge our divides...
  • If you would like to have an album that sounds good cranking at full volume in your sweet ride...

Then consider helping us earn funds to get the music into the hands, ears and hearts of people who will love it. You can do that right now by ordering one or more of the perks to your right. Be sure to check them all, there are a few surprises in there.

Risks & Challenges

In 2015, I used Indiegogo for my first album titled 'Sun King Warriors". The incredible support offered by people like you helped me to secure wide radio play throughout North America where the music landed for several months on Billboard’s Americana chart. The song Olalala reached #1 on two stations for multiple weeks, landed at Top 5 on 13 stations and Top 20 on 22 stations. The last campaign also helped us land national press in publications such as Relix Magazine and the Washington Times. In sum,  grassroots support of people like you gave the band the boost it needed to get off the ground and begin playing regionally throughout the Mid-Atlantic region.

I've been releasing and promoting music since 1990. Our experience and track record gives us complete confidence that we will deliver any and every perk you invest in. Our reputation is our most valuable asset and we would do nothing to taint it. The album is at the duplication plant as we speak. We anticipate delivery of many boxes of CDs to Jims house by early April 2018. Our plan is to get them out to you by April 15, 2018 or sooner.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if contributing financially isn't for you, there are other important ways you can pitch in and be an important part of the Sun King Warriors' "We See Through It" launch.

Simply use the Indiegogo share tools and let your friends on social media know what we're up to. Especially consider telling your friends about our mission and message. The more people who know about and imagine this project coming to life, the more likely that it will happen.

 

Let's Do This

Bringing a meaningful vision to life requires the focus, energy and love of many people like you. By pre-ordering any of the perks for the campaign you become a key part of helping us share the music, message and mission to the world.
 

As a supporter you can expect regular updates to let you know how we're doing. We've only got 31 days to meet our goal and so thank you in advance for your support. 

Let's do this!

Jim Donovan & Sun King Warriors

Put this elephant in your room. :)
